{'uri': '8230454195', 'lang': 'ell', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:49:20', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:49:20Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:48:32Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.liberal.gr/xena-hrimatistiria/wall-street-i-ptosi-ton-big-tech-odigei-se-boytia-sp-500-kai-nasdaq', 'title': 'Wall Street: Η πτώση των Big Tech οδηγεί σε "βουτιά" S&P 500 και Nasdaq', 'body': 'Σημαντική υποχώρηση καταγράφουν την Τετάρτη οι δείκτες S&P 500 και Nasdaq, στο χρηματιστήριο της Νέας Υόρκης καθώς συνεχίζεται η στροφή των επενδυτών από τις μετοχές τεχνολογίας υψηλής κεφαλαιοποίησης προς αυτές της μικρής κεφαλαιοποίησης.\n\nΟ βιομηχανικός δείκτης Dow Jones κινείται ανοδικά κατά 0,51% στις 41.163,47 μονάδες. Ο ευρύτερος δείκτης S&P 500 σημειώνει απώλειες 1,33%, στις 5.591,44 μονάδες και ο τεχνολογικός Nasdaq βρίσκεται, προς το παρόν σε βύθιση 2,74% στις 18.000,39 μονάδες.\n\nΗ άνοδος του Dow Jones οφείλεται κατά κύριο λόγο στην άνοδο άνω του 3% της UnitedHealth μετά την αναβάθμιση της λόγω της ισχυρής κερδοφορίας της. Αντίθετα, από τις τεχνολογικές μετοχές η Meta καταγράφει πτώση 4%, ενώ η Apple, η Netflix και η Microsoft σημειώνουν απώλειες άνω του 1%.\n\nΣύμφωνα με τους αναλυτές της αγοράς, αυτό είναι ένα δείγμα ότι οι επενδυτές αποσύρονται από τις τεχνολογικές εταιρείες υψηλής κεφαλαιοποίησης μετά την έντονα ανοδική πορεία τους, φέτος, που οφειλόταν στο ενδιαφέρον για την Τεχνητή Νοημοσύνη.\n\nΟι μετοχές των ημιαγωγών δέχθηκαν σημαντικές πιέσεις μετά από δημοσίευμα του Bloomberg News ότι η κυβέρνηση Μπάιντεν εξετάζει το ενδεχόμενο αυστηρότερων εμπορικών περιορισμών εάν οι εταιρείες συνεχίσουν να παρέχουν στην Κίνα πρόσβαση σε αμερικανική τεχνολογία. Παράλληλα σημαντικές για την πτώση των τιμών των μετοχών του κλάδου ήταν και οι δηλώσεις του Ντόναλντ Τραμπ σχετικά με την περαιτέρω αυστηροποίηση των περιορισμών στις εξαγωγές από τις ΗΠΑ προς την Ταϊβάν υλικού και μέσων παραγωγής μικροτσίπ.\n\nΗ μετοχή της VanEck Semiconductor ETF υποχωρεί περίπου 5% μετά την αναφορά αυτή. Παράλληλα η Nvidia χάνει 5,5% και η Taiwan Semiconductor κατέγραψε απώλειες 2%.\n\nΟ Russell 2000 υποχωρεί κατά 0,5%, θέτοντας σε κίνδυνο το πενθήμερο ανοδικό σερί του. Παρόλα αυτά, ο δείκτης που επικεντρώνεται στη μικρή κεφαλαιοποίηση έχει σημειώσει άνοδο σχεδόν 11% τις τελευταίες πέντε ημέρες διαπραγμάτευσης, καθώς το ράλι της αγοράς διευρύνθηκε.\n\nΕν τω μεταξύ, ο Nasdaq έχει χάσει περισσότερο από 1% την ίδια περίοδο, με τους επενδυτές να αποκομίζουν κέρδη από ονόματα τεχνολογίας που έχουν σημειώσει μεγάλες αποδόσεις φέτος.\n\nΑυτή η εναλλαγή συμβαίνει καθώς οι traders έχουν γίνει πιο αισιόδοξοι σχετικά με τις μειώσεις των επιτοκίων, οι οποίες θα ωφελήσουν τις μετοχές μικρής κεφαλαιοποιίησης και τις εταιρείες με υψηλότερο κόστος χρηματοδότησης. Τα προθεσμιακά συμβόλαια Fed funds ανεβάζουν στο 100% την πιθανότητα η Ομοσπονδιακή Κεντρική Τράπεζα των ΗΠΑ να μειώσει τα επιτόκια τον Σεπτέμβριο, σύμφωνα με το εργαλείο FedWatch της CME.\n\n"Οι επενδυτές, στην πράξη, απλώς πωλούν κάποιες από τις μετοχές υψηλής κεφαλαιοποίησης, παίρνοντας κάποια κέρδη, και, ταυτόχρονα αγοράζουν κάποιες από αυτές τις πιο "κυκλικές" εταιρείες", δήλωσε ο Mike Dickson, επικεφαλής Έρευνας και Στρατηγικής στην Horizon Investments. La Policía sostiene que una de las fallecidas envenenó al resto y se suicidó después.\n\nEn una rueda de prensa en la facultad de Medicina de la Universidad de Chulalornkong, las autoridades señalaron que las pruebas revelan que los seis fallecidos perecieron por envenenamiento y el análisis toxicológico de las muestras sanguíneas resultó positivo en cianuro.\n\nTe recomendamos: Detienen en Francia a neonazi que planeaba acciones violentas durante los Juegos Olímpicos\n\nLos médicos también analizan si los cadáveres fueron envenenados con otras sustancias, pero habrá que esperar al viernes cuando se prevé que se conozca el informe completo de los exámenes, al tiempo que señalaron que no detectaron signos de violencia.\n\nEste martes 16 de julio, los seis cadáveres, tres hombres y tres mujeres, fueron encontrados por el personal de limpieza en la habitación 502 del lujoso y céntrico hotel Grand Hyatt Erawan, donde había platos de comida intactos y tazas de té vacías.\n\nEl doctor Kornkiat Vongpaisarnsin, del Departamento de Medicina Forense de la citada universidad, declaró que labios y las uñas de las víctimas se habían vuelto de color púrpura oscuro, lo que indica falta de oxígeno, mientras que sus órganos internos tenían un rojo intenso, lo que es otro signo de envenenamiento por cianuro.\n\nPreviamente, la Policía afirmó que encontraron restos de cianuro en copas y vasos junto a las seis víctimas, cuatro vietnamitas y dos estadounidenses de origen vietnamita.\n\nSegún las pesquisas preliminares, los agentes sospechan que una de las personas fallecidas envenenó al resto con cianuro y luego se suicidó con el veneno a causa de problemas financieros.\n\nLa principal sospechosa es una estadounidense de origen vietnamita identificada como Chong Sherine, de 56 años, mientras que el resto de fallecidos tenía entre 55 y 37 años.\n\nSherine pidió alrededor del mediodía del lunes al servicio de habitaciones platos de comida y té, que se encargó de preparar ella misma, antes de la llegada del resto de personas, según el relato del personal del hotel recogido por los investigadores.\n\nLos cadáveres fueron encontrados al día siguiente cuando el personal de limpieza acudió a la habitación, después de que los huéspedes, que habían reservado varias habitaciones, no completaran el registro de salida.\n\nNo olvides seguirnos en Google Noticias para mantenerte informado\n\nLos agentes creen que las víctimas, que tenían las maletas preparadas para abandonar el hotel, llevaban muertas unas 24 horas, e investigan cómo la principal sospechosa pudo acceder a esta sustancia "altamente mortal" incolora, inodora y sin sabor.\n\nHay una séptima persona que viajaba con las víctimas -la hermana menor de una de ellas-, pero los investigadores afirman que abandonó el país el pasado 10 de julio.\n\nEl primer ministro de Tailandia, Srettha Thavisin, quien acudió en persona al lugar del supuesto crimen, anunció que el FBI participará en la investigación del suceso, al haber dos víctimas estadounidenses.\n\nEn declaraciones a la prensa, Srettha reiteró que las investigaciones preliminares indican que el móvil del supuesto crimen es un asunto personal y descartó que sea un caso que ponga en riesgo a la seguridad pública.\n\nEl hotel Grand Hyatt Erawan, de cinco estrellas y con más de 300 habitaciones, se encuentra en una popular intersección de Bangkok junto al famoso altar de Erawan y de centros comerciales como Central World.', 'source': {'uri': 'la-prensa.com.mx', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'La Prensa'}, 'authors': [], {'uri': '8230451265', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:47:04', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:47:04Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:46:37Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.forbes.com/sites/cmo/2024/07/17/how-gen-alpha-views-the-world/', 'title': 'How Gen Alpha Views The World', 'body': 'This is the published version of Forbes\' CMO newsletter, which offers the latest news for chief marketing officers and other messaging-focused leaders. Click here to get it delivered to your inbox every Wednesday.\n\nGoogle has been vilified recently for changes it\'s made to its algorithm, search results and the not-always-accurate generative AI Gemini search assistant. It seems like Google went from being the search engine of choice for a superior method of ranking results to being the search engine everyone is used to, but that cannot perform well.\n\nNew data from SEO and digital marketing consultant BrightEdge shows that isn\'t quite the truth. Google still dominates search, driving about 92% of organic traffic to brands. It doesn\'t seem that any other site is coming close to stealing that dominance away. And Google has reformed, BrightEdge found, with almost no AI Overview information coming from user-generated content last month -- so no more suggestions to put glue in pizza sauce to keep cheese from sliding off.\n\nBut while Google still rules online search, BrightEdge was able to quantify just how lucrative it is. Each percentage point of organic search market share is worth about $1.2 billion, they found -- meaning even small shifts in favored engines are extremely valuable. AI-powered Perplexity appears to be the biggest up-and-coming threat at the moment, with usage growing 31% month-over-month. There aren\'t many referrals coming from LLMs at the moment -- though that could definitely change, BrightEdge says in the report.\n\n"AI is in a constant state of progress, so the most important thing marketers can do now is leverage the precision of insights to monitor, prepare for changes, and adapt accordingly," said founder and executive chairman Jim Yu.\n\nAI search isn\'t the only up-and-coming aspect marketers are paying close attention to nowadays. While state and federal regulations don\'t allow much direct marketing to young children, the preferences and behaviors of Generation Alpha -- those born between 2010 and today -- will directly shape marketing in the future. Forbes HBCU scholar intern Tavon Thomasson and I talked to Razorfish President Dani Mariano about the agency\'s recent research on Generation Alpha. An excerpt from our conversation is later in this newsletter.\n\nAmericans are looking away from screens a lot more these days, a new study from Attest found. Forbes senior contributor Toni Fitzgerald writes that just 61% of people watch three or more hours of TV a day. While that\'s still a sizable amount, it\'s down 3% in 2024 alone. And nearly a quarter of people watch no live TV at all. But it\'s not just TV that\'s seeing fewer viewers. Fewer people report being heavy users of social media, with only 41% saying they use it two hours or more a day. Again, that\'s still a lot of people, but 4% less than last year.\n\nAttest founder and CEO Jeremy King chalks these shifts up to a few things. Millennials are getting to the point in life in which they have more responsibilities, both in their careers and with families, that they may have less time to spend with screens. There may also be concerted efforts to spend less money on cable or streaming services. But it also could be the manifestation of a wider "slow living" trend, in which Americans are trying to be more mindful.\n\nBut even though more TVs are getting turned off, it\'s still the most attention-grabbing way to advertise out there. Brand-new statistics from Omicron Media Group and Yahoo, through a partnership with Amplified Intelligence, found that CTV ads grabbed the most viewer attention -- 9.7 seconds worth, which is eight times more than mobile, and 16 times more than on desktop. However, CTV ads are best for brand awareness -- people who see an ad on a mobile device are twice as likely to purchase something as those exposed to an ad on a computer or CTV.\n\nWhen it rains, it pours. Burberry, the luxury British brand best known for its distinctive trench coat, is the latest to issue a profit warning, seeking revenues down 20% overall, and comp store sales down 21% year-over-year. In its trading update posted earlier this week, Burberry put it succinctly: "Our Q1 FY25 performance is disappointing." The brand has been struggling to redefine itself as high inflation is straining the luxury market as a whole and its trademark check pattern started to feel less exclusive, Forbes contributor Mark Faithfull wrote last week. Big changes have been made at the fashion house. With this week\'s profit warning, Burberry announced the immediate hire and start of its new CEO, Joshua Schulman. He\'s familiar to the luxury market, formerly serving as CEO of Coach, Michael Kors and Jimmy Choo. He\'s also held positions at Neiman Marcus Group, Bergdorf Goodman, Yves Saint Laurent and Gucci, Faithfull writes. Burberry may also be considering layoffs, Faithfull wrote last week. Late last month, the company announced internally it is restructuring, and hundreds of jobs could be cut.\n\nThe NBA reached an 11-season $76 billion rights deal for broadcasting its games. Under the terms of the deal, NBC and Amazon are the main partners, with broadcasts spread between traditional television and streaming platforms. Regular season games would be televised nearly every day under this deal, with NBC and its Peacock streaming network on Mondays and Tuesdays, and Amazon Prime streaming games on Friday nights and Saturdays. Amazon will stream the In-Season Tournament, conference finals will be alternated between NBC and Amazon, and ESPN will air a conference final and the NBA Finals.\n\nWhile this agreement brings the NBA more solidly into the streaming era, longtime basketball partner TNT is conspicuously absent. TNT, which has broadcast NBA games for 34 years, could still get a piece of the broadcast action if it can match the deal.\n\nThe streaming portion of the deal could be incredibly lucrative. Amazon, which streams Thursday night NFL games, was able to capture a younger audience than Sunday TV broadcasts for the league last year -- the median age was 48.5 years old on streaming versus 55.4 years old, according to ESPN. Twelve of the 16 games it broadcast had an average of more than 10 million viewers, twice as many as in 2022.\n\nThe next generation of consumers -- those born since 2010 and known as Gen Alpha -- are still in the younger part of childhood. However, the way they look at the world is vastly different than those who have come before. Marketing agency Razorfish recently published their most recent wave of research on Gen Alpha. Forbes HBCU scholar intern Tavon Thomasson and I talked to Razorfish President Dani Mariano about their findings and how they will impact marketing. This conversation has been edited for length, clarity and continuity. A longer version of this conversation is available here.\n\nYou said that there are a lot of differences between Gen Z and Gen Alpha. What are some of the biggest ones?\n\nMariano: In our first wave [of research on Gen Alpha], we saw that they\'re more Gen Z than Gen Z. They have a voice, they\'re very discerning and they\'re going to use their voice very loudly to drive the change that they want to see. I think we\'ll see that continue. We also know that they\'re much more brand-savvy.\n\nIn the second wave report, we compared Alphas to Gen Z at the same age. For Gen Alpha, their favorite brand is Nike. For Gen Z at the same age, it was McDonald\'s. These are two very different brands, creating two very different experiences, both online and digitally.\n\nGen Z was very interested in influencers, and wanted to be influencers themselves and develop careers out of that. Gen Alpha is not interested in that. They want jobs where they\'re going to change the world. They do look to influencers, but they are more interested in influencers and creators that they feel a connection and community with. That\'s where I think it gets very interesting, to see how that\'s going to change the way marketers operate.\n\nBoth generations love gaming. To me, gaming isn\'t just an affinity or lifestyle attribute -- everybody\'s gaming. However, the reason why Gen Z games is because they want to have an escape. It\'s their way of taking a break. Whereas Gen Alpha, they want to create. They\'re using gaming as an avenue for their creativity and for community.\n\nYou mentioned the importance of authenticity and real-life stories for Gen Alpha. What does this mean for brands, and how can they find and tell real-life stories that are engaging and bite sized to resonate with this generation?\n\nI think first you have to be really sharp on what the purpose is for the organization. We think a lot about what we call IBX: integrated brand experience. What is that experience, holistically, for somebody interacting with your brand? What does that entire journey look like, and what is it like once you purchase the product and [are] experiencing the world? Once you have a clear understanding of that, the stories will emerge. But who tells those stories is also important. We are very focused on creators right now. Creators are not just influencers putting their name on something. They are genuinely thinking about how to bring that story to life.\n\nPart of this involves having a lot of Gen Z staff who can create content authentically in the right voice for the target audience. The formats are there now, but it\'s very difficult for some brands to give up a little bit of control over how those stories look because they\'re not as polished or beautiful. They don\'t want super high-polished athletes and celebrities. They don\'t want the two-minute brand film. They want content that resonates with them, and that\'s going to look different. Based on what I\'m seeing in the data, I believe we\'re going to see a shift toward a creator content model for brands. Content creators will look for brands with authentic stories derived from their purpose, which they can then create and tell.\n\nHow do you see Gen Alpha\'s preferences changing marketing? How does this change what brands are going to be doing in five years?\n\nI think their brand maturity is one of the things that will have the biggest impact in five years. The baseline for Gen Alpha is high compared to where it was for Gen Z. Streaming is the baseline. Amazon is the baseline. The brands they\'re looking to are very sophisticated. These aren\'t just food, candy, and cookie brands. These are the biggest, most sophisticated brands in the world.\n\nIf you\'re used to Amazon, everything should be as easy as Amazon. We know how amazing that experience is, every brand should be thinking about that as the baseline five years from now.\n\nAnother huge change is AI. These kids will have grown up with AI. They will be savvy at knowing what was AI-generated and what was human-generated. This will become a big question around authenticity. As we scale personalization using AI tools, where is the line where it\'s so personalized that now it\'s inauthentic? For something like a candy bar, maybe it\'s fine because you don\'t have a high investment as a brand. But for something they are highly invested in, like a gaming property or a product that they\'re very interested in and part of their community, they won\'t want inauthentic AI-generated content.\n\nSome of Netflix\'s most-watched original shows this summer are real-life stories told in documentary-style series.\n\n23: Number of Netflix docuseries released this year that have been in its Top 10 most-watched shows\n\nWhat did actress Sydney Sweeney say in response to a not-quite-accurate AI-generated image of herself that went viral?', 'source': {'uri': 'forbes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Forbes'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://imageio.forbes.com/specials-images/imageserve/6698016baa62f4e815501d2f/0x0.jpg?format=jpg&crop=3063,1723,x0,y318,safe&height=600&width=1200&fit=bounds', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': -0.003921568627450966, 'wgt': 458934424, 'relevance': 70}

No doubt about that, right? And potentially, the earnings will be good as well. But it\'s all about expectations. So again, in the short term for the retail investor, very difficult to predict," Zaman says.\n\nHe explains that the concentration of more than 20% of the S&P 500 (^GSPC) lies in three stocks, which investors want to hold on to. However, he advises that "no individual stocks should be more than 5% of the portfolio, and invest in other areas of the market to protect yourselves."\n\nFocusing on Tesla (TSLA), Zaman notes that despite the stock\'s volatility, "in the long term it\'s going to do well." {'uri': '8230449359', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:45:38', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:45:38Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:45:12Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://finance.yahoo.com/news/argo-infrastructure-partners-powering-ai-173548072.html', 'title': 'Argo Infrastructure Partners on Powering the AI Gold Rush Through Data Centers', 'body': 'The data center industry continues to experience phenomenal growth as the digitalization of the economy accelerates exponentially across sectors. Against this backdrop, infrastructure investment firm Argo Infrastructure Partners LP ("Argo") has made a series of notable investments to become the majority owner of TierPoint, a leading U.S. data center operator and provider of enterprise-class data center solutions.\n\nWe sat down with Jason Zibarras, founder of Argo Infrastructure Partners and Brice Soucy, Argo Senior Director and TierPoint Board Member, to explore why TierPoint stands out as an attractive target in this dynamic market and as a platform for future investment growth. We\'ll examine Argo\'s investment thesis and capabilities, assess TierPoint\'s competitive positioning and potential for durable long-term growth, discuss additional investment to capitalize on the macro trends propelling demand for data center services and evaluate why TierPoint is a match for Argo\'s investment philosophy.\n\nCorpGov: For those not familiar with Argo, would you please explain your investment philosophy?\n\nJason Zibarras: Argo was founded as an independent infrastructure private equity manager to invest in high-quality infrastructure assets with contracted, regulated or concessioned features. Argo has invested in 5 utility companies with over 600,000 customers, over ~3 GW of power generation and transmission resources, an energy storage network, 40 data centers and over 4,000 managed parking and motorway services facilities. Argo\'s 18 portfolio companies have over 15,000 operating employees and operations in 42 states.\n\nOur national presence, the scale of our portfolio and our understanding of the nexus between power markets and data centers, including the criticality of power availability the industry is facing today, positioned us well to underwrite the TierPoint investment and growth. TierPoint\'s robust contractual revenue profile, $1.6bn of investment-grade debt profile and environmental stewardship, fully align with Argo\'s long-term sustainable infrastructure thesis.\n\nCorpGov: For those not familiar with TierPoint, would you please explain what the company does?\n\nBrice Soucy: TierPoint, founded in 2010, is an enterprise-class data center operator with 40 data centers in 20 markets, connected by a coast-to-coast fiber network providing services to over 3,000 customers.\n\nTierPoint offers a full range of solutions for enterprise customers, including mission-critical enterprise and high-density colocation, network, interconnection, cloud and managed services.\n\nCorpGov: Let\'s talk more about the data center industry. There has been considerable media coverage about their increasing importance in the digital economy. What are some of the factors driving growth?\n\nJason Zibarras: Almost all things digital rely on data centers. Several macro trends are driving demand for data center services by enterprises, including the rapid adoption of cloud computing, continued migration of enterprise workloads to off-premises data centers, emergence of compute-intensive workloads including artificial intelligence (AI) and increasing demand by content providers (including in edge markets). We see these trends materially contributing to growth for enterprise-class data centers by enabling enterprise clients to provide, store and traverse critical data in the medium term. Most pressing today, the AI gold rush is overtaking available processing power, further driving the need for more data centers. NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) is the most prominent example of the incredible demand for processing power to enable AI; TierPoint\'s data centers are providing the picks-and-shovels as a conduit to enable AI workloads via high-density colocation.\n\nPerhaps the most recent example of this is the onboarding of CoreWeave as a customer, a specialized cloud provider built for large-scale, GPU-accelerated workloads who has worked closely with NVIDIA. In total, according to an April report from Thunder Said Energy (TSE), the internet will be the fastest-growing segment of the energy industry due to the acceleration of AI, and electricity demand will be up ~5X p.a. through 2030 (2.4% p.a. vs 0.5% in the past 20 years) in part due to the growth in demand for data centers. According to TSE, "combining the requirement to power data centers with broader ambitions in the energy transition would culminate in the most active expansion of the US power generation infrastructure that has ever occurred." We expect this to translate into opportunities for TierPoint and our other portfolio companies, including our utility and power generation assets, through the 2030 timeframe.\n\nCorpGov: What are TierPoint\'s competitive advantages and how is TierPoint positioning itself to capitalize on the growing demand for AI-related infrastructure?\n\nBrice Soucy: TierPoint has one of the largest customer sets in the industry, and historically over 50% of our growth has been fueled by increased demand from existing customers. Having a national portfolio is crucial to meet increasing demand; more than half of our customers deploy workloads in multiple TierPoint data centers, which will become increasingly relevant as workloads move to the edge and closer to the customer. This is an area where we expect robust growth given the increase in peering traffic within TierPoint\'s target markets and the need for high-compute workloads with low latency and close proximity to the customer, including enabling the movement of content and being a conduit between the end user and the content supplier.\n\nTierPoint has one of the best track records for both energy-efficient and reliable operations in the industry. For example, TierPoint achieved 100% uptime of critical systems in 2023, and TierPoint\'s data centers exceed industry standards for information security.\n\nTierPoint continues to adjust to technological changes and advances by automating and augmenting its product set. We believe TierPoint is on the cutting edge with its offerings and will continue to focus on this as the company grows to ensure they are able to meet the growing needs of its customer base. As an example, TierPoint enables its clients\' compliant solutions. We have large healthcare practices for which we preserve and assist with critical data from hospitals, healthcare providers and other sources. We also provide similar services for our government and financial services clients, who have comparable regulatory and security requirements for their data.\n\nSince the emergence of high-performance computing and artificial intelligence / machine learning workloads, TierPoint has developed a proven and unparalleled track record for providing high-density colocation to support the most demanding workloads in its target markets. TierPoint has become a trusted partner of choice through its use of modern efficient cooling technologies and efficient rack design. They are able to lower operating temperatures and boost system performance, resulting in both capital and operating expense savings for customers, while helping customers prioritize sustainability by enabling heightened energy efficiency.\n\nCorpGov: The press release announcing Argo\'s majority investment in TierPoint stated that this is Argo\'s "flagship digital investment." Jason, would you provide some insight into your investment process and why you have such strong conviction making this investment?\n\nJason Zibarras: When I left J.P. Morgan, I founded Argo Infrastructure Partners with a specific investment philosophy in mind; one of the keys to that is investing in fundamentally strong, high-quality businesses providing critical/essential infrastructure with high growth potential underpinned by robust contractual frameworks. TierPoint is the exact type of investment we look for - a high-quality, essential infrastructure asset with incredibly strong macro tailwinds driving demand and a national presence able to capture them.\n\nCorpGov: What specific AI applications or workloads are driving the need for high-density colocation services?\n\nBrice Soucy: As TierPoint has stated on its blog, AI workloads can be used to train, execute and maintain artificial intelligence models. Different types of workloads are used to accomplish different tasks. AI models can be trained using historical data to analyze customer behavior, maintenance needs, and sales trends. Predictive analytics and forecasting require a tremendous amount of computing power.\n\nIn simple terms, as referenced by TSE, the growth in demand will be driven by both AI training (which requires training energy to process historical data) and then AI querying (which is the use of the models, analogous to sending an email or conducting a Google search). AI querying will drive the majority of long-term growth and according to TSE is expected to increase to ~350bn queries per day by 2045, comparable to today\'s daily email traffic, especially as compute-intensity increases over time.\n\nCorpGov: What is your expectation of the growth in the total addressable market (TAM) in the near and longer-term?\n\nBrice Soucy: Data center capacity, the power available to the IT systems it supports, can\'t be calculated with just one measurement. Multiple figures are combined to determine capacity, including space, power, cooling, computing resources and network connectivity.\n\nAccording to a McKinsey & Co. report, data center demand is forecasted to grow approximately 10% each year through 2030, reaching 35 gigawatts (GW) by 2030, a 77% increase from 2024.\n\nCorpGov: Can you elaborate on TierPoint\'s achievements in energy efficiency, including how it\'s addressing concerns about energy consumption and environmental impact?\n\nJason Zibarras: TierPoint has an unparalleled industry track record for reliable operations and energy efficiency, having achieved 100% uptime of critical systems and its lowest Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) in history in 2023. New build expansions can achieve even lower PUEs, 15-20% below the current portfolio PUE, by utilizing state-of-the-art design incorporating modern efficient cooling technologies and efficient rack design. TierPoint has also worked with customers to source local renewable energy capacity wherever possible.\n\nCorpGov: What challenges and opportunities do you foresee in the digital infrastructure landscape?\n\nBrice Soucy: Power availability represents the true nexus of infrastructure and data centers. According to the April report from TSE, there will be a need for 20 GW p.a. of new AI data centers through 2030 (150 GW total, including the demand for both AI training and querying), and Goldman Sachs research from April estimates this will translate into a $50 billion investment requirement over the same timeframe. What we foresee as an even greater challenge that is not being widely discussed in all the headlines about availability is power reliability. As TSE notes, "AI data centers will look for reliable, around the clock power, to minimize the chance of volatility impacting their utilization rates." As infrastructure investors, we recognize what will be required to source, generate and transmit this reliable power going forward at the lowest levelized total cost of electricity. This will include investment in infrastructure supporting the energy transition to drive energy efficiency and potentially long-duration energy storage solutions that will provide additional reliability over time.\n\nCorpGov: How is Argo planning to help TierPoint expand its data center footprint?\n\nJason Zibarras: Over half of TierPoint\'s historical growth has come from existing customers, so we expect that a significant amount of future investment opportunity will come from expanding existing facilities to meet the needs of our current customer base. Additionally, we are finding unprecedented demand in TierPoint\'s markets for colocation as the broader market is forecast to grow at 10% p.a. through 2030. We believe it would not be an overstatement to double the size of the portfolio in the medium term to meet this demand through contracted expansions. We look forward to partnering with the Company, our managed investors and securitization investor partners to fund this expansion over the medium term.', 'source': {'uri': 'finance.yahoo.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Yahoo! Es ist allerdings nicht auszuschließen, dass Amazon für die zweite Hälfte der Rabatt-Sause noch weitere Mobile-Schnäppchen im Köcher hat.\n\nDas A15 5G bietet eigentlich alles, was der Alltag von einem Smartphone verlangt, zu einem ohnehin relativ günstigen Preis. Amazon toppt das mit seinem Prime-Day-Deal - so günstig gibt es dieses Handy sonst nirgends.\n\nHinweis: Die Preise sind volatil und die Händler passen bisweilen auch die unverbindliche Preisempfehlung (UVP) an. Sollten sich die Preise von den hier angegebenen unterscheiden, haben die Händler sie nach Veröffentlichung des Artikels geändert.\n\nDas Google Pixel 8 gehört zu den High-End-Smartphones und macht den Modellen von Apple und Samsung ordentlich Konkurrenz. Für die schwarze Variante ist das der Bestpreis - so günstig war das Smartphone noch nie.\n\nAber: Wer sich auch mit einer anderen Farbvariante anfreunden kann, kommt anderswo sogar noch günstiger weg.\n\nWer zum neuen Smartphone auch gleich einen neuen Tarif möchte, findet mitunter an anderer Stelle bessere Angebote als bei Amazon. So zum Beispiel bei Vodafone: Hier gibt's das iPhone 15 Pro für einmalige 49,90 Euro im Verbund mit einem 50-Gigabyte-Tarif. Der GigaMobil M kostet dann 79,99 Euro monatlich.\n\nAuch diese Smartphones bekommen Prime-Mitglieder am Prime Day günstiger:\n\nUm bei den Deals und Schnäppchen zuschlagen zu können, ist eine Amazon-Prime-Mitgliedschaft erforderlich. Diese umfasst:\n\nEin weiterer Spar-Tipp: Der n-tv.de-Dealticker versorgt Schnäppchenjäger täglich mit frischen Angeboten, auch abseits des Amazon Prime Day.\n\nWer noch kein Prime-Abo hat oder kein dauerhaftes Abo abschließen möchte, profitiert womöglich von der kostenlosen Probemitgliedschaft. Diese gilt 30 Tage lang und umfasst ebenfalls die Sonderangebote am Prime Day 2024.\n\nTipp: Nur eine Person pro Haushalt benötigt eine Prime-Mitgliedschaft bei Amazon. Sie kann die Prime-Vorteile daraus mit einem Familienmitglied teilen, indem sie in den Einstellungen bei Amazon Name und E-Mail der ausgewählten Person eingibt. So können auch Nicht-Prime-Kunden am Prime Day auf die Amazon-Prime-Day-Angebote zugreifen. Allerdings ist ein Amazon-Konto eine Voraussetzung für den Einkauf.\n\nDer Amazon Prime Day fand im Jahr 2015 zum ersten Mal statt. Ins Leben gerufen wurde er als Amazon-eigenes Pendant zum Black Friday, mit dem das 20-jährige Jubiläum gefeiert wurde. Anfangs war es ursprünglich tatsächlich nur ein Tag, an dem die Produkte reduziert waren. Seit 2019 zieht sich der Prime Day über ganze zwei Tage.\n\nWer ein bestimmtes Produkt auf seiner Wunschliste hat oder einfach ein bisschen shoppen möchte, sollte am Prime Day die Augen offenhalten - das Sparpotenzial ist groß.", 'source': {'uri': 'n-tv.de', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'N-tv'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bilder1.n-tv.de/img/shopping-und-service/crop25095360/0881326280-cImg_16_9-w1200/Zum-Prime-Day-2024-reduziert-Amazon-wieder-zahlreiche-Smartphones-auch-von-Top-Marken.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458934310, 'relevance': 29}

{'uri': '8230445028', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:41:19', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:41:19Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:40:53Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.idahostatejournal.com/news/national/stock-market-today-big-tech-stocks-dive-again-as-their-split-deepens-with-the-rest/article_ee23da71-74ed-5348-933d-77a4a47f621a.html', 'title': 'Stock market today: Big tech stocks dive again as their split deepens with the rest of Wall Street', 'body': 'NEW YORK (AP) -- Big technology stocks are dropping again Wednesday, hurt by worries about potentially worsening trade tensions with China. That\'s dragging market indexes to their worst day in months, but conditions may be less discouraging underneath the surface, and nearly as many U.S. stocks are rising as falling.\n\nThe split left the S&P 500 sagging by 1.1% a day after it set an all-time high for the 38th time this year. The Nasdaq composite was down 2.1% and on track for its worst day since January, also weighed by losses for such market heavyweights as Nvidia and Apple.\n\nBut the Dow Jones Industrial Average was adding 103 points, or 0.3%, to its record set a day earlier, as of 10:45 a.m. Eastern time. The smaller stocks in the Russell 2000 were also holding up better than the rest of the market, down a more modest 0.5%, after roaring in recent days on hopes that interest rates are about to get easier and the U.S. economy will avoid a recession.\n\nIt\'s a continuation of a recent trend that market watchers have called encouraging, one where more stocks are rising rather than just a handful of overpowering elites.\n\nThe market\'s spotlight was squarely on chip companies, which tumbled after a report from Bloomberg News said President Joe Biden is considering the most severe trade restrictions available if companies like the Netherlands\' ASML and Japan\'s Tokyo Electron continue to ship advanced semiconductor technology to China. The U.S. government has blocked Chinese access to advanced chips and the equipment to make them, citing security concerns, and urged its allies to follow suit.\n\nASML saw its stock trading in the United States drop 10.6% even though it reported sales for the spring that came in at the high end of its forecasted range. Shares of Tokyo Electron, meanwhile, dropped 7.5% in Tokyo to cull its gain for the year to 32.2%.\n\nAnother major chip company, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., sank after former President Donald Trump criticized the self-governed island claimed by Beijing, which the U.S. is obligated by treaty to defend if it is attacked.\n\n"Taiwan should pay us for defense," Trump said according to a transcript of an interview published by Bloomberg. "Taiwan took our chip business from us, I mean, how stupid are we?" he said.\n\nTSMC\'s stock trading in the United States dropped 6.1%.\n\nReverberations reached chip stocks around the world, including big U.S. players that have been some of Wall Street\'s biggest stars this year amid a frenzy around artificial-intelligence technology. Nvidia fell 5.6% after soaring 155.2% this year through the day before.\n\nAdvanced Micro Devices fell 7.8%, and Broadcom dropped 5%.\n\nBig Tech stocks\' movements have an outsized effect on indexes like the S&P 500, which give more weight to companies of bigger size. That was a boon in recent years, when a small group of companies known as "the Magnificent Seven" was able to soar almost regardless of what the overall economy and interest rates were doing. That helped mask weakness underneath the surface as the economy struggled through high interest rates meant to snuff out inflation.\n\nNow, though, some critics call those Magnificent Seven stocks too expensive, and investors are creeping back into unloved areas of the market. The economy has remained remarkably resilient so far, with the job market remaining solid, and investors widely expect the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates in September because inflation has slowed.\n\n"Markets cannot continue indefinitely higher on the backs of just a handful of stocks," said JJ Kinahan, CEO of IG North America.\n\nJohnson & Johnson, whose stock is still down slightly for the year so far, jumped 2.9% after topping analysts\' forecasts for profit in the latest quarter. It was one of the largest reasons the Dow Jones Industrial Average was able to rise despite falls for each of the Magnificent Seven stocks: Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia and Tesla.\n\nU.S. Bancorp, which has also lagged the rest of the market this year, rallied 4.5% after topping analysts\' forecasts for profit and revenue.\n\nPrologis, whose stock is still down for the year, jumped 6.1% to be one of the day\'s strongest within the S&P 500. The company, which owns logistics real estate around the world, reported stronger results for the latest quarter than analysts expected. While CEO Hamid Moghadam said demand from customers remains subdued, it is improving, and he expects that trend to continue.\n\nOn the losing side of Wall Street was Five Below, a retailer targeting teens and tweens with products priced at $5 or below. It tumbled 19.9% after its CEO, Joel Anderson, stepped down from his job and from the board. It also gave a profit forecast for the second quarter that fell short of analysts\' expectations.\n\nSpirit Airlines lost 9% after the discount carrier cut its forecast for revenue in the second quarter. It said it\'s making fewer dollars than expected from fees outside of tickets.\n\nIn the bond market, the 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.18% from 4.16% late Tuesday.\n\nIn stock markets abroad, London\'s FTSE 100 was 0.4% higher after data showed the inflation rate remained steady at the Bank of England\'s 2% target in June. Indexes were mixed elsewhere across Europe and Asia.\n\n___\n\nAP Business Writer Elaine Kurtenbach contributed.', 'source': {'uri': 'idahostatejournal.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Idaho State Journal'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'stan_choe@idahostatejournal.com', 'name': 'Stan Choe', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/idahostatejournal.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/d/f4/df499942-757d-5536-a674-d0240f68b284/6697a63847646.image.jpg?crop=1763%2C926%2C0%2C124&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': -0.1450980392156863, 'wgt': 458934079, 'relevance': 26}

Netflix has beaten analysts\' revenue estimates in three of the past five quarters and five of the past 10 quarters.\n\nAnalysts expect Netflix to report second-quarter earnings per share of $4.74, compared to $3.29 in last year\'s second quarter. The company has beaten earnings per share estimates in four of the past five quarters and eight of the past 10 quarters.\n\nGuidance from Netflix calls for second-quarter revenue to be $9.49 billion and earnings per share to be $4.68.\n\nRead Also: Netflix Buys International Rights To Tencent\'s Chinese Series \'See Her Again\': Why This Rare Move Matters\n\nWhat Analysts Are Saying: Expectations for Netflix could be too high in the second quarter, Rosenblatt analyst Barton Crockett said in a new investor note.\n\nThe analyst said the outlook of second-quarter member growth is lower than that of the first quarter, which is reasonable given normal seasonality.\n\n"We don\'t see a basis for the more bullish calls that Netflix can substantially top its member growth outlook," Crockett said.\n\nThe analyst, who had a Neutral rating and $554 price target, said membership growth is the key to Netflix stock reaction to earnings reports.\n\nCrockett said usage data from the company and Google searches show a decline in the second quarter compared to the first quarter. The analyst said the second and third quarters are seasonally the slowest for subscriber growth.\n\n"While Netflix is a well-managed company, the transition from growth to a more mature trajectory could weigh on share performance."\n\nJPMorgan analyst Doug Anmuth also recently said expectations were high for Netflix\'s second quarter. The analyst, who had an Overweight rating, raised the price target from $650 to $750.\n\n"We remain positive on Netflix shares heading in Q2 earnings on Thursday, 7/18, while also recognizing high expectations," Anmuth said.\n\nThe analyst said positive trends for Netflix include paid sharing growth, core subscriber growth, strong content and the ad-supported tier growth. Additionally, sports content could boost engagement for Netflix, the analyst said.\n\n"We expect a bigger push into live sports over time, particularly as leverage continues to shift in NFLX\'s direction."\n\nThe ad-supported plan is the key for Netflix to scale subscribers going forward, Benchmark analyst Matthew Harrigan said.\n\nThe analyst, who had a Sell rating, raised the price target from $450 to $545.\n\n"Netflix management undeniably continues to execute well on paid sharing, its AVOD effort and injecting significant new content including NFL Christmas Day games and WWE Raw next year," Harrigan said.\n\nWhile Harrigan praised the company\'s growth and operations, valuation of the stock looks stretched.\n\n"We still do not feel the current valuation can be justified even valuing Netflix as a Nasdaq 100 high growth technology name and disregarding its hybrid media stock character."\n\nHere\'s a look at other analyst ratings on Netflix and their price targets:\n\nKey Items to Watch: Netflix added 9.33 million paid subscribers in the first quarter to end the quarter with 269.6 million.\n\nThe company did not provide guidance for subscribers only saying it expected the second quarter add to be lower than the first quarter. Netflix also said it won\'t provide subscriber metrics in 2025. The headline subscriber number will likely be a key for investors and analysts.\n\nThe upcoming content slate from Netflix will also be another hot topic with a second season of the massive hit "Squid Game" expected in the second half of 2024 with no release date.\n\nOther sports content will also fill the second half of the year like a Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul boxing match, a Joey Chestnut hot dog eating contest and two NFL games on Christmas Day.\n\nNetflix could share an update on more sports content or how the advertising demand for these key events is shaping up in relation to the ad-supported plan.\n\nThe streaming company could also share other upcoming shows and movies to get fans and investors excited.\n\nNFLX Price Action: Netflix shares trade at $642.71 Wednesday at publication versus a 52-week trading range of $344.73 to $697.49. {'uri': '8230436424', 'lang': 'hrv', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:34:01', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:34:01Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:33:35Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://lidermedia.hr/tvrtke-i-trzista/wall-street-izvjestio-o-najboljem-kvartalu-za-investicijsko-bankarstvo-u-posljednje-2-godine-158150', 'title': 'Wall Street izvjestio o najboljem kvartalu za investicijsko bankarstvo u posljednje 2 godine', 'body': "Wall Street je objavio najbolje tromjesečje za investicijsko bankarstvo u više od dvije godine, što su bankari opisali kao 'rano razdoblje' održivog oporavka.\n\nPet najvećih investicijskih banaka; Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America i Citigroup zajedno su izvijestile o naknadama investicijskog bankarstva od 8,2 milijarde dolara u drugom tromjesečju, što je povećanje od 40 posto u odnosu na godinu ranije i najviše od početka 2022., objavio je Financial Times.\n\nSve banke osim Goldman Sachsa objavile su više od očekivanih prihoda investicijskog bankarstva za ovo tromjesečje.\n\n- Brojke izgledaju sjajno - rekao je analitičar UBS-a Brennan Hakwen, koji tvrdi da su se 'stvarno uklopili u ovu priču o ponovnom otvaranju tržišta kapitala, koja je tematski bila u prvom planu za ulagače'.\n\nSvaka od pet velikih investicijskih banaka nadmašila je referentni indeks S&P 500 u posljednja tri mjeseca.\n\nU utorak su optimistični komentari glavnog izvršnog direktora Morgan Stanleya, Teda Picka o izgledima za investicijsko bankarstvo, pomogli u preokretu udara na dionice banke zbog mješovitih kvartalnih rezultata.\n\n- Mislim da smo u ranoj fazi višegodišnjeg ciklusa investicijskog bankarstva. Poprilično smo uvjereni u ovaj poziv - rekao je Pick analitičarima.\n\nDavid Solomon iz Goldmana rekao je u razgovoru s analitičarima da je 'zaostatak u investicijskom bankarstvu značajno porastao u ovom tromjesečju' s prostorom za daljnji porast aktivnosti, dok je glavni financijski direktor JPMorgana Jeremy Barnum rekao da su razgovori s klijentima o poslovima 'definitivno povećani'.\n\nPick je rekao da je u nekim područjima sada bilo tri puta više 'bakeoffova', odnosno situacija u kojima se banke natječu za uloge u nadolazećim poslovima, nego prije godinu dana.\n\nNaknade se općenito plaćaju po završetku poslova, što signalizira da će se prihodi investicijskog bankarstva vjerojatno dodatno povećati u narednim kvartalima.\n\nNaknade od ugovora o dugu nadmašile su druga područja investicijskog bankarstva, jer korporativni zajmoprimci žele refinancirati ili podići novi dug dok su se kamatne stope stabilizirale. Prihodi od preuzimanja duga u pet banaka porasli su za više od 50 posto u odnosu na godinu ranije na 3,7 milijardi dolara, piše FT.\n\nCiti i Morgan Stanley imali su najveće koristi od nedavnog oporavka dužničkih poslova. Naknade u dvjema bankama porasle su za oko 90 posto, odnosno 70 posto u odnosu na prošlu godinu, kako su banke oporavljale položaj koji su ustupile konkurentima.\n\nObnovljeno povjerenje u gospodarstvo povećalo je apetit ulagača za poslove koji bi se prije samo nekoliko mjeseci smatrali prerizičnima.\n\nProblematični proizvođač aviona Boeing prikupio je 10 milijardi dolara krajem travnja, predvođen BofA-om, Citijem, JPMorganom i Wells Fargom, djelomično za otplatu duga koji bi trebao dospjeti u sljedeće dvije godine.\n\nNaknade za preuzimanje dionica i poslove spajanja i preuzimanja također su porasle.\n\nPrihodi povezani s izdavanjem dionica porasli su 36 posto na 1,8 milijardi dolara, s drugim tromjesečjem potaknutim uvrštavanjem južnokorejske online strip platforme Webtoon Entertainment na Nasdaq, koja je prikupila 315 milijuna dolara.\n\nGoldman, Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan i Evercore vodili su taj posao, dok JPMorgan, BofA i Morgan Stanley vode IPO za Ardent Health Partners, koji bi mogao prikupiti više od 300 milijuna dolara.\n\nJPMorgan je zaradio 495 milijuna dolara naknada od ponude dionica u tromjesečju, a slijedi ga Goldman, koji je donio 425 milijuna dolara.\n\nPrihodi od savjeta o spajanjima i preuzimanjima porasli su za skromnijih 25 posto na 2,7 milijardi dolara u drugom kvartalu.\n\nIako je ove godine do sada bilo samo nekoliko velikih sklopljenih poslova (ne samo Exxonova akvizicija Pioneera vrijedna 60 milijardi dolara) postoje znakovi da se transakcije visoke vrijednosti povećavaju.\n\nVrijednost poslova najavljenih od početka godine porasla je 43 posto u SAD-u u usporedbi s prethodnom godinom, dok je ovaj tjedan objavljeno da Google pregovara o preuzimanju startupa Wiz za kibernetičku sigurnost u vrijednosti od 23 milijarde dolara.\n\nAko se ti najavljeni dogovori sklope, Goldman će preuzeti lavovski dio naknada.\n\nBanka je imenovana savjetnikom za poslove vrijedne 467 milijardi dolara u prvoj polovici godine, prema podacima LSEG-a. To je bilo jednako 28 posto svih najavljenih spajanja i preuzimanja, u odnosu na 21 posto prije godinu dana.\n\nMorgan Stanley, drugorangirani savjetnik, također je povećao svoj udio savjeta o poslovima s 15 posto poslova na 24 posto, pri čemu su JPMorgan i BofA pali na ljestvici.\n\nMeđutim, neki su analitičari izrazili skepticizam oko toga hoće li se oporavak održati. Rukovoditelji Wall Streeta rekli su ulagačima prije godinu dana da postoje 'zeleni izdanci' oporavka, ali su prihodi i dalje mjesecima ostali na povijesno niskim razinama.\n\nBankarski analitičar Wells Farga Mike Mayo upitao je u utorak Morgan Stanleyjev izbor: 'Zašto mislite da je ovaj put stvarno?'\n\n- Mnogi su ljudi tražili ovo, a to je bila vrsta odgođenih snimanja, ako hoćete. This potential acquisition would be Google's largest ever and significantly boost its cloud computing capabilities.\n\nThe potential deal has put ETFs with a substantial allocation to Alphabet in focus. These include Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (NYSE:XLC), Vanguard Communication Services ETF (NYSE:VOX), Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF (NYSE:FCOM), iShares Global Comm Services ETF (NYSE:IXP) and MicroSectors FANG+ ETN (NYSE:FNGS).\n\nWiz, an Israeli startup founded in 2020, is one of the fastest-growing start-ups in the cloud security arena and has been positioning itself as a platform provider versus leaders Palo Alto Networks, Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) and others.\n\nThe potential deal highlights Alphabet's strategic focus on enhancing its cybersecurity portfolio amid increasing competition in the tech industry. It would boost Google's cloud-computing business, which lags behind Amazon.com unit Amazon Web Services as well as Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT). Offering an all-in-one approach to cloud security, Wiz relies on ingesting data from various cloud platforms, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud, and then scanning it all for security risk factors.\n\nAlphabet executives see the deal as a way to fortify Google's cloud business, which grew 28% to $9.57 billion in the first quarter of this year. However, an agreement hasn't been reached yet, and talks may fall apart.\n\nCommunication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund\n\nCommunication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund offers exposure to companies from telecommunication services, media, entertainment and interactive media & services and has accumulated $19.6 billion in its asset base. It follows the Communication Services Select Sector Index and holds 22 stocks in its basket, with Alphabet Class A and C shares occupying the second and third position, respectively, with a combined 23.4% share. About 47% of the portfolio is allocated to interactive media & services, while entertainment and media round off the next two.\n\nCommunication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund charges 9 bps in annual fees and trades in an average daily volume of 3.2 million shares. It has a Zacks ETF Rank #2 (Buy).\n\nVanguard Communication Services ETF targets the communication sector by tracking the MSCI US Investable Market Communication Services 25/50 Index. Holding 117 stocks in its basket, both Alphabet Class A and C shares take the second and third spots, with a total of 22.2% of the portfolio. Interactive media & services is the top sector, accounting for 51.1% of the portfolio, while movies & entertainment, cable & satellite and integrated telecommunication services round off the next three.\n\nVanguard Communication Services ETF has AUM of $4.1 billion and trades in a good volume of 135,000 shares a day, on average. It charges 10 bps in annual fees and has a Zacks ETF Rank #3 (Hold) with a Medium risk outlook.\n\nFidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF\n\nFidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF follows the MSCI USA IMI Communication Services 25/50 Index. It holds 65 stocks in its basket, with Alphabet Class A and C shares taking the second and third spot, respectively, at 22.8%. Interactive media & services dominates the fund's return at 51.8%, followed by integrated telecommunication services (17.7%).\n\niShares Global Comm Services ETF has amassed $443 million in its asset base while trading at an average daily volume of 20,000 shares. It holds 10 equal-weighted stocks in its basket, with Alphabet accounting for a 10.2% share.\n\nMicroSectors FANG+ ETN has accumulated $383.6 million in its asset base and charges 58 bps in annual fees. Alcoholic beverages will be ordered at the window seen at right in this photo, will be picked up at a window on the back of the building. Google maps screen capture\n\n"Everything is in order," Town Manager Carrie Castonguay said.\n\nDerek Pomeroy and Destiny Cook officially took over the business from owners Steve and Rhonda Jones in Sept. 2022, now operate under the business name DD Horizons LLC.\n\nThe facility features an order window on the Main Street side, food is picked up along the side of the building along Water Street. A floor plan submitted with the application indicates alcohol will only be served from a window on the back side. Picnic tables are located in that area, which is roped off from the roadway beside the building and the parking lot behind it, according to the plan.\n\n"I am wondering about the roped off area," Selectman Bruce Peary said. "Roping or cordoning off a thing is not always a really good deterrent to people wandering away with their adult beverages. Do you have a contingency about making sure that that doesn\'t happen?"\n\n"We are going to have signs, also have security cameras on the back side of the building facing towards the gazebo," Pomeroy replied. "I also thought that the police station would be a pretty good deterrent. If that seems to be an issue, I can put a fence up."\n\nAdvertisement\n\n"You face Main Street, your pickup window is on the side," Peary noted. "From your vantage point you can\'t see anything that is going on back there. How are you going to control that? Someone is going to want to take their adult beverage down along the river or whatever."\n\nPeary thinks the addition is a great idea.\n\n"Obviously if there are any issues, we are going to make adjustments as they come," Pomeroy said. The security cameras, police station and signs will be the start, he noted. A serving station in that area will have a person available to provide refills, he stated.\n\nPreparing orders Oct. 1 at Stevie J\'s Burgers and Burritos in Livermore Falls are employee Mya Gastin, left, new owner Derek Pomeroy, former owner Steve Jones and new owner Destiny Cook. Pam Harnden/Livermore Falls Advertiser file\n\nWhen asked about hours for serving liquor, Pomeroy said he has a family and farm too, probably wouldn\'t be open past 8:30 p.m.\n\nPeary asked if the canopy would be put back up.\n\n"If I can get the poles in the ground, I would like to have it in the long run be a permanent structure so it has a hard roof," Pomeroy replied.\n\nAdvertisement\n\n"People don\'t want to sit there and have rain falling into their beverages or their burgers," Peary said.\n\nWhen asked, Pomeroy said there is a portable toilet near the gazebo people can use.\n\nChair William Kenniston noted requirements might be different for an outdoor operation.\n\nPomeroy said he hoped to have everything in place before the end of this season. Previously Stevie J\'s closed in the fall.\n\nCopy the Story Link Related Headlines Stevie J\'s Burgers and Burritos has new owners\n\nSend questions/comments to the editors.\n\nfiled under: Board of Selectmen, Livermore Falls Advertiser, livermore falls maine Related Stories Latest Articles', 'source': {'uri': 'sunjournal.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Lewiston Sun Journal'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://w2pcms.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/10/2022/10/LFA.steviejP.100522-2.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.05882352941176472, 'wgt': 458933431, 'relevance': 41}

'【大纪元2024年07月17日讯】（大纪元记者林燕综合报导）随着美国总统2024年竞选活动升温，亿万富翁们分别为民主党推定总统候选人拜登和共和党总统候选人川普注资。\n\n自上周六（7月13日）躲过暗杀以来，前美国总统川普（特朗普）的竞选团队已经收到大量来自巨额捐赠者的资金。另一边，拜登总统也同样获得一些亿万富翁的力挺。\n\n因暗杀事件短暂休战两天后，双方再次进入选战状态，共和党本周举行全国代表大会，民主党将在8月召开全国代表大会。可以预计，接下来拜登与川普之间的竞选活动会更加激烈。\n\n各竞选团队和政党的大型筹款机构以及一些关键的超级政治行动委员会于周一（7月15日）向联邦选举委员会提交了季度报告，截止时间是6月底。以下是彭博社的报导：\n\n拜登团队\n\n拜登和民主党在第二季度筹集了2.63亿美元，手头有2.4亿美元现金。拜登的第二季度筹款额超过川普。支持拜登的大型民主党超级政治行动委员会，包括Future Forward PAC和American Bridge，要到周六（7月20日）才会公布报告。\n\n6月份，拜登筹集了1.27亿美元，而川普筹集了1.12亿美元。\n\n从6月27日第一次总统辩论会到6月底，拜登为他的竞选和民主党筹集了3800万美元。民主党巨额捐赠者也纷纷表态支持他。\n\n对冲基金经理乔治‧索罗斯（George Soros）向Future Forward PAC捐赠了500万美元。\n\n前谷歌首席执行官埃里克‧施密特（Eric Schmidt）和房地产开发商赫伯特‧西蒙（Herbert Simon）最近几周向拜登的竞选团队和民主党捐赠了六位数的捐款。\n\n拜登6月在洛杉矶与前总统奥巴马一起举行了一场盛大的筹款活动，并从电影制片人J‧J‧亚伯拉罕（JJ Abrams）和女演员朱莉娅‧罗伯茨（Julia Roberts）等好莱坞明星处获得了超过3,000万美元的捐款。\n\n房地产投资者韦恩‧乔丹（Wayne Jordan）、慈善家奎因‧德莱尼（Quinn Delaney）和菲利普‧芒格（Philip Munger）也在6月进行了捐赠。\n\n菲利普‧芒格是沃伦‧巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的长期商业伙伴、已故老友查尔斯‧芒格（Charles Munger）的儿子。\n\n川普团队\n\n川普和共和党全国委员会在5月份筹集了3.31亿美元，没有透露现金总额。MAGA（Make America Great Again Inc.）超级政治行动委员会将于周六公布下一份报告。\n\n在因"封口费"案而被判有罪后，川普在5月底迎来一场筹款热潮。\n\n除了在线筹集的数百万美元外，黑石集团首席执行官苏世民（Stephen Schwarzman）、私募股权资深人士约翰‧查尔兹（John Childs）和脸书前副总裁、风险投资公司Social Capital的查马斯‧帕利哈皮蒂亚（Chamath Palihapitiya）等金融行业人士也在判决后的第二天，为川普的竞选团队和共和党开出六位数的支票。\n\n川普还从全球最大激进基金之一埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Investment Management LP）的亿万富翁创始人保罗‧辛格（Paul Singer）获得了接近42万美元捐款。\n\n家装巨头家得宝（Home Depot）联合创始人伯尼‧马库斯（Bernie Marcus）、加密货币双胞胎亿万富翁梅隆‧文克莱沃斯（Cameron Winklevoss）和泰勒（Tyler Winklevoss），以及家居建筑材料公司ABC Supply Co.的亿万富翁老板黛安‧亨德里克斯（Diane Hendricks）都捐赠了资金。\n\n川普的两个辅助捐赠组织 -- -- Right for America和America PAC报告他们获得了巨额捐款。\n\n漫威娱乐前董事长艾萨克‧珀尔马特（Isaac Perlmutter）和他的妻子琳达（Linda Perlmutter）分别向Right for America捐赠了500万美元。\n\nAmerica PAC在第二季度筹集了880万美元。帕兰提尔科技（Palantir Technologies）联合创始人乔‧朗斯代尔（Joe Lonsdale）和加密币文克莱沃斯兄弟（Winklevosses）是该组织的其他大捐助者之一。\n\n责任编辑：林妍#', 'source': {'uri': 'epochtimes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The {'uri': '8230431617', 'lang': 'deu', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:29:52', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:29:52Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:29:24Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.ad-hoc-news.de/politik/bayerns-ministerpraesident-markus-soeder-hat-die-bedeutung-der-presse-fuer/65462193', 'title': 'Bayerns Ministerpräsident Markus Söder hat die Bedeutung der Presse für die Gesellschaft hervorge', 'body': '"Ohne Verlage, ohne freie Presse gibt es tatsächlich keine Demokratie", sagte der CSU-Chef in München vor Vertretern von Zeitschriftenverlagen. Die Branche sei angesichts der Digitalisierung und Social Media herausgefordert wie noch nie.\n\nSöder sicherte den Zeitschriftenverlagen erneut seine Unterstützung bei finanziellen Hilfen zu: Die von der Branche geforderte Senkung der Mehrwertsteuer auf ihre Produkte sei dafür am einfachsten. "Wenn es hilft, gerne", bekräftigte Söder. Zugleich ermahnte er die Branche aber angesichts des Umbruchs im Mediengeschäft: Die Kunst sei, sich in den Wandel einzubringen und ihn mitzugestalten.\n\nVerlage erwarten seit Jahren erfolglos eine Förderung bei den gestiegenen Kosten der Zustellung gedruckter Zeitungen. Die Branche setzt daher unter anderem auf die weitere Reduzierung des Mehrwertsteuersatzes für gedruckte und digitale Angebote der Verlage.\n\nDer Vorstandsvorsitzende des Medienverbands der freien Presse (MVFP), Philipp Welte, betonte für die vom Verband vertretene Zeitschriftenbranche, die Digitalisierung habe "zu sehr ungleichen Wettbewerbsbedingungen geführt". Die großen Internetplattformen wie Google, Amazon und der Facebook-Konzern Meta würden mit ihrer Macht willkürlich über die Sichtbarkeit von Marken und Themen entscheiden - und damit über die Einnahmen der Verlage. Das erschwere es massiv, "hochwertigen Journalismus im 21. Jahrhundert marktwirtschaftlich zu finanzieren", sagte Burda-Manager Welte.\n\nDer Erste Vorsitzende des MFVP in Bayern, Horst Ohligschläger, sagte: "Die Freiheit der Presse beginnt bei der wirtschaftlichen Unabhängigkeit." Diese Unabhängigkeit sei aktuell bedroht. Der MFVP organisiert im Freistaat die Interessen von rund 100 bayerischen Zeitschriftenhäusern.', 'source': {'uri': 'ad-hoc-news.de', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Ad Hoc News'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.ad-hoc-news.de/img/logos/ahn-logo.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458933392, 'relevance': 3}

'sim': 0.5215686559677124, 'url': 'https://www.epochtimes.com/b5/24/7/17/n14292694.htm', 'title': '總統競選升溫 億萬富翁紛紛為拜登川普注資 | 美國總統大選 | 超級政治行動委員會 | 大紀元', 'body': '【大紀元2024年07月17日訊】（大紀元記者林燕綜合報導）隨著美國總統2024年競選活動升溫，億萬富翁們分別為民主黨推定總統候選人拜登和共和黨總統候選人川普注資。\n\n自上週六（7月13日）躲過暗殺以來，前美國總統川普（特朗普）的競選團隊已經收到大量來自巨額捐贈者的資金。另一邊，拜登總統也同樣獲得一些億萬富翁的力挺。\n\n因暗殺事件短暫休戰兩天後，雙方再次進入選戰狀態，共和黨本週舉行全國代表大會，民主黨將在8月召開全國代表大會。可以預計，接下來拜登與川普之間的競選活動會更加激烈。\n\n各競選團隊和政黨的大型籌款機構以及一些關鍵的超級政治行動委員會於週一（7月15日）向聯邦選舉委員會提交了季度報告，截止時間是6月底。以下是彭博社的報導：\n\n拜登團隊\n\n拜登和民主黨在第二季度籌集了2.63億美元，手頭有2.4億美元現金。拜登的第二季度籌款額超過川普。支持拜登的大型民主黨超級政治行動委員會，包括Future Forward PAC和American Bridge，要到週六（7月20日）才會公布報告。\n\n6月份，拜登籌集了1.27億美元，而川普籌集了1.12億美元。\n\n從6月27日第一次總統辯論會到6月底，拜登為他的競選和民主黨籌集了3800萬美元。民主黨巨額捐贈者也紛紛表態支持他。\n\n對沖基金經理喬治‧索羅斯（George Soros）向Future Forward PAC捐贈了500萬美元。\n\n前谷歌首席執行官埃里克‧施密特（Eric Schmidt）和房地產開發商赫伯特‧西蒙（Herbert Simon）最近幾週向拜登的競選團隊和民主黨捐贈了六位數的捐款。\n\n拜登6月在洛杉磯與前總統奧巴馬一起舉行了一場盛大的籌款活動，並從電影製片人J‧J‧亞伯拉罕（JJ Abrams）和女演員朱莉婭‧羅伯茨（Julia Roberts）等好萊塢明星處獲得了超過3,000萬美元的捐款。\n\n房地產投資者韋恩‧喬丹（Wayne Jordan）、慈善家奎因‧德萊尼（Quinn Delaney）和菲利普‧芒格（Philip Munger）也在6月進行了捐贈。\n\n菲利普‧芒格是沃倫‧巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的長期商業夥伴、已故老友查爾斯‧芒格（Charles Munger）的兒子。\n\n川普團隊\n\n川普和共和黨全國委員會在5月份籌集了3.31億美元，沒有透露現金總額。MAGA（Make America Great Again Inc.）超級政治行動委員會將於週六公布下一份報告。\n\n在因「封口費」案而被判有罪後，川普在5月底迎來一場籌款熱潮。\n\n除了在線籌集的數百萬美元外，黑石集團首席執行官蘇世民（Stephen Schwarzman）、私募股權資深人士約翰‧查爾茲（John Childs）和臉書前副總裁、風險投資公司Social Capital的查馬斯‧帕利哈皮蒂亞（Chamath Palihapitiya）等金融行業人士也在判決後的第二天，為川普的競選團隊和共和黨開出六位數的支票。\n\n川普還從全球最大激進基金之一埃利奧特管理公司（Elliott Investment Management LP）的億萬富翁創始人保羅‧辛格（Paul Singer）獲得了接近42萬美元捐款。\n\n家裝巨頭家得寶（Home Depot）聯合創始人伯尼‧馬庫斯（Bernie Marcus）、加密貨幣雙胞胎億萬富翁梅隆‧文克萊沃斯（Cameron Winklevoss）和泰勒（Tyler Winklevoss），以及家居建築材料公司ABC Supply Co.的億萬富翁老闆黛安‧亨德里克斯（Diane Hendricks）都捐贈了資金。\n\n川普的兩個輔助捐贈組織 -- -- Right for America和America PAC報告他們獲得了巨額捐款。\n\n漫威娛樂前董事長艾薩克‧珀爾馬特（Isaac Perlmutter）和他的妻子琳達（Linda Perlmutter）分別向Right for America捐贈了500萬美元。\n\nAmerica PAC在第二季度籌集了880萬美元。帕蘭提爾科技（Palantir Technologies）聯合創始人喬‧朗斯代爾（Joe Lonsdale）和加密幣文克萊沃斯兄弟（Winklevosses）是該組織的其他大捐助者之一。\n\n責任編輯：林妍#', 'source': {'uri': 'epochtimes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The Il Dow è in controtendenza, balzando ai massimi storici.\n\nScendendo nei dettagli, Bloomberg ha scritto che l'amministrazione Biden sta valutando la possibilità di utilizzare le restrizioni commerciali più severe disponibili se le aziende, tra cui ASML, continuano a concedere alla Cina l'accesso alla tecnologia avanzata dei semiconduttori. Nel frattempo, una posizione anti-cinese è in cima all'agenda del candidato repubblicano Donald Trump, che in un'intervista con Bloomberg Businessweek si è chiesto se gli Stati Uniti abbiano il dovere di difendere Taiwan, importante centro di produzione di chip.\n\nSul fronte macroeconomico, la produzione industriale e manifatturiera negli Stati Uniti è aumentata più delle attese nel mese di giugno; inoltre, sono cresciuti più delle previsioni i i nuovi cantieri avviati e i permessi edilizi rilasciati dalle autorità competenti; infine, sono tornate a crescere le domande di mutuo negli Stati Uniti nell'ultima settimana.\n\nPer quanto riguarda le trimestrali, Johnson & Johnson ha abbassato la guidance sull'EPS per l'intero anno 2024 per riflettere i costi associati alle recenti acquisizioni; U.S. Bancorp ha registrato un calo dell'utile nel secondo trimestre, anche per una discesa dell'NII.\n\nGuardando ai principali indici di Wall Street, il Dow Jones è in rialzo dello 0,55%, continuando la scia rialzista evidenziata da sei guadagni consecutivi, innescata mercoledì scorso, mentre, al contrario, giornata negativa per l'S&P-500, che continua la seduta a 5.595 punti, in calo dell'1,27%. Depresso il Nasdaq 100 (-2,62%); come pure, in discesa l'S&P 100 (-1,46%).\n\nIn buona evidenza nell'S&P 500 i comparti beni di consumo per l'ufficio (+1,41%), energia (+0,98%) e finanziario (+0,65%). Nella parte bassa della classifica dell'S&P 500, sensibili ribassi si manifestano nei comparti informatica (-3,48%), telecomunicazioni (-1,90%) e beni di consumo secondari (-1,76%).\n\nAl top tra i giganti di Wall Street, United Health (+3,93%), Johnson & Johnson (+3,80%), Intel (+2,29%) e Chevron (+2,13%).\n\nLe più forti vendite, invece, si manifestano su Amazon, che prosegue le contrattazioni a -3,33%. Sotto pressione Apple, con un forte ribasso del 2,73%. Soffre Salesforce, che evidenzia una perdita del 2,41%. Preda dei venditori Microsoft, con un decremento del 2,05%.\n\nTra i best performers del Nasdaq 100, Globalfoundries (+7,07%), Xcel Energy (+3,25%), PepsiCo (+2,90%) e Exelon (+2,77%).\n\nLe più forti vendite, invece, si manifestano su ASML Holding, che prosegue le contrattazioni a -11,80%. Vendite a piene mani su Marvell Technology, che soffre un decremento dell'8,96%. Pessima performance per Advanced Micro Devices, che registra un ribasso dell'8,77%. {'uri': '8230427132', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:26:38', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:26:38Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:25:51Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://calgary.citynews.ca/2024/07/17/group-in-charge-of-googles-100m-for-news-outlets-lays-out-its-governance-model/', 'title': "Group in charge of Google's $100M for news outlets lays out its governance model", 'body': 'The group Google asked to distribute $100 million to news outlets in Canada has publicly released its governance model, which it says focuses on sustainability, equity and innovation within the industry.\n\nThe Canadian Journalism Collective submitted plans to Canada\'s broadcasting regulator this week outlining the structure of the board that will ultimately oversee the funds. That submission was made public on Wednesday.\n\nThe Canada Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission requested the information as part of the public consultations to enforce the Online News Act, which compels tech companies to enter into agreements with news publishers for the use of their content.\n\nThe collective has had limited time to develop this novel framework under a law that is being closely watched by other countries that want to implement something similar, including the United States.\n\nIt will ultimately be up to the CRTC to determine if the collective\'s plan meets its expectations. If the governance model is satisfactory, then the CRTC will grant Google an exemption from the law.\n\nThis is a pivotal step as the journalism industry comes together to ensure the money is distributed equally, regardless of the business model or self-interest of any individual media outlet.\n\nThe CJC says its board will be compromised of 19 directors, including eight members representing publishers, eight members representing broadcasters and three independent members.\n\nRequirements for the 19 positions include ensuring there is representation from large and small media outlets, startups, non-profit outlets and Indigenous, Black, racialized, francophone and official language minority groups.\n\nThe governance model also includes two separate councils, which would make recommendations on behalf of publishers and broadcasters, as well as an executive committee that would appoint non-voting advisers to the board.\n\nCBC, which is guaranteed up to $7 million from the pot of money, will have a seat on the board and executive committee, but its representative will sit as an observer without any voting powers.\n\nThe collective also intends to appoint an ombudsman to whom the public and board can voice concerns, and a dispute resolution committee that would have the power to investigate grievances.\n\n"The proposed high-level governance structure that the CJC-CCJ has submitted to the CRTC seeks to implement the Act and regulations by promoting sustainability, equity and innovation in the Canadian news ecosystem," Jean La Rose, a spokesperson and interim board director of the collective, said in a statement.\n\nThe governance structure will allow each member to have equal representation and encompass all types of news organizations, small and large, urban and rural, La Rose said.\n\nLast year, Google agreed to keep news on its search engine and pay Canadian news publishers $100 million annually, indexed to inflation, in order to be exempt from the Online News Act.\n\nOnce Google gets an exemption, the company is set to deliver the money within 60 days to the collective, which would then elect its board and distribute the money to eligible news outlets.\n\n"Our submission is the first step in outlining how the CJC-CCJ will establish policies and procedures that meet objectives and maintain the highest standards of integrity, independence, transparency and accountability," La Rose said.\n\n"Our governance structure includes at-large and independent roles and officers to foster the trust of the Canadian public."\n\nThis structure would continue to be shaped throughout the CRTC consultation and through engagement with stakeholders, the collective said.\n\nIt also promises to support emerging news organizations, smaller media markets and innovative business models while ensuring marketplace fairness.\n\n"As the digital news environment and consumer behaviours shift, no one existing business model should be disproportionately represented at the expense of innovation, sustainability and geographic outreach," the submission to the CRTC reads.\n\nThe collective was founded in May by an interim group of publishers and broadcasters that represent French-language, community and Indigenous news, along with outlets that specifically represent Black and under-represented Canadians.\n\nGoogle chose the CJC to handle the media money, saying in a blog post last month that its principles were in alignment with the company\'s. Those included diversity, a robust government structure, a high level of transparency and assurance that as much funding as possible would go to news organizations.\n\nA second collective led by big media players, called the Online News Media Collective, lost out in Google\'s selection process.\n\nEarlier this year, Google put out an open call to news organizations that wish to receive compensation under the Online News Act, and about 1,500 outlets applied for the cash.\n\nThe collective will eventually review all news publishers that responded to the open call, and distribute the funds to publishers that meet the criteria as laid out in the law and regulations.\n\nThe money will be distributed proportionately based on how many full time-journalists the companies employ.', 'source': {'uri': 'calgary.citynews.ca', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'CityNews Calgary'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://calgary.citynews.ca/wp-content/blogs.dir/sites/8/2024/07/c59d56eb-2648-4edb-a6b8-93ff0f1f32c9.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.223529411764706, 'wgt': 458933198, 'relevance': 51}

{'uri': '8230421970', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:21:56', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:21:56Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:21:27Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.4823529422283173, 'url': 'https://www.montevideo.com.uy/Negocios-y-Tendencias/Banco-Santander-y-Google-estrenan-un-curso-gratuito-en-Inteligencia-Artificial-uc894345', 'title': 'Banco Santander y Google estrenan un curso gratuito en Inteligencia Artificial', 'body': 'Banco Santander y Google alcanzaron un acuerdo para ofrecer formación gratuita en Inteligencia Artificial (IA) destinada a mayores de 18 años de cualquier país.\n\nEl curso Santander | Google: Inteligencia Artificial y Productividad, que se estrenó en la plataforma Santander Open Academy en español, inglés y portugués, permite a los usuarios aprovechar el potencial que ofrece esta tecnología para aplicarlo tanto en su vida laboral como personal. Mejorar la productividad, adquirir conocimientos básicos y desarrollar las habilidades necesarias para automatizar tareas, generar ideas y resolver problemas de forma más eficiente, son algunos de los resultados obtenidos con esta formación.\n\nPara Rafael Hernández, director global adjunto de Santander Universidades, "está fuera de toda duda que la IA está revolucionando nuestro día a día, especialmente los entornos laborales, con un impacto directo en la creación de nuevas oportunidades y perfiles profesionales. Este curso supone una importante aportación de herramientas para mejorar competencias profesionales, generando una mayor competitividad laboral y una adaptación efectiva a las demandas del mercado actual y futuro".\n\n"Estamos muy contentos de asociarnos con Banco Santander para ofrecer esta formación gratuita y accesible sobre IA a cualquier persona, en cualquier lugar del mundo", dijo Cova Soto, directora de Marketing de Google España y Portugal. "Esta colaboración refleja nuestro compromiso compartido de democratizar la educación en IA y empoderar a las personas con las habilidades que necesitan para prosperar en la era digital. Creemos que al hacer que el conocimiento y las herramientas de IA estén disponibles para todas las personas, podemos desbloquear nuevas oportunidades para el crecimiento personal y profesional", añadió.\n\nContenido del curso\n\nEl curso ofrecido por Banco Santander y Google está diseñado para ser accesible a todos, independientemente de su experiencia técnica previa. Se imparte en un lenguaje sencillo y directo, facilitando la comprensión de los conceptos fundamentales de la IA y su creciente influencia en el mundo laboral. Los participantes adquieren las siguientes habilidades y conocimientos:\n\nFundamentos de la IA: Comprenden los principios básicos de la inteligencia artificial y cómo está transformando diversos sectores.\n\nAplicaciones prácticas de la IA: Aprenden a utilizar herramientas de IA como Gemini, de Google, para optimizar su productividad en el trabajo diario.\n\nCreación de peticiones efectivas: Desarrollan la capacidad de generar peticiones claras y precisas para obtener los mejores resultados de las herramientas de IA.\n\nEste curso es una oportunidad única para que profesionales de todos los ámbitos se familiaricen con la IA y adquieran habilidades prácticas para aprovechar su potencial en su vida laboral. Al finalizar, los usuarios reciben un certificado que acredita la formación recibida.\n\nLa formación cuenta con plazas ilimitadas y se podrá solicitar hasta el 31 de diciembre en la web de Santander Open Academy.\n\nSantander y su apoyo a la educación, la empleabilidad y el emprendimiento\n\nBanco Santander mantiene una apuesta pionera y consolidada por la educación, la empleabilidad y el emprendimiento, que desarrolla desde hace más de 27 años y le distingue del resto de entidades financieras del mundo. El banco ha destinado más de 2.300 millones de euros y ha apoyado a más de 1,5 millones de personas y empresas a través de acuerdos con más de 1.200 universidades.\n\nA través de Santander Open Academy, ofrece acceso a un amplio abanico de formación para la mejorara de competencias con cursos 100% subvencionados, contenidos formativos gratuitos y becas con universidades e instituciones líderes de todo el mundo. Además, ha sido reconocida como una de las empresas que más están contribuyendo a cambiar el mundo a mejor, según la lista de la revista de la revista Fortune \'Change the World\' 2023 (www.santander.com/universidades).\n\nMontevideo Portal', 'source': {'uri': 'montevideo.com.uy', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Montevideo Portal / Montevideo COMM'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'montevideo_portal@montevideo.com.uy', 'name': 'Montevideo Portal', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://imagenes.montevideo.com.uy/imgnoticias/202407/_W933_80/888403.jpg', 'eventUri': 'spa-3546506', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458932916, 'relevance': 68}

Bien que les actions aient connu une hausse de 11 % depuis le dernier rapport sur les résultats, l\'analyste estime que les prochains résultats trimestriels, bien qu\'ils ne constituent pas un catalyseur important, démontreront la trajectoire de croissance soutenue de l\'entreprise.\n\nL\'analyste a souligné que, malgré les perspectives positives, il pourrait y avoir de légères révisions des estimations du bénéfice par action (BPA).
