{'uri': '8230347400', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:26:22', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:26:22Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:24:22Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.infobae.com/noticias/2024/07/17/en-el-cierre-de-los-mercados-aex-se-ubica-en-terreno-negativo-este-17-de-julio/', 'title': 'En el cierre de los mercados, AEX se ubica en terreno negativo este 17 de julio', 'body': 'Un índice bursátil es un indicador que muestra cómo se modifica el precio de un determinado conjunto de activos, por lo que recolecta datos de diferentes empresas o sectores de un fragmento del mercado.\n\nEstos indicadores son empleados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de distintos países del mundo y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por firmas con diferentes especificidades como podría ser disponer de una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a al mismo tipo de industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo toman en cuenta un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.\n\nLos índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de la confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una empresa. Generalmente, si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los costos de las acciones tienden a caer.\n\nAsimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores hacer una comparativa entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.\n\nEste tipo de indicadores comenzaron a utilizarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. observara con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios\n\nActualmente existen diversos índices y pueden aglomerarse en función de su ubicación geográfica, los sectores, el tamaño de las compañías o incluso el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías en gran medida relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).\n\nCada índice bursátil posee su propia forma de ser medido, pero el principal componente es la capitalización bursátil de cada compañía que lo integra. Este se saca al multiplicar el valor del día de la acción en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en el mercado.\n\nLas compañías que aparecen en bolsa están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho informe debe hacerse público cada tres o seis meses, según corresponda.\n\nLeer un índice bursátil también requiere observar sus variaciones en el tiempo. Los índices actuales siempre comienzan con un valor fijo basado en los precios de las acciones en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede llevar a engaño.\n\nSi un índice se potencia en 500 puntos en un día, mientras que otro solo consigue 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo una rentabilidad mejor. Sin embargo, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede deducir que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron más grandes.\n\nEn Asia, los principales índices bursátiles son el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Se encuentra, además, el SSE Composite Index, que figura como el más notable de China, conformado por las compañías más destacadas de la Bolsa de Shanghái. El mismo papel que interpretan el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.\n\nDe igual manera, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.\n\nDe igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.', 'source': {'uri': 'infobae.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'infobae'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.infobae.com/new-resizer/LC9mUpD-JUYzudF--I1kkvnZObs=/1200x630/filters:format(webp):quality(85)/cloudfront-us-east-1.images.arcpublishing.com/infobae/LCRVRMR23FFTPPVGXRNHM272T4.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458929582, 'relevance': 34}
{'uri': '8230347397', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:26:19', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:26:19Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:24:22Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.infobae.com/noticias/2024/07/17/atx-cerro-operaciones-a-la-baja-este-17-de-julio/', 'title': 'ATX cerró operaciones a la baja este 17 de julio', 'body': 'Con respecto a los últimos siete días, el ATX registra una subida del 0,22%%, por lo que en términos interanuales mantiene aún un ascenso del 14,81%. El ATX se sitúa un 2,67% por debajo de su máximo del presente año (3.775,49 puntos) y un 10,45% por encima de su cotización mínima en lo que va de año (3.327,04 puntos).\n\nUn índice bursátil es un indicador que muestra cómo cambia el valor de un conjunto de activos determinado, para lo cual toma datos de distintas compañías o sectores de un fragmento del mercado.\n\nEstos indicadores son empleados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de cada país y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por empresas con requisitos concretos como podría ser tener una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a la misma industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo consideran un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.\n\nLos índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de la confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una entidad. Generalmente, si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los costos de las acciones tendrían tendencia a caer.\n\nAsimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores tener comparaciones entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.\n\nEste tipo de indicadores comenzaron a utilizarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. observara con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios\n\nHoy en día en nuestra economía existen diversos índices y pueden juntarse en función de su localización, los sectores, el tamaño de las compañías o también el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías en gran medida relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).\n\nCada índice bursátil posee su propio método de cálculo, pero el principal factor es la capitalización bursátil de cada empresa que lo integra. Este se obtiene al multiplicar el valor del día del título en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en circulación en el mercado.\n\nLas firmas que figuran en la bolsa están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho reporte debe hacerse público cada tres o seis meses, según sea el caso.\n\nLeer un índice bursátil también implica examinar sus cambios en el tiempo. Los nuevos índices siempre abren con un valor fijo basado en los precios de los valores en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede ser fuente de equívocos.\n\nSi un índice crece 500 puntos en un día, mientras que otro solo añade 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo una rentabilidad mejor. No obstante, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede suponer que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron mayores.\n\nEn Asia, los principales índices bursátiles son el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Asimismo, el SSE Composite Index, es visto como el más sólido de China, conformado por las compañías más relevantes de la Bolsa de Shanghái. De igual manera, cabe mencionar el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.\n\nFinalmente, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.\n\nDe igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.', 'source': {'uri': 'infobae.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'infobae'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.infobae.com/new-resizer/3TCCICky8iQm4LJOAF6Vjp_fnfc=/1200x630/filters:format(webp):quality(85)/cloudfront-us-east-1.images.arcpublishing.com/infobae/HTQ4RMTAM5GCNGLMWUXFEV7WX4.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458929579, 'relevance': 31}
{'uri': '8230348694', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:26:10', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:26:10Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:25:19Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/exclusive-apax-bain-and-cvc-exploring-potential-bids-softwareone-sources-say-4486546', 'title': 'Exclusive-Apax, Bain and CVC exploring potential bids for SoftwareOne, sources say', 'body': "LONDON : Apax Partners, Bain Capital and CVC are each exploring potential bids for SoftwareOne, two people with knowledge of the situation said, three months after the ouster of the Swiss software company's board.\n\nTalks with interested funds are ongoing, one of the people said. Four sources mentioned Bain and CVC and two of them also named Apax.\n\nSoftwareOne's board was ousted in April after it rejected a 2.9 billion Swiss franc ($3.27 billion) takeover offer by Bain.\n\nApax, Bain and CVC declined to comment. A spokesperson for SoftwareOne declined to comment and referred to a statement issued in May, when the company said it had been approached by several bidders.\n\nIn May, at the time of its first quarter 2024 trading update, the company said the board had been approached by several parties regarding a potential going-private transaction but didn't provide names.\n\nJefferies is advising the board on the matter, a fifth person with knowledge of the matter said. All five people were speaking on condition of anonymity because the talks are private. Jefferies did not immediately reply to a request for comment.\n\nEarlier this year, founding shareholders Daniel von Stockar, Rene Gilli and B. Curti Holding, who own nearly a third of SoftwareOne stock, won a vote to oust most of the existing board after it had resisted a sale to Bain.\n\nAnalysts and investors believed the move would once again make the company a likely takeover target.\n\nSoftwareOne rejected multiple offers from Bain over the course of last year, saying they provided neither sufficient certainty, nor reflected the value of the company.\n\nSoftwareOne has more than 9000 employees and assists companies to buy and manage software from other providers such as Microsoft (MSFT.O), SAP (SAPG.DE), and Adobe (ADBE.O).", 'source': {'uri': 'channelnewsasia.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'CNA'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://onecms-res.cloudinary.com/image/upload/s--XmKQ2yud--/fl_relative,g_south_east,l_mediacorp:cna:watermark:2024-04:reuters_1,w_0.1/f_auto,q_auto/c_fill,g_auto,h_676,w_1200/v1/one-cms/core/2024-07-17t161518z_1_lynxmpek6g0nb_rtroptp_3_envestnet-m-a-bain-capital.jpg?itok=EPnxMplO', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.01960784313725483, 'wgt': 458929570, 'relevance': 3}

For instance, $30 million has been invested in a data trust center in Ciudad Arce.\n\nThis initiative will create over 4,000 jobs. At the center's opening, U.S. Ambassador William Duncan showed support, highlighting its potential to boost the local economy.\n\nIn agriculture, Bukele aims to remove tariffs on 116 essential food items for ten years. This policy will help keep food prices low and stable, battling long-term inflation.\n\nTechnology also plays a key role. Bukele wants to transform El Salvador into a regional tech hub.\n\nHe seeks partnerships with major tech companies like Google, aiming to position the nation at the forefront of technological innovation.\n\nMoreover, the plan includes expanding the Port of Acajutla to promote fishing and tourism. It also involves reopening the Pacific train service to improve regional connectivity.\n\nAdditionally, plans for the country's first green airport are underway, which will boost air travel and economic activities in the eastern regions.\n\nFinancially, Bukele's government is negotiating with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). These talks are crucial for managing the fiscal issues arising from Bitcoin's adoption as legal tender.\n\nSecurity remains a priority too. The Territorial Control Plan targets reducing gang influence, which has historically hampered economic growth through extortion.\n\nBukele's comprehensive strategy aims to rejuvenate El Salvador's economy and strengthen its role in Central America's economic scene.", 'source': {'uri': 'riotimesonline.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The Rio Times'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'juan_martinez@riotimesonline.com', 'name': 'Juan Martinez', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://www.riotimesonline.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/El-Salvador.webp', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.2705882352941176, 'wgt': 458929527, 'relevance': 34}

Κυβέρνηση και το Υπουργείο Ναυτιλίας και Νησιωτικής πολιτικής απαντούν με "nonpaper",υιοθετώντας αυτούσια σχεδόν τη \'\'γραμμή\'\' των ακτοοπλόων περί ελάχιστων αυξήσεων, \'\'ψελλίζοντας\'\' {'uri': '2024-07-425046139', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:24:52', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:24:52Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T12:00:19Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.etftrends.com/model-portfolio-channel/signs-abound-big-companies-big-ai-believers/', 'title': 'Signs Abound That Big Companies Are Big AI Believers |', 'body': 'Amid concerns about intensifying regulatory scrutiny, Apple (AAPL) and Microsoft (MSFT) abandoned board seats at generative AI leader OpenAI, the parent company of ChatGPT. That might sound alarming to novice investors. But prior to fretting too much, market participants should consider other factors.\n\nApple and Microsoft leaving the OpenAI board notwithstanding, large companies remain devoted AI backers. This signals that they see long-term merit in this disruptive technology. That\'s noteworthy for investors considering ETFs like the WisdomTree Artificial Intelligence and innovation Fund (WTAI).\n\nWTAI, which turns three years old in December, is home to many of the large- and mega-cap stocks investors most readily associate with AI. But the ETF offers diversification advantages in that it\'s not excessively allocated to a small number of names. In fact, ARM Holdings (ARM) -- the ETF\'s largest holding -- commands just 3.25% of the fund\'s weight. Still, WTAI is levered to the theme of big-name corporations making big artificial intelligence investments.\n\nAI Chip Deals Flourishing\n\nWTAI is home to an array of semiconductor stocks -- nine of its top 15 holdings hail from that industry. That\'s pertinent to investors because the chip space is an epicenter of artificial intelligence investments.\n\nOn July 10, Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) said it\'s shelling out $665 million to acquire Finnish AI startup Silo AI in another sign of the buyer\'s efforts to better compete with rival Nvidia (NVDA). Both Nvidia and AMD are top 10 holdings in WTAI.\n\n"Silo AI\'s team of trusted AI experts and proven experience developing leadership AI models and solutions, including state-of-the-art LLMs built on AMD platforms, will further accelerate our AI strategy and advance the build-out and rapid implementation of AI solutions for our global customers," said Vamsi Boppana, senior vice president of the artificial intelligence Group at AMD, said in a news release.\n\nEnthusiasm Abounds for AI\'s Long-Term Prospects\n\nKeeping with the theme of AI chips, reports surfaced on July 12 that Japan\'s SoftBank Group -- the company that previously held a majority stake in ARM -- acquired U.K.-based chipmaker Graphcore. Financial terms of that deal weren\'t disclosed. But it\'s worth noting Graphcore was also once viewed as a potential rival to Nvidia.\n\nNeither Softbank nor Graphcore are WTAI holdings. But that transaction, coupled with AMD\'s Silo AI purchase, are two examples that large tech companies and big-name investors remain enthusiastic about AI\'s long-term prospects. And they\'re willing to allocate capital to that effect. They have the capital to do that. For example, some WTAI holdings are among the most cash-rich U.S. companies.\n\nFor more news, information, and analysis, visit the Modern Alpha Channel.\n\nThis article was prepared as part of WisdomTree\'s general paid sponsorship of VettaFi | ETF Trends. Cuatro fuentes mencionaron a Bain y CVC y dos de ellas también nombraron a Apax.\n\nEl consejo de administración de SoftwareOne fue destituido en abril tras rechazar una oferta de adquisición de 2.900 millones de francos suizos (3.270 millones de dólares) presentada por Bain.\n\nApax, Bain y CVC declinaron hacer comentarios. Un portavoz de SoftwareOne declinó hacer comentarios y se remitió a un comunicado emitido en mayo, cuando la empresa dijo que se le habían acercado varios licitadores.\n\nEn mayo, en el momento de su actualización comercial del primer trimestre de 2024, la empresa dijo que el consejo había sido contactado por varias partes en relación con una potencial transacción de salida a bolsa, pero no proporcionó nombres.\n\nJefferies está asesorando a la junta sobre el asunto, dijo una quinta persona con conocimiento del asunto. Las cinco personas hablaron bajo condición de anonimato porque las conversaciones son privadas. Jefferies no respondió inmediatamente a una solicitud de comentarios.\n\nA principios de este año, los accionistas fundadores Daniel von Stockar, Rene Gilli y B. Curti Holding, que poseen casi un tercio de las acciones de SoftwareOne, ganaron una votación para expulsar a la mayor parte del consejo existente después de que éste se hubiera resistido a una venta a Bain.\n\nLos analistas y los inversores creían que la medida convertiría de nuevo a la empresa en un objetivo probable de adquisición.\n\nSoftwareOne rechazó múltiples ofertas de Bain en el transcurso del año pasado, alegando que no proporcionaban la suficiente seguridad ni reflejaban el valor de la empresa.\n\nSoftwareOne cuenta con más de 9.000 empleados y ayuda a las empresas a comprar y gestionar software de otros proveedores como Microsoft (MSFT.O), SAP (SAPG.DE) y Adobe (ADBE.O). {'uri': '8230341176', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:21:31', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:21:31Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:20:08Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.572549045085907, 'url': 'https://www.theepochtimes.com/opinion/humanity-needs-to-get-a-grip-on-ai-5688364', 'title': 'Humanity Needs to Get a Grip on AI', 'body': 'The old adage that we should "begin with the end in mind" is still great advice, especially when it comes to new technology.\n\nConsider the invention of the lightbulb and the widespread electrification of society. Here was a technology with a clear and unambiguous purpose -- to illuminate a world that went dark when the sun went down.\n\n"The days of my youth extend backward to the dark ages," observed British inventor Joseph Swan, one of the first men to successfully harness electric light. "Common people, wanting the inducement of indoor brightness ... went to bed soon after sunset."\n\nSwan\'s prototype was a model for Thomas Edison\'s far more successful lightbulb. It set off a technological revolution that unleashed great benefits to society, even if it inconvenienced a few candle makers.\n\nToday\'s technological revolution -- the rapid advance of artificial intelligence (AI) -- displays no such clarity of purpose. As we race to create new uses for AI throughout the economy, no one seems to know exactly where we\'re going, or what the world will look like when we get there.\n\nEven Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI and a key player in the AI revolution, is disturbingly flippant and honest about this reality. Last year he told TIME magazine that, "No one knows what happens next."\n\nAI could pose a threat to the future of humanity itself -- we simply don\'t know. While current concerns about AI revolve around deepfake videos and autonomous vehicles, we need to realize there are much greater issues at stake.\n\nExperts such as philosopher Amanda Askell suggest AI may soon be able to do "whatever intellectual work humans currently do." What happens when AI replaces not just factory workers and cashiers, but the CEO of the company as well?\n\nThere are serious consequences to replacing the entirety of human labour with machines, including a loss of self-esteem and life purpose as well as many economic considerations. The fundamental question we must ask ourselves is: does AI actually make humanity better off?\n\nFurther ethical dilemmas abound as we approach the not-so-distant shore of a world driven by AI. As machines become smarter, how do we ensure that they reflect human values? Technology optimists like to claim AI is purer and more objective than messy human morality, and will thus help us upgrade our deficient innate operating software: "I think the problem is that human values as they stand don\'t cut it," said Google Research executive Blaise Agüera y Arcas. "They\'re not good enough."\n\nAgüera y Arcas believes it is possible to use computer code to create a better moral framework than what humans can provide. But even then, someone has to decide how to build such a machine; who will train computers to be better than humans themselves? And what happens when some artificially intelligent machine achieves moral superiority to man? Are we to bow before our new digital masters?\n\nMeanwhile, AI research is being driven by the same tech culture which makes a virtue out of "breaking stuff" and "failing fast."\n\nAs AI scholar Kate Crawford points out, most AI development today goes on without any review or oversight of the ethics involved. We need to fix this. One way would be to require a regulatory framework for software developers modelled on the current system for professional engineers who design bridges and build roads. This would ensure those who build AI are instructed in the ethical implications of their work and held to account through strict standards and regulations.\n\nBut placing new restrictions on AI developers is only a first step. If we are going to truly grapple with the ethical considerations of our current AI revolution, society-at-large must come to terms with its own morality.\n\nBefore we can instruct a machine to act morally, we need to define what it means for a human to be moral. Unfortunately, it is apparent throughout the Western world today that there is no collective agreement on what is good. Our current political debates focus on identifying oppressors and oppressed, while ideologies like critical race theory encourage tribal identities. All this is a rejection of the West\'s Judeo-Christian foundations. Our confusion about the ethics of AI is thus a symptom of a deeper societal malaise.\n\nAmid the rise of artificial intelligence, it is paramount that we align our own values before trying to assign such values to machines.\n\nInstead of AI for AI\'s sake, we want AI for humanity\'s sake.', 'source': {'uri': 'theepochtimes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'www.theepochtimes.com'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://img.theepochtimes.com/assets/uploads/2024/06/11/id5666946-GettyImages-2006688844-LSedit-1080x720.jpg', 'eventUri': 'eng-9737280', 'sentiment': 0.4274509803921569, 'wgt': 458929291, 'relevance': 16}
{'uri': '8230341673', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:21:01', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:21:01Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:20:31Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://baynews9.com/fl/tampa/news/2024/07/17/carlos-watson-ozy-media-convicted', 'title': 'Carlos Watson convicted in trial over collapse of Ozy Media', 'body': 'Former TV personality Carlos Watson was convicted Tuesday in a federal financial conspiracy case about Ozy Media, an ambitious startup that collapsed after another executive impersonated a YouTube executive to hype the company\'s success.\n\nWatson, 53, had been free on bail but was taken into custody to await sentencing, set for Nov. 18.\n\nBrooklyn-based U.S. Attorney Breon Peace said the verdict held Watson accountable for "brazen crimes" that were meant to keep cash-strapped Ozy afloat but ultimately sank it.\n\n"The jury found that Watson was a con man who told lie upon lie upon lie to deceive investors into buying stock in his company," Peace said in a statement, adding that the company "collapsed under the weight of Watson\'s dishonest schemes."\n\nPeace\'s office said a jury found Watson guilty of all the charges against him: conspiracy to commit securities fraud, conspiracy to commit wire fraud and aggravated identity theft. Ozy Media also was convicted of the same conspiracy offenses, the only charges the company faced.\n\nWatson and Ozy had pleaded not guilty and denied the allegations. He testified that Ozy\'s cash squeezes were standard startup speed bumps and that materials given to investors noted that the information wasn\'t audited and could change -- "like \'buyer beware,\'" he said.\n\nThe defense blamed any misrepresentations on Ozy co-founder and chief operating officer Samir Rao, who has pleaded guilty.\n\nWatson and Ozy plan to appeal, lawyers Ronald Sullivan, Janine Gilbert and Shannon Frison said in a statement.\n\nWatson\'s relatives and supporters left court without commenting, but wearing black shirts emblazoned with, "Whose son is next?"\n\nWatson could face decades in prison, though sentencing guidelines for individual defendants vary. Now-defunct Ozy faces potential financial penalties.\n\nWatson, a cable news host who\'d worked on Wall Street and sold his own education-related startup, conceived of Ozy in 2012. The Mountain View, California-based company produced shows and gave "Ozy Genius" awards to college students. It interviewed former President Bill Clinton, won an Emmy Award and produced an annual music-and-ideas festival that President Joe Biden attended in 2017, when he was a former VP.\n\nBut prosecutors said that underneath Ozy\'s hip public profile, the company was tottering financially from 2018 on. It routinely ran short of money to pay vendors, rent and even employees and took out expensive loans against future receipts to cover its bills, former finance Vice President Janeen Poutre testified.\n\nThe prosecution and its key witnesses said Ozy, with Watson\'s blessing, began floating increasingly audacious lies to try to snag a lifeline from investors.\n\n"Survival within the bounds of decency, fairness, truth, it morphed into survival at all costs and by any means necessary," Rao told jurors, saying that Watson had sanctioned all his falsehoods.\n\nOzy gave much bigger revenue numbers to its prospective backers than to its accountants, with the discrepancy widening to $53 million versus $11.2 million for 2020, according to testimony and documents shown at trial.\n\nProsecutors said that the company claimed deals and offers it hadn\'t really secured -- for example, that Watson told a prospective investor that Google was willing to buy Ozy for hundreds of millions of dollars. Ozy\'s lawyer said Watson never made that claim.\n\nGoogle CEO Sundar Pichai testified there was no such offer, though he did contemplate hiring Watson and providing $25 million to help Ozy move on if he took the Google job.\n\nTo woo potential corporate suitors and lenders, Rao forged some terms of contracts with a network for one of Ozy\'s TV shows. Then, when a bank wanted to check with the network, Rao set up a fake email account for an actual network executive and sent a message offering information. The bank loan didn\'t happen.\n\nRao went on to pose as a YouTube executive on a phone call with investment bankers, in a bizarre effort to back up a false claim that Rao had made about YouTube paying for another Ozy show. The bankers got suspicious, their potential investment evaporated and the real YouTube exec soon learned of the ruse.\n\nWatson\'s lawyers hammered on Rao\'s admissions about his own conduct to try to portray him as a liar trying to avoid prison by pleasing prosecutors. Rao is awaiting sentencing.\n\nWatson, who hosted multiple Ozy shows and podcasts, told jurors he concentrated on the company\'s content, staff, vision and partnerships more than on "making sure that every decimal is in the right place." He said he traveled about four days a week and left finance and operations largely to Rao and others.\n\n"I couldn\'t be as hands-on as I probably wanted to be," he testified.\n\nOzy rapidly unraveled after The New York Times revealed Rao\'s faux call in a September 2021 column that also questioned the start-up\'s claims about its audience size.', 'source': {'uri': 'baynews9.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Spectrum News Bay News 9'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://s7d2.scene7.com/is/image/TWCNews/AP_Ozy_Media_Carlos_Watson_071724', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': -0.1137254901960785, 'wgt': 458929261, 'relevance': 28}

I got personal information from them, which is probably fake but I did everything I could," he told The Telegraph.\n\n"I had to engage with them for six days, sometimes messages at half past 11 at night, to be able to gather this information and as much information as possible.\n\n"I felt that by doing that, it would empower all those other small businesses that might be suffering with this to not pay, don\'t pay, there is support out there.\n\n"And as soon as you cut the head off the snake, it stops, they\'ll probably move on to something else."\n\nMr Sheridan and Mr Morgan\'s flagship restaurant is 8 by Andy Sheridan in Liverpool, which features in the Michelin Guide, and was named Best Restaurant in the UK at the British Restaurant Awards last September. Mr Sheridan has appeared on the BBC\'s Great British Menu.\n\nBut one fake review of 8 posted on Tripadvisor read: "Wine list is very poor and totally overpriced.\n\n"Our chef Jake was fantastic but the lack of drink choice and excessive price really lets this venue down. This restaurant is just a scam. Be aware."\n\nBecause of the delay caused as Mr Morgan worked to obtain the scammer\'s bank details and a copy of a passport, the conmen then raised their demand from £2,000 to £2,500.\n\nBut Mr Morgan held firm and after intervention from Google and others, the wave of fake one-star reviews slowed.\n\n"It\'s stress. When that review hit for the first time and they\'re threatening to post thousands with verified accounts, it made me worry, it did concern me," Mr Morgan added.\n\n"I also know how fickle Joe Public is, they take it for verbatim and why not? And it\'s just not something that I could allow to happen to our business."\n\nHe added that it was unacceptable that tech giants took so long to intervene.\n\n"Finally they [Google] acted. The press has to get involved for them to act and that\'s a pretty poor situation," he said.\n\n"And that\'s just not good enough in today\'s day and age, when you\'re a multi-billion pound organisation, making money out of small business. This kind of activity contravenes Tripadvisor\'s guidelines and is illegal in many locations.\n\n"With regards to this incident, while Tripadvisor\'s standard reporting processes were not initially engaged with by the business, our Trust and Safety team has been in contact with the owner and the review in question is no longer published to their listing page.\n\n"More broadly our message to business owners is simple. If you are threatened with blackmail - by a customer or anyone else - do not engage directly with that individual.\n\n"Report the incident to the police then contact Tripadvisor directly via the dedicated "report blackmail threat" feature on our platform. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\n\nYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges. The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive. If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\n\nA protection band of 0% would be very bullish and would indicate full investment with 0% in cash. A protection band of 100% would be very bearish and would indicate a need for aggressive protection with cash and hedges or aggressive short selling.\n\nIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash. La réaffirmation du statut de l\'action est intervenue au milieu de rapports selon lesquels GitLab pourrait envisager une vente en raison de l\'intérêt d\'une acquisition. Datadog a été désigné comme l\'un des acheteurs potentiels intéressés par GitLab, selon un article publié mercredi matin avant l\'ouverture du marché.\n\nDatadog, connu pour ses services de surveillance des nuages, est considéré comme un évaluateur permanent des opportunités de fusions et d\'acquisitions. Toutefois, Stifel note qu\'en dépit des rumeurs, GitLab n\'est peut-être pas la solution idéale pour Datadog. Le raisonnement fourni souligne que Datadog s\'est concentré sur l\'amélioration de ses offres dans le domaine de la gestion des services cloud et sur l\'expansion de sa plateforme de sécurité cloud.\n\nL\'analyste de Stifel a souligné que même si la direction de Datadog est susceptible d\'envisager une acquisition importante pour renforcer sa plateforme, en particulier dans le domaine de la sécurité sur le marché DevSecOps, GitLab n\'est peut-être pas la solution que Datadog recherche. Google Ventures, qui détient 22 % des droits de vote de GitLab, est une partie prenante importante qui pourrait influencer toute vente potentielle.\n\nLes perspectives de Stifel suggèrent que si Datadog est ouvert à des acquisitions stratégiques pour renforcer ses services, la trajectoire actuelle de l\'entreprise met l\'accent sur les plateformes de décision, d\'action et d\'automatisation de bout en bout. Le cabinet prévoit que Datadog pourrait s\'engager dans une acquisition de plusieurs milliards de dollars à moyen terme pour améliorer ses capacités, mais il n\'est pas certain que GitLab fasse partie de ces plans.\n\nDans d\'autres nouvelles récentes, GitLab Inc. envisagerait une vente potentielle dans un contexte d\'intérêt pour une acquisition, Datadog Inc. étant identifié comme un acheteur potentiel. L\'intérêt pour une acquisition fait suite à la croissance du chiffre d\'affaires de GitLab de 33 % en glissement annuel, à 169,2 millions de dollars, et à l\'obtention d\'un flux de trésorerie positif pour la première fois au cours du dernier trimestre. Wolfe Research a maintenu sa notation "Outperform" pour GitLab, notant les synergies techniques potentielles entre le pipeline de développeurs de GitLab et les outils d\'observabilité de Datadog.\n\nDatadog, en revanche, a reçu des commentaires mitigés de la part des analystes. Mizuho Securities, Evercore ISI et Loop Capital ont maintenu leurs notes positives pour la société, citant le potentiel de croissance des revenus et le leadership du marché.\n\nCependant, Monness, Crespi, Hardt a rétrogradé Datadog de Neutre à Vendre en raison de problèmes de valorisation. Datadog, valorisé à 44 milliards de dollars, a intégré son agent avec l\'OpenTelemetry Collector et développé ses fonctions de sécurité pour les applications cloud, reflétant l\'engagement de l\'entreprise en faveur de l\'innovation et de la croissance.\n\nCes évolutions soulignent la nature dynamique du secteur du développement de logiciels, les entreprises cherchant à rationaliser les processus et les outils pour améliorer l\'efficacité et la rentabilité. {'uri': '8230332189', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:15:09', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:15:09Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:14:30Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://es.investing.com/news/company-news/stifel-mantiene-la-compra-de-acciones-de-datadog-en-medio-de-los-rumores-sobre-gitlab-93CH-2753105', 'title': 'Stifel mantiene la compra de acciones de Datadog en medio de los rumores sobre GitLab  Por Investing.com', 'body': 'El miércoles, la firma de servicios financieros Stifel mantuvo su calificación de Comprar sobre las acciones de Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) con un precio objetivo de 140,00 dólares. La reafirmación del estado de la acción se produjo en medio de informes de que GitLab podría estar considerando una venta debido al interés de adquisición. Datadog ha sido nombrada como uno de los posibles compradores interesados en GitLab, según una noticia publicada el miércoles por la mañana antes de la apertura del mercado.\n\nDatadog, conocida por sus servicios de monitorización en la nube, está considerada como un evaluador continuo de oportunidades de fusiones y adquisiciones. Sin embargo, Stifel señala que, a pesar de los rumores, GitLab podría no ser la pareja ideal para Datadog. El razonamiento aportado destaca que Datadog se ha centrado en mejorar su oferta en gestión de servicios en la nube y en ampliar su plataforma de seguridad en la nube.\n\nEl analista de Stifel señaló que aunque es probable que la dirección de Datadog considere una adquisición significativa para reforzar su plataforma, especialmente en el área de seguridad dentro del mercado DevSecOps, GitLab podría no ser la solución que Datadog está buscando. Google Ventures, con un 22% de control de voto en GitLab, es un accionista significativo que podría influir en cualquier venta potencial.\n\nLas perspectivas de Stifel sugieren que, si bien Datadog está abierta a adquisiciones estratégicas para reforzar sus servicios, la trayectoria actual de la empresa hace hincapié en las plataformas integrales de decisión, acción y automatización. La firma anticipa que Datadog podría participar en una adquisición multimillonaria a medio plazo para mejorar sus capacidades, pero sigue siendo incierto si GitLab formaría parte de esos planes.\n\nEn otras noticias recientes, se informa de que GitLab Inc. está considerando una posible venta en medio de un interés de adquisición, con Datadog Inc. identificado como posible comprador. El interés en la adquisición se produce después de que GitLab informara de un crecimiento interanual de los ingresos del 33%, hasta 169,2 millones de dólares, y de que lograra un flujo de caja positivo por primera vez en el último trimestre. Wolfe Research mantiene una calificación de Outperform para GitLab, destacando las potenciales sinergias técnicas entre el pipeline de desarrollo de GitLab y las herramientas de observabilidad de Datadog.\n\nDatadog, por su parte, ha recibido opiniones dispares de los analistas. Mizuho Securities, Evercore ISI y Loop Capital mantuvieron sus calificaciones positivas para la empresa, citando el potencial de crecimiento de los ingresos y el liderazgo del mercado.\n\nSin embargo, Monness, Crespi y Hardt rebajaron la calificación de Datadog de neutral a vender por motivos de valoración. Datadog, valorada en 44.000 millones de dólares, ha estado integrando su agente con OpenTelemetry Collector y ampliando sus funciones de seguridad para aplicaciones en la nube, lo que refleja el compromiso de la empresa con la innovación y el crecimiento.\n\nEstos avances ponen de relieve la naturaleza dinámica de la industria del desarrollo de software, en la que las empresas tratan de racionalizar los procesos y las herramientas para mejorar la eficiencia y la rentabilidad. La posible fusión y adquisición de GitLab y Datadog pone de relieve lo mucho que está en juego en este tipo de operaciones.', 'source': {'uri': 'es.investing.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Investing.com Español'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://i-invdn-com.investing.com/news/World_News_8_800x533_L_1420026210.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458928909, 'relevance': 28}

The company missed earnings and revenue estimates. The company's earnings fell by 28.3% to $135.87 million in the second quarter from $189.55 million, in the same period last year. The decline in revenue was primarily driven by a 5% decrease in gross revenue per load in Intermodal (JBI) and a decline in load volume of 25% in Integrated Capacity Solutions (ICS), 9% in Truckload (JBT), and 9% in Dedicated Contract Services (DCS). These items were partially offset by Final Mile Services® (FMS) revenue growth of 5%, primarily driven by new contracts implemented over the past year, and a 5% increase in revenue per load in ICS. Current quarter total operating revenue, excluding fuel surcharge revenue, decreased 6% versus the comparable quarter 2023.\n\nJBHT in the second quarter of FY 24 has reported the adjusted earnings per share of $1.32, missing the analysts' estimates for the adjusted earnings per share of $1.52. The company had reported the adjusted revenue decline of 6.5 percent to $2.92 billion in the second quarter of FY 24, missing the analysts' estimates for revenue of $3.04 billion. The decrease in operating income was primarily due to lower revenue, and higher insurance and claims, equipment-related, and certain personnel-related expenses.\n\nMoreover, Intermodal volume decreased 1% over the same period in 2023. Transcontinental network loads increased 4%, while eastern network loads decreased 7% compared to the second quarter 2023. While experiencing some seasonal build in demand through the quarter, overall performance continued to be pressured by the soft freight market and its impact on over-the-road truck competition in the eastern network. Dedicated Contract Services (DCS) revenue decreased 4% during the current quarter over the same period 2023 driven by a 1% decline in average trucks combined with a 3% decline in productivity (revenue per truck per week). Integrated Capacity Solutions (ICS) revenue declined 21% during the current quarter versus the second quarter 2023. Overall segment volume decreased 25% versus the prior-year period. '水曜、金融サービス会社であるStifelは、データドッグ（NASDAQ:DDOG）株の目標株価を140.00ドルとし、買いのレーティングを維持した。GitLabが買収の関心を受け、売却を検討している可能性があると報じられる中、株価の再確認が行われた。水曜日の朝、市場が開く前に発表されたニュース記事によると、GitLabに興味を持つ買い手候補の一社としてDatadogの名前が挙がっている。\n\nDatadogはクラウド監視サービスで知られ、M&Aの機会を継続的に評価していると見られている。しかし、噂とは裏腹に、GitLabはDatadogにとって理想的な相手ではないかもしれないとStifelは指摘している。その理由は、Datadogがクラウド・サービス・マネジメントの強化とクラウド・セキュリティ・プラットフォームの拡大に注力していることを強調している。\n\nStifelのアナリストは、Datadogの経営陣はプラットフォームを強化するため、特にDevSecOps市場のセキュリティ分野で重要な買収を検討しているようだが、GitLabはDatadogが求めているソリューションではないかもしれないと指摘している。GitLabの議決権を22%保有するGoogle Venturesは、売却の可能性に影響を与えうる重要な利害関係者だ。\n\nStifelの見通しでは、Datadogはサービスを強化するために戦略的買収に前向きだが、同社の現在の軌道はエンドツーエンドの意思決定、アクション、自動化プラットフォームに重点を置いている。同社は、Datadogがその能力を強化するために中期的に数十億ドル規模の買収を行う可能性があると予想しているが、GitLabがその計画に含まれるかどうかはまだ不明だ。\n\n他の最近のニュースでは、GitLab Inc.が買収の関心を集める中、売却の可能性を検討していると報じられており、Datadog Inc.が買い手候補として挙げられている。買収への関心は、ギットラボの売上高が前年同期比33％増の1億6920万ドルに達し、最新四半期に初めてキャッシュフローがプラスになったことを受けてのものだ。ウォルフ・リサーチはギットラボのアウトパフォームのレーティングを維持し、ギットラボの開発者パイプラインとデータドッグの観測可能性ツールの間の潜在的な技術的相乗効果に注目している。\n\n一方、Datadogはアナリストから様々な評価を受けている。みずほ証券、エバーコアISI、ループ・キャピタルは、収益成長と市場でのリーダーシップの可能性を挙げ、同社に対するポジティブな評価を維持した。\n\nしかし、モンネス、クレスピ、ハードは、バリュエーション上の懸念からデータドッグを「中立」から「売り」に格下げした。評価額440億ドルのDatadogは、自社のエージェントをOpenTelemetry Collectorと統合し、クラウドアプリケーション向けのセキュリティ機能を拡張しており、同社のイノベーションと成長へのコミットメントを反映している。\n\nこれらの動きは、ソフトウェア開発業界のダイナミックな性質を浮き彫りにしており、企業は効率と費用対効果を高めるためにプロセスやツールの合理化を模索している。GitLabとDatadogのM&Aの可能性は、このような潜在的な取引に伴う高いリスクを強調している。', La riconferma dello status del titolo è arrivata in mezzo alle notizie secondo cui GitLab potrebbe prendere in considerazione una vendita a causa dell'interesse di un'acquisizione. Datadog è stata indicata come uno dei potenziali acquirenti interessati a GitLab, secondo una notizia pubblicata mercoledì mattina prima dell'apertura del mercato.\n\nDatadog, nota per i suoi servizi di monitoraggio del cloud, è vista come un continuo valutatore di opportunità di fusioni e acquisizioni. Tuttavia, Stifel osserva che, nonostante le voci, GitLab potrebbe non essere l'abbinamento ideale per Datadog. La motivazione fornita evidenzia che Datadog si è concentrata sul potenziamento della propria offerta nel Cloud Service Management e sull'espansione della propria piattaforma di Cloud Security.\n\nL'analista di Stifel ha sottolineato che, sebbene sia probabile che il management di Datadog prenda in considerazione un'acquisizione significativa per rafforzare la propria piattaforma, in particolare nell'area della sicurezza all'interno del mercato DevSecOps, GitLab potrebbe non essere la soluzione che Datadog sta cercando. Google Ventures, con un controllo di voto del 22% in GitLab, è un azionista significativo che potrebbe influenzare qualsiasi potenziale vendita.\n\nLe prospettive di Stifel suggeriscono che, sebbene Datadog sia aperta ad acquisizioni strategiche per rafforzare i propri servizi, l'attuale traiettoria dell'azienda si concentra sulle piattaforme di decisione, azione e automazione end-to-end. L'azienda prevede che Datadog potrebbe impegnarsi in un'acquisizione multimiliardaria nel medio termine per potenziare le proprie capacità, ma rimane incerto se GitLab rientrerà in questi piani.\n\nIn altre notizie recenti, GitLab Inc. starebbe valutando una potenziale vendita in mezzo a interessi di acquisizione, con Datadog Inc. identificata come potenziale acquirente. L'interesse per l'acquisizione segue la crescita del 33% del fatturato di GitLab su base annua, che ha raggiunto 169,2 milioni di dollari, e il raggiungimento di un flusso di cassa positivo per la prima volta nell'ultimo trimestre. Wolfe Research ha mantenuto il rating Outperform su GitLab, notando le potenziali sinergie tecniche tra la pipeline di sviluppatori di GitLab e gli strumenti di osservabilità di Datadog.\n\nDatadog, invece, ha ricevuto giudizi contrastanti dagli analisti. Mizuho Securities, Evercore ISI e Loop Capital hanno mantenuto le loro valutazioni positive sull'azienda, citando il potenziale di crescita dei ricavi e la leadership di mercato.\n\nTuttavia, Monness, Crespi, Hardt ha declassato Datadog da Neutrale a Vendere a causa di problemi di valutazione. Datadog, valutata 44 miliardi di dollari, ha integrato il suo Agent con l'OpenTelemetry Collector e ha ampliato le sue funzioni di sicurezza per le applicazioni cloud, a testimonianza dell'impegno dell'azienda verso l'innovazione e la crescita.\n\nQuesti sviluppi evidenziano la natura dinamica del settore dello sviluppo software, con le aziende che cercano di ottimizzare i processi e gli strumenti per migliorare l'efficienza e l'efficacia dei costi. Vance: जे.डी वेंस टेक इंडस्ट्री के ऐसे पहले एक्सपर्ट हो सकते हैं, जो कि अमेरिका के व्हाइट हाउस में कदम रख सकते हैं. दरअसल जे डी वेंस अमेरिका के ओहायो राज्य के एक संसद सदस्य हैं और अब उनके व्हाइट हाउस में जाने की संभावना बन रही है.\n\nअगर ऐसा होता है तो जे डी वेंस टेक इंडस्ट्री के पहले व्यक्ति होंगे जो अमेरिका के व्हाइट हाउस के मेंबर बनेंगे. क्या आप जानते हैं कि जे डी वेंस और टेक इंडस्ट्री का Thiel) के जरिए है. पीटर थील दुनिया की जानी मानी कंपनी पेपल (PayPal) के पूर्व सीईओ और एक प्रमुख निवेशक हैं. उन्होंने जे डी वेंस को अपने एक फंड में काम करने के लिए भी हायर किया था. लिहाजा, जे डी वेंस का टेक से पहला कनेक्शन तो यही है.\n\nउनके दूसरे कनेक्शन की बात करें तो थील ने वेंस के खुद की वीसी फंड "नार्या" में भी इन्वेस्टमेंट की है, जिसकी शुरुआत उन्होंने 2019 में की थी. इसके अलावा थील ने बाद में जे डी वेंस के ओहायो के सेनेट चुनाव में भी वित्तीय समर्थन भी किया था.\n\nअब जेडी वेंस को 2024 के राष्ट्रपति चुनाव के लिए डोनाल्ड ट्रंप के रनिंग मेट के रूप में चुना गया है. इस नए उपराष्ट्रपति पद के उम्मीदवार के पास वेंचर कैपिटल में काफी सारी विविधताएं हैं.\n\nबड़े टेक रेगुलेशन और क्रिप्टोकरेंसी दोनों पर उनका मुखर रुख है. ट्रंप अभियान में उनका शामिल होना अमेरिका में मौजूद बड़ी टेक कंपनियों के लिए संभावित नीतिगत बदलावों को नया रूप देने जैसा माना जा रहा है.\n\nअमेरिका के मुख्य टेक इंडस्ट्री से जे डी वेंस रिश्ता काफी जटिल है. सिलिकॉन वैली से अपने अच्छे रिलेशन के बावजूद, वेंस अमेरिका की बड़ी टेक कंपनियों के मुख्य आलोचक रहे हैं. वह गूगल और मेटा जैसी अमेरिका और दुनिया की बड़ी टेक कंपनियों की खुलकर आलोचना करते हैं.\n\nउन्होंने गूगल को तोड़ने का आह्वान किया है और सूचना पर गूगल जैसी दिग्गज टेक कंपनियों के नियंत्रण होने पर गहरी चिंता व्यक्त की है. वेंस की मंशा को सरल भाषा में समझें तो वो गूगल और मेटा जैसी बड़ी टेक कंपनियों की मनमर्जियों पर लगाम लगाना चाहते हैं और इसके लिए वो इन दिग्गज टेक कंपनियों के सामने कंट्टीटर्स को पेश करना चाहते हैं.\n\nट्रंप के रनिंग मेट के रूप में जेडी वेंस का नामांकन एक ऐसे उम्मीदवार को पेश करता है, जिसका वेंचर कैपिटल और सिलिकॉन वैली दोनों से गहरा संबंध है. इसके अलावा बिग टेक की कड़ी आलोचना और क्रिप्टोकरेंसी पर एक समर्थक रुख रखना भी वेंस की खास बातों में से एक है.\n\nहालांकि, अभी तक यह देखना बाकी है कि उनकी उम्मीदवारी पूर्व अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड {'uri': '8230326606', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:11:07', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:11:07Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:10:48Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.asianinvestor.net/article/institutional-investors-hunt-for-new-plays-amid-ai-boom/496919', 'title': 'Institutional investors hunt for new plays amid AI boom | Equities | AsianInvestor', 'body': 'As artificial intelligence reshapes industries and work forces, institutional investors are discovering new opportunities in unexpected sectors.\n\nArtificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping entire industries and creating unexpected investment opportunities, according to money managers in the region.\n\nFrom reducing energy costs in data centres to personalising fashion recommendations, AI is driving innovation across sectors. Widespread adoption is also forcing investors to look beyond traditional tech companies.\n\nThe most promising opportunities may lie in firms leveraging AI to solve industry-specific problems or in those providing the essential infrastructure that power AI applications, according to Katie Horne, lead portfolio analyst at T. Rowe Price.\n\n"Complex AI requires a vast amount of computing power and some companies in infrastructure build-out mode are consuming enough electricity to run a small city," Horne told AsianInvestor.\n\nThis increased demand for power is opening up new investment opportunities.\n\n"We think there will be a shortage of power and increased demand for reliable, renewable energy sources such as nuclear energy - especially for companies with commitments to green energy," she said.\n\nALSO READ: Market Views: How sustainable is AI\'s escalating energy demand?\n\nThe impact of AI will also extend beyond energy needs.\n\n"Given the demand for datacentre capacity is increasing so rapidly, there are many sub-sectors beyond power and electricity that could benefit," said Horne.\n\n"For example, datacentres generate high levels of heat, which require specialised cooling systems, in turn provided by industrial companies."\n\nTECH PLAYERS\n\nWhen it comes to AI companies, investors need to consider both established players and emerging contenders, said Horne.\n\n"Mega cap tech companies have an advantage over smaller peers and we believe this will continue - the large will get larger. AI is creating contestable markets and in order to compete, you need to invest," said Horne.\n\nHowever, she also points out opportunities for smaller companies: "AI can also lower the barriers to entry for newer companies able to develop disruptive technology, and we\'ve seen this with the likes of Open AI, Perplexity and Anthropic."\n\nFor smaller-cap companies, Horne advises looking for "a specific niche, a solid business model, and high barriers to entry."\n\nAlso read: Family office in search of emerging managers to make AI bets\n\n"We like an electronic manufacturing services, \'EMS\', business that produces AI-optimised servers, switches, and other customisable solutions," she shared. "They are partnering with customers, such as a key hyperscaler, to make their computing more efficient."\n\nROOM TO RUN\n\nThere is still plenty of opportunity in AI investment space, according to Matthew Cioppa, co-portfolio manager of Franklin Technology Fund.\n\n"Many semiconductor and hardware stocks have already benefitted from the AI trend, but the runway for growth is long if current trends hold. Scaling laws dictate that large language models will continue to dramatically improve as the amount of computing power increases, which incentivises \'build\' stage participants to continue to invest," Cioppa told AsianInvestor.\n\n"Additionally, we\'ve barely begun to see broader adoption at the application layer, so much of this trend is ahead of us," he said.\n\nOliver Cox, equities portfolio manager for Asia Pacific at JP Morgan Asset Management, believes we are already starting to see this current bull market broaden beyond just semiconductors to hardware, as expectations about "edge AI" pick up.\n\nThis means more AI software will be used on AI-integrated devices.\n\n"Apple\'s recent announcement of upcoming AI software products was perhaps the best recent example of that," Cox told AsianInvestor.\n\n"However, the software and services group are still playing catch up, mainly because corporates and consumers are still working out which AI services they need, how best to use them and to how to scale usage of them," he said.\n\nPOTENTIAL APPLICATIONS\n\nHorne of T. Rowe Price believes the potential applications of AI are vast and could reshape entire industries.\n\n"AI is likely going to reduce company headcount over the long-term, as it\'ll likely drive productivity boosts in coding, back office, automation, and call centres, to name just a few areas. We could start to see the size of organisations shrink, at least for a period of time, as efficiency and automation take root."\n\nShe also highlighted the potential for AI to disrupt established markets.\n\n"AI is creating contestable markets - and this is apparent in search. Google has enjoyed a near-monopoly (~90% market share) in traditional search for about 20 years, and so far their search-related revenue has proven resilient, even with the recent advent of ChatGPT. However, we believe that search will become more competitive over time," Horne said.', 'source': {'uri': 'asianinvestor.net', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'AsianInvestor'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://cdn.i.haymarketmedia.asia/?n=asian-investor%2Fcontent%2Fshutterstock_2320153381.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.419607843137255, 'wgt': 458928667, 'relevance': 11}

dañadas por las obras del Tren Interurbano México-Toluca', 'body': 'Vecinos de El Capulín, alcaldía Álvaro Obregón, amenazan con tomar drásticas medidas como el bloqueo de algunas avenidas en caso de que la Sobse no diga las fechas\n\nEste día vence el plazo para que la Secretaria de Obras y Servicios de la Ciudad de México (Sobse) entregue a los vecinos de la colonia El Capulín, alcaldía Álvaro noticias más importantes a través de nuestro canal de Whatsapp, disponible en este enlace\n\nRecordó que el pasado 1 de julio realizaron una protesta sobre la avenida Río Tacubaya, nuevamente para las viviendas y tener una garantía respecto al pago e indemnización en caso de que haya accidentes o afectaciones de las viviendas.\n\nEl personal de Sobse se comprometió en entregar para el miércoles 17 de julio las fechas para iniciar los dictámenes de por lo menos 30 predios de los vecinos afectados. Dicho levantamiento se solicitó que sean realizados por personal especializado es decir, un Director Responsable de Obra (DRO) y un estructurista para que dicho dictamen sea notariado y posteriormente entregado a los vecinos.\n\nBarrera señaló que hasta el día de hoy la zona sigue teniendo a varios vecinos afectados, hace unas semanas durante la construcción de una columna los trabajadores rompieron los tubos del agua dejando una parte de la colonia Santo Domingo sin agua.\n\nAsí mismo en El Capulín trabajadores dejaron sin luz varias viviendas después de mover el cableado, del cual CFE no tenía conocimiento y los responsables de afectaciones de obras inducidas del proyecto no solucionaron el problema hasta días después por presión de los vecinos.\n\nNo olvides seguirnos en Google Noticias para mantenerte informado\n\nY recientemente el ruido todas las noches de taladros hidráulicos ha causado malestar vecinal, al grado de exigir al personal y responsables evitar laborar en dichos horarios.\n\n"Cabe señalar, que denunciamos que mientras la solicitud de los dictámenes con DRO está en espera, personal de obras el 11 de julio, trató de hacer levantamientos bajo el supuesto de ver las posibles afectaciones de algunas viviendas. {'uri': '8230322948', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:10:47', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:10:47Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:08:10Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.infobae.com/noticias/2024/07/17/acciones-de-la-eurozona-pierden-asi-cerro-la-sesion-el-euro-stoxx-50-este-17-de-julio/', 'title': 'Acciones de la eurozona pierden; así cerró la sesión el Euro Stoxx 50 este 17 de julio', 'body': 'Un índice bursátil es un indicador que mide cómo evoluciona el valor de un determinado conjunto de activos, por lo que se sirve de datos de diversas empresas o sectores de una parte del mercado.\n\nEstos indicadores son usados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de diversas naciones y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por compañías con características concretas como podría ser contar con una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a al mismo tipo de industria, asimismo, hay algunos índices que sólo toman en cuenta un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.\n\nLos índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de la confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una compañía. Si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los valores de las acciones tienden a caer.\n\nAsimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores hacer una comparación entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.\n\nEste tipo de indicadores comenzaron a usarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. viera con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios\n\nActualmente existen diversos índices y pueden aglomerarse en función de su geografía, los sectores, el tamaño de las compañías o incluso el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías mayormente relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).\n\nCada índice bursátil posee su propia forma de calcularse, pero el principal factor es la capitalización bursátil de cada empresa que lo integra. Este se saca al multiplicar el valor del día del bono en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en en manos de los inversionistas.\n\nLas empresas que aparecen en la bolsa de valores están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho informe debe entregarse cada tres o seis meses, según sea el caso.\n\nLeer un índice bursátil también implica observar sus modificaciones en el tiempo. Los nuevos índices siempre arrancan con un valor fijo basado en los precios de los valores en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede llevar a engaño.\n\nSi un índice suma 500 puntos en un día, mientras que otro solo añade 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo un rendimiento mejor. Pero, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede deducir que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron mayores.\n\nEntre los principales índices bursátiles en la Unión Americana está el Dow Jones Industrial Average, mejor conocido como Dow Jones, que está integrado por 30 compañías. De igual manera, el S&P 500, que contempla a 500 de las mayores empresas de la Bolsa de Nueva York. Por último, no hay que olvidar el Nasdaq 100, que reúne a 100 de las mayores firmas no financieras.\n\nEn el continente asiático, tenemos el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Se encuentra, además, el SSE Composite Index, que puede considerarse el más representativo de China, conformado por las compañías más relevantes de la Bolsa de Shanghái. De igual manera, cabe mencionar el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.\n\nTambién, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.\n\nDe igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.', 'source': {'uri': 'infobae.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'infobae'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.infobae.com/new-resizer/q4D009ED96Ge0OBF67VZLotQXBI=/1200x630/filters:format(webp):quality(85)/cloudfront-us-east-1.images.arcpublishing.com/infobae/53FASBX5QVEQRB45SBKHXSCBWI.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458928647, 'relevance': 36}

{'uri': '8230324411', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '16:09:32', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T16:09:32Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T16:09:14Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://baynews9.com/fl/tampa/news/2024/07/17/wall-street-july-17-dow-jones-record', 'title': 'Dow Jones adds to record high, but big tech stocks dive again', 'body': 'Big technology stocks are dropping again Wednesday, hurt by worries about potentially worsening trade tensions with China. That\'s dragging market indexes to their worst day in months, but conditions may be less discouraging underneath the surface, and nearly as many U.S. stocks are rising as falling.\n\nThe split left the S&P 500 sagging by 1.1% a day after it set an all-time high for the 38th time this year. The Nasdaq composite was down 2.1% and on track for its worst day since January, also weighed by losses for such market heavyweights as Nvidia and Apple.\n\nBut the Dow Jones Industrial Average was adding 103 points, or 0.3%, to its record set a day earlier, as of 10:45 a.m. Eastern time. The smaller stocks in the Russell 2000 were also holding up better than the rest of the market, down a more modest 0.5%, after roaring in recent days on hopes that interest rates are about to get easier and the U.S. economy will avoid a recession.\n\nIt\'s a continuation of a recent trend that market watchers have called encouraging, one where more stocks are rising rather than just a handful of overpowering elites.\n\nThe market\'s spotlight was squarely on chip companies, which tumbled after a report from Bloomberg News said President Joe Biden is considering the most severe trade restrictions available if companies like the Netherlands\' ASML and Japan\'s Tokyo Electron continue to ship advanced semiconductor technology to China. The U.S. government has blocked Chinese access to advanced chips and the equipment to make them, citing security concerns, and urged its allies to follow suit.\n\nASML saw its stock trading in the United States drop 10.6% even though it reported sales for the spring that came in at the high end of its forecasted range. Shares of Tokyo Electron, meanwhile, dropped 7.5% in Tokyo to cull its gain for the year to 32.2%.\n\nAnother major chip company, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., sank after former President Donald Trump criticized the self-governed island claimed by Beijing, which the U.S. is obligated by treaty to defend if it is attacked.\n\n"Taiwan should pay us for defense," Trump said according to a transcript of an interview published by Bloomberg. "Taiwan took our chip business from us, I mean, how stupid are we?" he said.\n\nTSMC\'s stock trading in the United States dropped 6.1%.\n\nReverberations reached chip stocks around the world, including big U.S. players that have been some of Wall Street\'s biggest stars this year amid a frenzy around artificial-intelligence technology. Nvidia fell 5.6% after soaring 155.2% this year through the day before.\n\nAdvanced Micro Devices fell 7.8%, and Broadcom dropped 5%.\n\nBig Tech stocks\' movements have an outsized effect on indexes like the S&P 500, which give more weight to companies of bigger size. That was a boon in recent years, when a small group of companies known as "the Magnificent Seven" was able to soar almost regardless of what the overall economy and interest rates were doing. That helped mask weakness underneath the surface as the economy struggled through high interest rates meant to snuff out inflation.\n\nNow, though, some critics call those Magnificent Seven stocks too expensive, and investors are creeping back into unloved areas of the market. The economy has remained remarkably resilient so far, with the job market remaining solid, and investors widely expect the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates in September because inflation has slowed.\n\n"Markets cannot continue indefinitely higher on the backs of just a handful of stocks," said JJ Kinahan, CEO of IG North America.\n\nJohnson & Johnson, whose stock is still down slightly for the year so far, jumped 2.9% after topping analysts\' forecasts for profit in the latest quarter. It was one of the largest reasons the Dow Jones Industrial Average was able to rise despite falls for each of the Magnificent Seven stocks: Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Nvidia and Tesla.\n\nU.S. Bancorp, which has also lagged the rest of the market this year, rallied 4.5% after topping analysts\' forecasts for profit and revenue.\n\nPrologis, whose stock is still down for the year, jumped 6.1% to be one of the day\'s strongest within the S&P 500. The company, which owns logistics real estate around the world, reported stronger results for the latest quarter than analysts expected. While CEO Hamid Moghadam said demand from customers remains subdued, it is improving, and he expects that trend to continue.\n\nOn the losing side of Wall Street was Five Below, a retailer targeting teens and tweens with products priced at $5 or below. It tumbled 19.9% after its CEO, Joel Anderson, stepped down from his job and from the board. It also gave a profit forecast for the second quarter that fell short of analysts\' expectations.\n\nSpirit Airlines lost 9% after the discount carrier cut its forecast for revenue in the second quarter. It said it\'s making fewer dollars than expected from fees outside of tickets.\n\nIn the bond market, the 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.18% from 4.16% late Tuesday.\n\nIn stock markets abroad, London\'s FTSE 100 was 0.4% higher after data showed the inflation rate remained steady at the Bank of England\'s 2% target in June.
