{'uri': '2024-07-424903014', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:08:48', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:08:48Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T14:00:00Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://tucson.com/opinion/column/local-opinion-new-anti-pollution-measures-are-good-for-our-health-and-the-environment/article_13ea8ea0-42e0-11ef-a17c-9b5e189f293b.html', 'title': 'Local opinion: New anti-pollution measures are good for our health and the environment', 'body': "The following is the opinion and analysis of the writer:\n\nThere's not a place on planet earth that won't be affected by climate change. The consequences of a changing climate, though they may manifest themselves differently in different places, will surely manifest themselves everywhere, and that includes Arizona. Because of climate change, our state has seen more protracted, more extreme extreme-heat events than ever before. These unlivable high temperatures represent the single most consequential impact of climate change to which we Arizonans are susceptible.\n\nLast year, in Maricopa County, 645 people died from heat-related health issues. That figure represents a more than 50% increase in heat-related deaths over the year before, a tenfold increase from the number of heat-related deaths recorded ten years ago. And this is just the beginning. It's also just one half, one side, of the climate crisis, because the pollution that drives climate change is itself a public-health threat. This is something that as a pediatrician I feel strongly about. It's not only for the environment that we should cut climate pollution; it's for our own health and well-being.\n\nPeople are also reading...\n\nNo tornado, but powerful storm left swath of damage across Tucson Mountain lion that made Tucson hospital visit headed back to wild Tucson coffee and candy shop Chocolate Iguana is back open at a new location 🍫 Tucson restaurant's signature dish makes us long to visit France Escape to Mount Lemmon for a musical experience Tornado touches down in Tucson, officials confirm Two Democrats vie in primary for Pima County treasurer nomination 50 fun events happening in Tucson this weekend July 11-14 🍫🛼 Father of Marana girl who died in hot car faces murder, child abuse charges Tone down political rhetoric, Gov. Hobbs says, but won't discuss her use of harsh terms Bob Hirsh, Tucson's 'finest criminal defense lawyer,' dies Tucson breaks heat record for third day in a row; excessive heat warning extended Tucson coffee and candy shop Chocolate Iguana is back open at a new location These Tucson-area Albertsons, Safeway stores cold be sold in proposed merger Dad says he left for two days after son, 9, had no pulse, court filing shows\n\nPollution from power plants, for example, is a top contributor to climate change, but it also worsens our air quality. Poor air quality is linked to many chronic health conditions suffered by millions of Americans. Vulnerable populations, children and the elderly especially, are more hurt than others by this pollution.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nChildren are smaller, their bodies still developing. They spend more time outside than the average adult and are therefore more exposed to air-quality issues. This exposure has the potential to do great damage to their health and causes many to develop chronic medical conditions, such as asthma. Meanwhile, many older Americans already suffer chronic health conditions - hypertension, heart failure, COPD, and so on - and these conditions are all worsened by poor air quality.\n\nThankfully, under this administration, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has lived up to its name, releasing one measure after another to curb pollution, protect the environment, and address climate change. Most recently, the EPA announced new standards to limit how much carbon can be released by power plants. Under the EPA's new standards, all power plants that burn coal - and some new plants burning natural gas -- must either cut or capture 90% of the carbon pollution that they produce.\n\nThese standards represent a monumental step forward for climate action in America. They are expected to reduce carbon pollution from the power sector by 75% from peak pollution levels seen in 2005. In physical terms, this means that over the next two decades, the release of 1.38 billion tons of carbon will have been prevented by these standards. More vividly, it will be as if 328 million gas-powered cars were taken off the road. That's what the EPA will have accomplished, with the stroke of a pen, by enacting these standards.\n\nBut there are more benefits: These standards are expected to improve health outcomes for millions of Americans. Because of the new standards, we will see fewer premature deaths caused by pollution, fewer new cases of asthma, fewer hospitalizations, and fewer missed school days. All this because the EPA took action to protect public health.\n\nThere are some, however, who are none too pleased by the EPA's announcement. Corporate polluters -- the big oil and gas companies, the big utility monopolies, Big Coal, the usual suspects -- have pledged to challenge these anti-pollution standards in the courts. They want a judge to strike them down. And in Congress, the allies of corporate polluters are working hard to repeal the new power-plant standards legislatively along with several other anti-pollution measures.\n\nIt's important that these efforts, both in the courts and in Congress, should fail. We cannot allow big corporations to take away these new protections. The utility monopolies and their fossil-fuel suppliers have had decades to profit from their pollution. It's only right that our government should prioritize what's best for the rest of us. We deserve -- our children deserve, our elders deserve -- to breathe clean air, and we all deserve our nation's very best effort to stop the climate crisis.\n\nDr. Eve Shapiro has been a pediatrician in Tucson for more than three decades. She has been involved in climate and healthcare advocacy for many years, through Physicians for Social Responsibility and Physicians for a National Health Plan.\n\nRespond: Write a letter to the editor | Write a guest opinion\n\nSubscribe to stay connected to Tucson. Asosiasi Industri Plastik Hilir Indonesia (Aphindo) menyampaikan perlunya pengetatan impor produk barang jadi plastik dari negara lain untuk memproteksi industri hilir plastik dalam negeri, sehingga sektor ini bisa memberikan kontribusi yang lebih besar bagi kemajuan ekonomi Indonesia.\n\nSekretaris Jenderal Aphindo Henry Chevalier di Jakarta, Selasa mengatakan masifnya barang jadi plastik tersebut secara langsung mengganggu kinerja industri hilir plastik domestik, hal itu dikarenakan produk impor lebih diminati karena memiliki harga yang lebih murah.\n\n"Karena produk-produk yang impor itu, barang-barang jadi yang masuk ke Indonesia jauh lebih murah dibandingkan dengan produk dalam negeri," kata dia dalam keterangannya, Rabu (17/7).\n\nHenry mencontohkan, salah satu negara pemasok barang impor yang lebih murah ke Indonesia yaitu China. Disampaikannya, alasan barang yang dijual oleh negara tersebut lebih murah dikarenakan upah pekerja (labour cost) di sana bisa lebih rendah, serta tingginya ketersediaan bahan baku.\n\nBaca Juga: Sambut Positif Aturan Pelabelan BPA, YLKI: Industri AMDK Harus Siapkan Upaya Mitigasi\n\nOleh karena itu dirinya mendorong supaya pemerintah menerapkan pengetatan impor khususnya untuk barang jadi plastik di setiap regulasi yang diterapkan, terlebih apabila produk tersebut sudah diproduksi oleh industri domestik. Tapi tidak cukup hanya sebatas lartas (larangan dan pembatasan), tapi harus diatur tata impornya," ujarnya.\n\nLebih lanjut, ia mengatakan selain menerapkan pengetatan impor di setiap regulasi yang diterapkan, pemerintah dalam hal ini Bea Cukai mesti menindak dengan tegas dan menolak barang plastik impor yang tidak sesuai dengan Standar Nasional Indonesia (SNI).\n\n"Misalnya spesifikasi yang masuk dari barang-barang impor jadi plastik itu tidak sesuai dengan spesifikasi SNI yang ada di Indonesia, nah itu tentunya peran dari Bea Cukai harus menolak itu, dan bea cukai harus paham SNI itu apa saja," katanya.\n\nBaca Juga: Pengusaha: Penerapan Bea Impor Ganda dari China Bisa Berdampak Buruk\n\nSebelumnya Sekretaris Jenderal Industri Olefin, Aromatik, dan Plasik Indonesia (Inaplas) Fajar Budiono menyampaikan, pihaknya mencatat sudah ada penurunan utilisasi di industri plastik hilir hingga di bawah 50 persen, sehingga apabila masifnya barang impor di pasar domestik dibiarkan bisa berdampak kepada industri hulu yakni petrokimia.\n\n"Itu sudah mulai terasa juga di beberapa pabrik hulu, ada yang sudah mematikan mesinnya, mereka wait and see," kata dia.\n\nSelanjutnya: Penurunan Suku Bunga The Fed Diperkirakan Lebih Cepat, Rupiah Akan Stabil?\n\nMenarik Dibaca: HP Jatuh ke Air? {'uri': '2024-07-424898377', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:05:15', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:05:15Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:45:00Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.9019607901573181, 'url': 'https://qctimes.com/opinion/column/tyler-cowen-why-is-sweden-paying-grandparents-to-babysit-economist-says-its-worth-a-try/article_f1dcd414-c38f-594e-925a-91d9fa471123.html', 'title': "Tyler Cowen: Why is Sweden paying grandparents to babysit? Economist says it's worth a try", 'body': 'As Sweden attends its first NATO summit as a member, FRANCE 24\'s Nadia Massih spoke to Tobias Billström, Swedish Foreign Minister.\n\nAt first glance, the policy sounds absurd, especially to many Americans: In Sweden, grandparents are now eligible for government subsidies to babysit their grandchildren.\n\nAs a proud grandparent, I would be willing to pay to babysit my grandkids. (I don\'t have to, but I would.) It would feel wrong to accept government money for my services.\n\nAnd even in the Swedish context, the program seems excessive. The country has long had first-rate and well-subsidized child-care facilities, which is another reason not to pay grandparents anything, and Sweden already has high levels of government spending and taxation. Is this additional benefit -- and expenditure -- really what it needs?\n\nBut sometimes even apparently foolish ideas have such compelling rationales that you begin to rethink whether they\'re foolish at all. These are often the cases that require the hardest thinking.\n\nPeople are also reading...\n\nEl Compita in Davenport ordered to pay nearly $50,000 in back wages, damages to workers John Deere will lay off an undetermined number of salaried workers beginning next week Quad-Cities weather updates: National Weather Service confirms EF-1 tornado from Monday Iowa restaurant inspection update: Grimy blenders, mouse droppings and bad sushi NEW DETAILS: John Deere announces another 345 layoffs at Waterloo facilities Davenport interim city administrator to leave job in August for private sector 7 Quad Cities restaurants that opened in June An early look at Davenport\'s plans for Main Street Landing One dead in shooting in Hudson Beat the Elite runners to start at 2 mile mark in Quad-City Times Bix 7 WATCH LIVE TONIGHT: Republican National Convention continues in Milwaukee Trump injured but \'fine\' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Quad-Cities business openings, closings: Scooter\'s Coffee, Hungry Haven food truck \'The best ones that are made\' Standard Byke Company leads the BMX industry for 33 years Woman charged with abandoning infant on Davenport street\n\nIf you look at Sweden\'s policy closely, it adheres pretty well to some basic economic principles: namely, the notion of "Pareto improvements," which benefit all parties involved.\n\nStart with the fact that Swedish parents currently receive extensive paid leave on the birth of a child, and so it can be said they are already paid to look after their children. Whether you agree with that policy, it is longstanding and well-established. Take it as a given.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nNow imagine that you are an ambitious Swedish doctor or lawyer, climbing the career ladder, and are self-aware enough to realize you do not always have entirely the right degree of natural patience necessary for parenting. In that case, you might prefer to go back to work following the birth of your child. Under the status quo, you could not work and draw your normal salary and still get the full child-care benefit, even though some child benefits are paid automatically.\n\nSo the system has some potential inefficiency. You may stay at home just to get the money, even when an alternate arrangement might be better for everyone.\n\nNow add grandparents to this equation. If the grandparents can be paid to take care of your child, all of a sudden the extended family as a whole doesn\'t lose the money by having the parent go back to work. Instead, that money is transferred to the grandparents, so the work disincentive is diminished.\n\nAnd economists will tell you that the parents and grandparents can do their own settling up. If the grandparents are well-to-do, for instance, and eager to spend time with their grandkids, they might funnel some of that money back to the parents or the child, either directly or indirectly. In some cases, on net, the grandparents may not end up getting paid anything at all.\n\nIn essence, you can think of this policy as a model designed to maximize gains from trade.\n\nOne side effect is that, to the extent the parent who returns to work is a high earner, government tax revenue will increase. That will help pay for the policy, partially if not entirely.\n\nThe logic for this policy may hold all the more for single parents. In that case, the costs of giving up work may be even higher. That\'s because on a single income, climbing the career ladder and investing in future earnings will be all the more important. Enlisting aid from grandparents may also be more necessary, given the higher burdens on a single caregiver. A defender of the policy would cite these accommodative benefits, whereas a critic might allege they encourage single parenthood too much.\n\nMore broadly, fiscal conservatives might point out that the policy still costs some money upfront, while social conservatives might argue that it commodifies family relationships. The policy\'s supporters, on the other hand, might note that it can help some people get back to work and also make the grandparents happier. The children might benefit, too.\n\nI am still unsure if this policy is a good idea, though it has stronger virtues and benefits than I first thought. But I am all the more certain of one final lesson: Framing is everything. The very same policy, described in different terms, can sound eminently reasonable or badly out of whack. Keep that in mind next time you are tempted to render a quick verdict on someone else\'s idea.\n\nCowen is a Bloomberg columnist, professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog.\n\n___\n\nLove\n\n0\n\nFunny\n\n0\n\nWow\n\n0\n\nSad\n\n0\n\nAngry\n\n0\n\nCatch the latest in Opinion\n\nGet opinion pieces, letters and editorials sent directly to your inbox weekly!\n\nSign up!\n\n* I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy.', 'source': {'uri': 'qctimes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The Quad-City Times'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/qctimes.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/f/1d/f1dcd414-c38f-594e-925a-91d9fa471123/6697b3d0c98ae.preview.jpg?crop=1765%2C927%2C0%2C123&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': 'eng-9738640', 'sentiment': 0.1058823529411765, 'wgt': 458921115, 'relevance': 36}

{'uri': '2024-07-424897086', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:04:04', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:04:04Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:32:00Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/i-spy-laggard-5-divvies-92-buy-instead', 'title': 'I SPY a Laggard: 5 Divvies Up to 9.2% to Buy Instead', 'body': 'You\'ve got some SPY in your portfolio. So much in fact you\'re probably trying to quickly change the subject from the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY).\n\nI\'m not mad. (I\'m just disappointed--ha!) We refer to SPY as "America\'s ticker for a reason." It is everywhere.\n\nAnd it\'s OK. Really it is. Holding SPY has worked out this year. But we\'re now at an inflection point--which is why we are having this conversation.\n\nOnly three stocks account for 21% of the S&P 500. Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA) and Microsoft (MSFT) determine the entire market\'s moves! This trio is tired. The "S&P 3" need a rest.\n\nWhich means money is about to flow into the forgotten 497. (Technically the overlooked 500 as the S&P 500 actually contains 503 stocks. We contrarians appreciate these nuances.)\n\nLet\'s discuss five dividend payers that are likely to lap SPY between now and the end of the year. Unlike the tired tech names, these "boring" dividends are due for a rally.\n\nThey are utilities. And I\'m most interested in them because sometimes income investing is just that simple. Utility stocks are "bond proxies" that benefit directly from falling rates. When rates drop, the \'utes rally:\n\nWhen Rates Decline, Utilities Rally\n\nThe purple line is Utilities Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLU). the utility fund that basic investors and money managers buy. Over the past year, XLU rallied 24%. The catalyst? A lower 10-year Treasury rate, which eased from 5% to 4.2%.\n\nUtility stocks became so hot in May that mainstream pubs like The Wall Street Journal proclaimed them a "hot bet on AI"--ha! The narrative? Skyrocketing demand for electricity to support AI algorithms would benefit utilities. A connection so loose it\'s laughable.\n\nAren\'t lower rates the real driver of the move in the \'utes?\n\nWe basically started the utility stock bandwagon here at Contrarian Outlook. With the Federal Reserve set to cut rates sooner rather than later, utilities remain a best buy right now--before they grab attention.\n\nAnother 0.8% decline in the 10-year yield could bring another terrific 24% price pop for the \'utes.\n\nBut rather than buy vanilla XLU and its 3.2% yield, we\'ll supersize our dividend. Let\'s begin with Cohen & Steers Infrastructure Fund (UTF), my "go to" ticker for utility and infrastructure stocks. It pays 7.8% and gives us instant exposure to 242 terrific names including American Tower (AMT), The Southern Company (SO) and NextEra Energy (NEE).\n\nSometimes we are fortunate enough to snag UTF at a discount to its net asset value (NAV). Today it trades at par. Take UTF anytime it\'s at par or below because its NAV will gain as rates decline.\n\nReaves Utility Income (UTG) is a similar play. UTG yields a bit more at 8% and also trades at par.\n\nUTG focuses on higher yield plays, so it uses less leverage (20% versus 30% for UTF) to deliver its elite 8% dividend.\n\nUTG\'s premium is familiar territory. The fund\'s markup has wandered as high as 13% in recent years! We could see "premium expansion" happen again with falling rates providing a nice boost for its underlying holdings.\n\nDNP Select Income (DNP) is another fund that owns electric utilities and dishes an even bigger dividend. The fund is popular with income investors because it pays a monthly 6.5 cent dividend that nets out to a nifty 9.2% annually.\n\nDNP often trades at a premium to its net asset value (NAV)--in fact earlier this year, it fetched a 31% markup! In other words, investors were paying $1.31 for a dollar in assets. Not us!\n\nBut now, thanks to the recent pullback in utilities, DNP\'s premium is down to 4%, which may be as low as we see it this cycle. We like it.\n\nLooking for individual utility plays? Here are a couple of ideas to cherry pick.\n\nDominion Energy (D) lowered its dividend back in 2020 and has been in the doghouse since. The "dividend magnet" works both ways. After Dominion cut, its stock price was eventually punished. But the selloff looks overdone, and this utility has some upside to catch up with its payout:\n\nDominion\'s Dividend Magnet is Due\n\nWhy the 2020 chop? Too much debt, of course. Dominion had embarked on an acquisition binge in the name of growth. Which, ironically, backfired.\n\nThe result was a rare payout slash from a utility--an income investor\'s worst nightmare. That\'s why first-level investors keep Dominion in the doghouse today.\n\nWhich intrigues us here at Contrarian Outlook. Chief financial officers (CFOs) are like carpenters. It\'s best if they measure twice and cut only once.\n\nAs a result, the safest dividend is often the one recently cut. Unless management is a complete clown show, the last thing they want is to have to cut twice. They don\'t have the nose for it!\n\nMeanwhile, American Electric Power (AEP) is a "dividend magnet" favorite. This regulated utility boasts 5.6 million customers across 11 states. "Regulated" means AEP has a "high floor" in terms of earnings, because regulators approve rates that afford utilities enough profits to serve customers but without gouging them. These profits grind higher and higher.\n\nAEP recently reached a deal with activist investor Carl Icahn for two board seats. Icahn, surely, was attracted to the company because of its consistent earnings growth. Since 2010, AEP has compounded its earnings by 5% per year and recently accelerated to 6.5%:\n\nAEP Earnings and CAGR\n\nAEP is a "pure play" on dividend growth. Over the past decade the company\'s dividend has catapulted 76% from $2.00 to $3.52 per share:\n\nAEP: A Steady Dividend Grower\n\nSource: Income Calendar\n\nAbout that 76% dividend climb. AEP\'s stock price 45% rise lags the divvie. That\'s one reason for spicey upside we rarely see from a utility. As rates cool down, AEP\'s dividend magnet could really pull shares higher:\n\nAEP\'s Dividend Magnet is Due\n\nSource: Income Calendar\n\nAEP\'s earnings always rise. Its payout always climbs. Its stock price overshoots and undershoots its dividend, as stocks do. But, over time, its price rises with its payout.\n\nThe views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.', 'source': {'uri': 'nasdaq.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'NASDAQ Stock Market'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'bnk_invest@nasdaq.com', 'name': 'Bnk Invest', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://www.nasdaq.com/sites/acquia.prod/files/2019-05/0902-Q19%20Total%20Markets%20photos%20and%20gif_CC8.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.0980392156862746, 'wgt': 458921044, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230137054', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:03:59', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:03:59Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T14:03:30Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://napavalleyregister.com/news/local/napa-flood-control-eminent-domain-environment-weather/article_5e14c91a-42d5-11ef-b499-2f766a6b2670.html', 'title': 'Napa County acquiring land for flood wall project', 'body': 'A new Napa River flood control project segment to be built between Lincoln Avenue and the Oxbow is to include a river trail.\n\nHere\'s a sign the latest Napa River flood control project phase is moving forward -- the Napa County Flood Control and Water Conservation District is acquiring land.\n\nAbout 45 properties in the city of Napa are needed for the next big push. So far, the district has three agreements and has made 40 offers based on appraisals, with the coming months promising a flurry of activity.\n\n"It\'s quite a process," said Richard Thomasser, the district manager.\n\nThe flood control district is poised to use eminent domain powers to acquire land when negotiations with owners fail, allowing the Napa County Superior Court to settle the price.\n\nThis next phase of the flood control project involves building a flood wall on the west side of the Napa River for about a mile, from near the Elks Lodge south of Trancas Street past Lincoln Avenue to the Oxbow area. The goal is to protect hundreds of properties from the peak flood level expected every 100 years.\n\nPeople are also reading... $400K in unpaid bills for grapes lead to slew of lawsuits against Napa winemaker Ryan Seacrest\'s Napa County home up for sale at $22 million Customers are raving about Moulin -- downtown Napa\'s new café and bakery Hank McGraw, onetime baseball phenom turned maverick and late-life Napan, dead at 81 Letter: Concerns about St. Helena Agritourism Initiative Mount Veeder vineyard owners sue own lawyers over money tied to Tubbs Fire Napa City Council to weigh selling land for downtown development Napa High School Athletic Hall of Fame: Cabral learned from sports how to battle adversity in life Why is that? Here\'s the lowdown on some Napa head-scratchers Napa County, Hoopes winery file closing arguments in legal clash St. Helena Cyclery to reopen in wake of Trek\'s closure Trump injured but \'fine\' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Fight between Le Petit Elephant and Alta Heights neighbors gets personal Authorities hunt for clues, but motive of man who tried to assassinate Donald Trump remains elusive Defendants in Napa double murder delay pleas to Sept. 17\n\nConstruction of the project, which is to include a public trail, is scheduled to begin in late 2025.\n\nOn Tuesday, the flood control district\'s board of directors met and acquisitions were on the agenda. The board approved buying 1.42 acres of vacant industrial land along the Napa River at 501 North Bay Drive near Lincoln Avenue for $675,000.\n\nThe board was also scheduled to initiate eminent domain for vacant property at 1114 Jordan Lane south of Lincoln Avenue. The district and owners have been unable to agree on a price for a 15-foot-wide strip of land along the river and temporary construction easements.\n\nBut the board needs a two-thirds vote to initiate eminent domain. Not enough members attended the meeting to meet that threshold.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\n"To be continued," said board chair and Napa Mayor Scott Sedgley.\n\nDistrict engineer Andrew Butler told the board that 95% of the design for the project should be completed in the fall. Sedgley called this "really good news."\n\nThis latest phase of the flood control project is to protect an area near Lincoln Avenue and along Soscol Avenue that last flooded during the 2005-06 New Year\'s Eve storms. Muddy Napa River water spilled onto streets and into homes and businesses.\n\nFlood control has long been a concern locally, with the Napa Valley experiencing about two dozen major floods since pioneer days. But the community balked when the federal government in the 1960s proposed lining a section of the Napa River with concrete as a solution.\n\nBig storms in February 1986 once again put flood control in the spotlight. Flooding caused an estimated $140 million in damage, destroyed 250 homes and prompted 7,000 evacuations in Napa Valley.\n\nNapa County communities and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers launched the Napa River flood control project in 1998. Voters passed a now-expired half-cent sales tax to help fund the undertaking, with the federal and state governments also providing money.\n\nFlood control Napa-style would not involve a concrete-lined river. Instead, the emphasis would be on a "living river" concept depending largely on floodplains and flood walls.\n\nSince then, the city of Napa has seen such work down as major bridges replaced and floodplains created. The last major project was the $18.5 million flood control bypass between the Oxbow area and downtown, completed in 2015 and named the Oxbow Commons.\n\nBut work remained. In 2021, Rep. Mike Thompson, D-St. Helena, announced the Army Corps of Engineers would provide $48.3 million for remaining portions of the flood control project. Local funds, grants and developer contributions were to boost the total to about $94 million.\n\nThe Lincoln Avenue-area project is coming first. Next, the flood control district plans to construct a flood wall and trail along the western river from Imola Avenue to near the Napa County Library, much of it along Riverside Drive. Work is also to be done in the Oxbow area.\n\nThrowback Thursday: A look at the Napa River St. Helena on the Napa River Schooner on the Napa River Napa River Scene Napa River 1920 Flood of 1940 at Pearl Street Napa River Sailboats on the Napa River Service boat in Napa River Uncle Sam Wine Cellars from the Napa River Zinfandel Steamer in the Napa River Gondola on the Napa River\n\nYou can reach Barry Eberling at 707-256-2253 or beberling@napanews.com\n\nGet local news delivered to your inbox!\n\nSubscribe to our Daily Headlines newsletter.\n\nSign up! * I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy. {'uri': '8230136491', 'lang': 'ind', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:03:53', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:03:53Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T14:03:14Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.cantika.com/read/1892228/daftar-bos-startup-perempuan-dari-mesty-ariotedjo-hingga-amanda-simandjuntak', 'title': 'Daftar Bos Startup Perempuan, dari Mesty Ariotedjo hingga Amanda Simandjuntak', 'body': 'CANTIKA.COM, Jakarta - Sektor startup masih dianggap sebagai kekuatan penting bagi pertumbuhan ekonomi dan penciptaan lapangan kerja juga sering menjadi katalisator inovasi radikal, sehingga tetap menarik di kalangan pencari kerja terutama generasi milenial dan generasi z. Beberapa perusahaan rintisan ini juga dipimpin dan didirikan oleh bos startup perempuan yang tentu saja memberi warna\n\nBerikut ulasan Cantika deretan bos startup perempuan yang inspiratif: 1. Mesty Ariotedjo - Tentang Anak\n\nKebanyakan orang tua mungkin memiliki kecenderungan cemas, kurang informasi, dan merasa sendirian saat membesarkan anak. Terlebih lagi, di Indonesia, hanya terdapat sekitar 4.000 dokter anak yang melayani 80 juta anak Indonesia. Hal ini menyebabkan upaya promotif dan preventif terkait pola asuh mungkin belum dapat diakses oleh sebagian besar orang tua.\n\nBaca Juga:\n\nAlasan Mesty Ariotedjo Rilis Aplikasi Tentang Anak, Orang Tua Tak Merasa Sendiri\n\nHal ini memotivasi Mesty Ariotedjo dan Garri Juanda untuk mengembangkan Tentang Anak. Sebuah aplikasi terpadu yang dapat dipercaya untuk mendukung orang tua dalam merawat anak mereka mulai dari kehamilan hingga lima tahun pertama (masa emas) dan seterusnya.\n\nDalam rangka merayakan Hari Keluarga Nasional yang jatuh pada tanggal 29 Juni 2024, Google Play berkesempatan berbincang dengan Mesty Ariotedjo mengenai Tentang Anak, aplikasi ekosistem parenting miliknya, berkolaborasi untuk mengedukasi masyarakat tentang pentingnya peran keluarga dalam membangun bangsa.\n\n"Kami mengawalinya dengan misi untuk mendorong para orang tua agar percaya diri dan yakin dalam mengasuh anaknya dengan membekali mereka dengan pengetahuan yang relevan untuk terus memantau dan memberikan rangsangan positif bagi tumbuh kembang anaknya," kata Mesty melalui siaran pers, Senin, 1 Juli 2024.\n\nBaca Juga:\n\nStartup Lokal Ini Bekerja Sama dengan 7 Produk Kecantikan Asal Taiwan, Apa Saja?\n\nDi Indonesia, hanya ada sekitar 4.000 dokter anak untuk melayani 80 juta anak Indonesia. Berbagai usaha promotif dan tindakan preventif terkait mengasuh anak belum dapat menjangkau sebagian besar orang tua dan pengasuh. Oleh karena itu, banyak dari mereka yang merasa sendiri, cemas, dan belum paham saat mengasuh anak mereka.\n\n"Aplikasi Tentang Anak ingin mendampingi 30 juta orang tua mengasuh anaknya agar mereka dapat tumbuh sehat dan sejahtera, terutama dalam periode emas dari masa kehamilan hingga 5 tahun pertama. Tentang Anak dikembangkan langsung oleh ahlinya, termasuk dokter anak, psikolog anak, dokter obgyn, bidan, hingga perencana keuangan keluarga dalam satu aplikasi," ucap Mesty.\n\nTantangan yang dirasa sulit bagi Mesty ialah bagaimana menjangkau masyarakat luas di Indonesia yang bervariasi dalam penggunaan teknologi. Misalnya, aplikasi versi terbaru belum dapat diunduh ke ponsel mereka karena kemampuan ponsel yang belum memadai atau karena keterbatasan kuota data.\n\n2. Asri Wijayanti - Jahitin\n\nAsri Wijayanti - Jaitin. Dok. Antara\n\nTidak perlu ribet. Ingin punya busana yang ngetrend plus enak dipakai? Klik "Jahitin" saja. Maksudnya, buatlah baju idamanmu secara daring/online melalui situs jahitin.com. Iya, sekarang, kita bisa meminta dijahitkan baju atau busana lainnya secara daring/online. Siapkan kainnya, pilih modelnya, selanjutnya biar jahitin.com yang menjahitnya.\n\nAdalah Asri Wijayanti, seorang fashionpreneur asal Surabaya yang mengembangkan bisnis fashion dengan cara unik. Ia mengagas starup jahitin.com, yakni layanan jahit online dengan konsep economy sharing, menghubungkan para penjahit dengan pelanggan yang membutuhkan.\n\nSejak awal, Unit CDC Telkom Surabaya mendampingi jahitin.com lewat program kemitraan dan bina lingkungan (PKBL). Jahitin hingga kini terus bertahan, bahkan semakin berkibar."Usaha jahit online ini tidak akan seperti sekarang tanpa dukungan akses internet. Tanpa internet tidak akan ada jahitin.com," ungkap Asri yang kini menjadi CEO itu.\n\nAsri mengaku senang bergabung sebagai mitra binaan Telkom. Ia menjadi lebih semangat membesarkan jahitin.com. Selain memberikan pendampingan, pelatihan dan bantuan permodalan, Telkom juga memberikan pelatihan bagaimana mengurus berbagai perizinan. "Awalnya, waktu kuliah dulu, saya sering kesulitan menemukan penjahit," katanya tentang awal gagasannya mendirikan jahitin.com.\n\nApalagi, banyak penjahit rumahan yang enggan mempromosikan jasanya. Dari situlah, pada 2016 muncul gagasan mempertemukan penjahit dengan konsumennya lewat sebuah layanan digital. "Pelanggan pertama jahitin.com adalah teman-teman saya (mahasiswi) di Malang," kenang Asri. Layanan jahit online semakin disukai netizen, karena praktis, aman dan kualitas jahitannya terjamin.\n\nCara kerja jahitin.com sederhana, customer mengisi form di situs jahitin.com. Sediakan kain dan tentukan model pakaian yang akan dijahit. Pelanggan bisa mengirimkan kain ke kantor Jahitin.com untuk dipola dan dipotong atau dipola di workshop Jahitin.com. Setelah itu dikirimkan kepada mitra penjahit rumahan yang dipilih.\n\nBisa juga customer mengunggah foto model baju. Jika sudah pas, konsumen mengirim kain ke alamat penjahit yang sudah dipilih. Pembayaran melalui jahitin.com, bisa dilakukan di muka atau setelah pesanan rampung. Tentu tidak sebatas mempertemukan penjahit rumahan dengan pelanggan, pihaknya terus memantau penyelesaian pesanan. Secara khusus tim jahitin melakukan proses quality control, ketepatan waktu penyelesaian dan proses pembayarannya.\n\n"Enaknya, pelanggan tak perlu keluar rumah, jika diperlukan tim jahitin akan menjemput kain, dan mengantarkan jika pesanan sudah selesai," ungkap Asri.\n\nSelain menghubungkan pelanggan dengan penjahit, jahitin.com juga membuka Jahitin Academy, yakni pelatihan khusus untuk para penjahit. "Jahitin.com memang baru bisa diakses melalui website. Harapannya sih, jahitin.com bisa membuat aplikasi, jadi semua bisa diatur melalui aplikasi itu, dan bisa merambah ke banyak tempat lagi," jelas Asri.\n\nCita-cita Asri tidak hanya mempertemukan supply dan demand, ia juga terpanggil untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan para penjahit. Saat ini jahitin.com mengelola tak kurang dari 2.000 penjahit rumahan yang tersebar di seluruh Indonesia dengan omset sekitar Rp3 Miliar per bulan.\n\nAsri berharap UMKM binaan Telkom yang memiliki line bisnis di bidang fashion bisa bersinergi dengan jahitin.com. "Kita bersinergi agar lebih efisien dan memperluas pasar," katanya. Asri menjelaskan, pihaknya juga menyediakan layanan Jahitin Store, yang menyediakan peralatan dan material yang diperlukan dalam menjahit, termasuk pola, kain, label merek dan sebagainya.\n\nJahitin.com hingga kini terus bertahan, bahkan semakin berkibar. UMKM ini juga tetap setia kepada misi pemberdayaan ekonomi yang dianut. Di masa pandemi ini jahitin tetap sibuk melayani pelanggan.\n\nIa memang berharap agar yang bisa memproduksi tidak hanya di kota besar melainkan di setiap daerah. Bahkan, alamat jahitin.com ada di Diamond Park Residence B5-1, Sedati, Sidoarjo, Jawa Timur. "Kami melihat peluang dan tren yang ada, apa yang sekarang paling dibutuhkan masyarakat. Kami harus bertahan, sebab kami tidak hanya hidup untuk keuntungan perusahaan tetapi juga terkait kelangsungan hidup para penjahit," tutur Asri.\n\nSebagai salah satu pemenang kompetisi startup NextDev, melalui UMKM yang dikelolanya, Asri berharap bisa membantu meningkatkan pendapat para penjahit rumahan.\n\nInovasi platform pasar digital memang memberi peluang bagi pertumbuhan ekosistem industri dan ekonomi lokal yang ramah biaya. Jahitin.com sudah membuktikan apa pun bisa terjadi dengan inovasi digital, termasuk di masa pandemi seperti sekarang ini.\n\n3. Fransiska P. W. H - Perlo\n\nFransiska P. W. H - Prelo. Tangkapan layar YouTube\n\nMungkin belum banyak yang pernah mendengar nama Fransiska Hadiwidjana. Namun, sudah banyak orang yang akrab dengan Prelo, situs dan aplikasi yang dirintisnya.\n\nPrelo, seperti kebanyakan perusahaan berbasis teknologi informasi yang sekarang sedang berkembang di Indonesia, adalah perusahaan start-up yang melayani jual-beli barang. Namun, yang membedakan dari para pesaingnya, Prelo memfokuskan pada jual-beli barang bekas bermerek. Mayoritas barang yang dijual berupa barang fashion dan kosmetika, dan kini juga sudah merambah ke barang lain, seperti gadget dan buku. Selain itu, Prelo juga menyediakan jasa titip dan sewa.\n\nPrelo menggunakan sistem rekening bersama sehingga dijamin terpercaya untuk melakukan transaksi jual beli. Perusahaan ini didirikan dengan semangat ramah lingkungan, yang bertujuan mengoptimalkan barang bekas agar tidak terbuang begitu saja. Sebelum menjadi Prelo, embrio perusahaan ini adalah Kleora, startup e-commerce khusus perempuan. Prelo merupakan rebranding dari Kleora yang bertujuan untuk menjaring demografi lebih luas, dan ini terbukti dengan berkembangnya Prelo.\n\nFransiska yang merupakan alumni Informatika \'08 juga masuk ke dalam daftar 10 Pengusaha Wanita Paling Inspiratif di Bidang Teknologi Dari SEA versi Forbes. Prestasinya tidak hanya itu. Fransiska sempat mengikuti program tahunan Singularity University Graduate Studies Program 2012 (GSP 12), yaitu insititut pendidikan interdisipliner yang berlokasi di NASA AMes Research Park dengan bekerja bersama Google, Nokia, Autodesk, dan lainnya.\n\nBerada di dunia teknologi informasi yang identik dengan banyaknya laki-laki tidak membuatnya gentar. "Ketika saya masuk jurusan teknologi informatika ITB, hanya ada 20 persen perempuan dalam satu kelas. Memang sedikit jumlah perempuan tapi untuk menghapus stigma ini, kita harus percaya dengan apa yang kita bisa," Fransiska mengingatkan.\n\n"Saya selalu berfokus di software atau perangkat lunak. Memanfaatkan pengembangan perangkat lunak agar menjadi sesuatu yang berguna bagi masyarakat itu selalu menjadi cita-cita saya," jelasnya.\n\nPada wawancara dengan salah satu stasiun radio lokal, ia menceritakan bahwa ketika duduk di bangku SD, dirinya telah memiliki ketertarikan pada dunia teknologi. Semua itu berawal dari hobinya bermain game dikomputer. Hal itu pun yang membuatnya semakin penasaran untuk mengotak-atik komputer. Dunia komputer dan programming merupakan suatu hal yang menarik bagi Fransiska. Oleh karena itu, ia pernah meraih kemenangan dalam kompetisi coding dan pemrograman.\n\n4. Melia Winata - Du Anyam\n\nMelia Winata - Duanyam. Dok. Instagram pribadi.\n\nMelia Winata, Chief Marketing Officer dan Co-founder Du Anyam & Krealogi. Awalnya ia dilibatkan dalam usaha grosir dan eceran milik keluarganya serta berkesempatan meniti karir di industri pialang real estate, membuat pengalaman dan pola pikir strategis bisnis Melia semakin berkembang. Dengan kompetensi dan kredibilitasnya di bidang wirausaha, serta jaringan yang luas, Melia berharap agar ia bisa memperluas produksi dan jaringan usaha kecil dan menengah semakin pesat melalui Krealogi.\n\nBerkat hasratnya yang tinggi dalam dunia bisnis, melia berhasil mengelola sendiri lebih dari 100 portofolio penjualan di Du Anyam. Perempuan lulusan melboune University ini juga telah membawa Du Anyam menjadi salah satu merchandise resmi Asian Games 2028.\n\nMelia Winata dipilih oleh Forbes menjadi anak muda paling berpengaruh dalam Forbes Indonesia "30 under 30" 2020. Semoga pencapaian ini menjadi inspirasi anak muda dan wirausaha sosial lainnya dalam berkarya untuk negeri.\n\nLahirnya Du Anyam pada tahun 2014 berangkat dari tingginya masalah sosial ekonomi dibalik angka malnutrisi pada ibu dan anak di Flores Timur, Nusa Tenggara Timur.\n\nIklan Scroll Untuk Melanjutkan\n\nSaat itu, biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari masih menjadi tantangan tersendiri bagi masyarakat desa. Masyarakat seringkali harus menunggu musim panen tiba untuk memperoleh pendapatan, sehingga masyarakat tidak memiliki tabungan yang cukup dan merasakan kesulitan dalam melakukan perencanaan keuangan.\n\nHal ini menyebabkan tingginya angka malnutrisi pada anak serta ketidakmampuan masyarakat untuk membuat keputusan pembelian kebutuhan pokok yang mempertimbangkan gizi.\n\nTak sedikit keluarga yang hanya mengandalkan sepetak kebun di rumah mereka sebagai sumber pangan. Bahkan banyak pula di antara mereka yang terpaksa harus menempuh perjalanan berjam-jam menuju pasar di desa atau kabupaten lain demi menjual hasil anyaman untuk membeli makanan atau komoditas lain karena rantai pasok yang tidak efisien.\n\nDidorong oleh keinginan untuk memberdayakan dan meningkatkan kesejahteraan ibu dan anak di pedesaan Indonesia, didirikanlah Du Anyam (Du\'a: ibu; Anyam: menganyam)\n\nbos startup perempuanStartupMesty Ariotedjoamanda simandjuntakArdelia Apti\n\nHalaman\n\n1.2. L\'aggiornamento rappresenta un nuovo sviluppo della piattaforma di IA linguistica di DeepL per le aziende, ridefinendo lo standard del settore in termini di qualità e prestazioni.\n\nGli ultimi risultati del nuovo modello alzano notevolmente l\'asticella per la qualità della traduzione automatica. Test indipendenti dimostrano che gli esperti linguisti preferiscono le traduzioni di DeepL rispetto a Google Traduttore (1,3 volte), ChatGPT-4 (1,7 volte) e Microsoft (2,3 volte).\n\nLe traduzioni tramite il modello di ultima generazione sono per ora disponibili per i clienti DeepL Pro che traducono in inglese, giapponese, tedesco e cinese semplificato, con altre lingue in arrivo. Il nuovo LLM è disponibile nel traduttore online selezionando l\'opzione "Modello di ultima generazione", permettendo così agli utenti di avere un controllo più accurato sulle traduzioni. Con l\'abbonamento a DeepL Pro, i dati degli utenti sono protetti secondo elevati standard di sicurezza, includendo la conformità al GDPR, la certificazione ISO 27001 e la SOC 2 di tipo 2.\n\nDalla sua nascita nel 2017, DeepL è diventato il fornitore di IA linguistica di riferimento per le aziende di tutto il mondo. L\'azienda ha recentemente lanciato DeepL per le imprese, una soluzione linguistica pensata per rispondere alle esigenze in continua evoluzione delle aziende che cercano di integrare soluzioni IA. La rapida crescita di DeepL è confermata dalla sua rete di clienti in forte espansione, che comprende più di 100.000 aziende, enti governativi e altre organizzazioni in tutto il mondo, inclusa metà delle imprese nella lista Fortune 500.\n\nA maggio 2024, DeepL ha raccolto un nuovo investimento da 300 milioni di dollari con una valutazione di 2 miliardi di dollari, in un round guidato dalla rinomata società di investimenti late-stage Index Ventures.', 'source': {'uri': 'ceotech.it', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'CeoTech'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'team_ceotech@ceotech.it', 'name': 'Team Ceotech', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://www.ceotech.it/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/DeepL-alza-lasticella-con-un-nuovo-modello-linguistico-LLM-960x540.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920953, 'relevance': 14}

Χατζηδάκης\n\nΣτην προσήλωση της κυβέρνησης να παραμείνει συνεπής στην πολιτική της δημοσιονομικής σοβαρότητας εστίασε ο υπουργός Εθνικής Οικονομίας και Οικονομικών Κωστής Χατζηδάκης μιλώντας στο "7th InvestGR Forum 2024: Charting the Future".\n\nΌπως είπε, "εκείνοι που ντύνονται πρόσκαιρα Αη Βασίληδες αποδεικνύονται Δρακουμέλ", καθώς υπόσχονται περισσότερα από όσα αντέχουν τα δημοσιονομικά περιθώρια οδηγώντας σε αυτά που έζησε η χώρα την περασμένη δεκαετία.\n\nΟ κ. Χατζηδάκης σημείωσε πως η Ελλάδα έχει καταφέρει να παρουσιάζει πλεονάσματα στην εκτέλεση του προϋπολογισμού χωρίς να αυξηθούν οι φόροι. Όπως είπε, τα τελευταία δυο χρόνια αυτό επετεύχθη κυρίως με την αύξηση των ρυθμών ανάπτυξης που είναι από τους υψηλότερους στην Ευρώπη, αλλά και μέσω της συστηματικής προσπάθειας αντιμετώπισης της φοροδιαφυγής που αποδίδει καρπούς. Ο ρόλος του πληθωρισμού έχει περιοριστεί σημαντικά καθώς έχει καταγράψει σημαντική μείωση από το 9% πριν από μία διετία στο 2,5% σήμερα. Έτσι, η κυβέρνηση έχει τη δυνατότητα να εκτελεί τον προϋπολογισμό με συνέπεια, να καλύπτει τις ανάγκες των πολιτών και να παραμένει έτοιμη για την αντιμετώπιση έκτακτων φαινομένων, όπως οι φυσικές καταστροφές.\n\n"Στο τέλος της διαδρομής, όταν έχεις πια αντιμετωπίσει πιο ριζικά το ζήτημα της φοροδιαφυγής, μπορείς να μειώσεις περισσότερο τους φόρους και τις ασφαλιστικές εισφορές. Άρα, η αντιμετώπιση της φοροδιαφυγής δεν είναι μόνο μια πολιτική που έχει ένα πρόσημο κοινωνικής δικαιοσύνης. Μπορείς και από φιλελεύθερη πλευρά αν το δεις, να συμπεράνεις ότι τελικά υπηρετείς την υγιή επιχειρηματικότητα και τις επενδύσεις, διότι αντιμετωπίζοντας αυτή τη διαρθρωτική αδυναμία της ελληνικής οικονομίας, μπορείς να έχεις το περιθώριο να μειώσεις τους φόρους και τις ασφαλιστικές εισφορές" ανέφερε χαρακτηριστικά ο κ. Χατζηδάκης.\n\nΕρωτώμενος για το ενδεχόμενο να υπάρξει μείωση των συντελεστών στον ΦΠΑ, ο κ. Χατζηδάκης τόνισε πως "πρέπει να ξεχωρίζουμε στην πατρίδα μας συνεχώς, μετά τη δραματική εμπειρία της περασμένης δεκαετίας, το λαϊκό από το λαϊκίστικο, το πραγματικά φιλολαϊκό από το δημαγωγικό", ενώ τόνισε πως η πρόταση για την μείωση του ΦΠΑ στην Ελλάδα "έχει ξεκάθαρα λαϊκίστικα χαρακτηριστικά". Όπως είπε, προηγούμενες κυβερνήσεις είχαν προχωρήσει σε μειώσεις των συντελεστών του ΦΠΑ χωρίς εντυπωσιακά αποτελέσματα και χωρίς να φθάνει στους καταναλωτές. "Δεν θέλουμε να κάνουμε το ίδιο λάθος. Θεωρούμε ότι στην Ισπανία που έγινε, δεν είχε αποτέλεσμα. Άλλωστε υπάρχουν περίοδοι, τώρα τελευταία, που η Ελλάδα σε κάποιους μήνες είχε και χαμηλότερο πληθωρισμό από την Ισπανία, χωρίς εμείς να έχουμε μειώσει τον ΦΠΑ", ανέφερε. Παράλληλα, τόνισε πως στην Ελλάδα δεν υπάρχει η ίδια ευελιξία όπως σε άλλες ευρωπαϊκές χώρες λόγω της εξυπηρέτησης του δημοσίου χρέους και των αμυντικών και συνταξιοδοτικών δαπανών. "Και τα τρία αυτά καθιστούν την Ελλάδα μια ξεχωριστή περίπτωση μέσα στην Ευρώπη" είπε υπογραμμίζοντας πως αν λείψουν οι πόροι αυτοί, το βάρος θα το επωμιστούν οι Έλληνες πολίτες.\n\nΜιλώντας για τις πρωτοβουλίες αντιμετώπισης του πληθωρισμού, ο κ. Χατζηδάκης σημείωσε πως "μαγικές συνταγές δεν υπάρχουν. Ευτυχώς το θέμα φαίνεται να κινείται -αν δεν τύχει κάτι απρόοπτο- σε μια αποκλιμάκωση. Στην Ελλάδα είχαμε 9% πληθωρισμό το 2022, 4% το 2023 και τώρα είμαστε στο 2,5%". Στο πλαίσιο αυτό υπενθύμισε τις κινήσεις που έχει ήδη κάνει η κυβέρνηση για την ενίσχυση των πολιτών: "Δεν αναφέρομαι μόνο στους ελέγχους της ΔΙΜΕΑ, ούτε στα πρόστιμα τα οποία έχουν επιβληθεί. Αναφέρομαι και στην αύξηση των μισθών των δημοσίων και ιδιωτικών υπαλλήλων. Η αύξηση του κατώτατου μισθού, εις πείσμα ορισμένων που επιμένουν να διαστρεβλώνουν την κατάσταση. Είναι αρκετά παραπάνω από την αύξηση του πληθωρισμού".\n\nΤέλος, αναφερόμενος στο νέο σύστημα φορολόγησης των ελεύθερων επαγγελματιών, ο κ. Χατζηδάκης σημείωσε πως "μόνο τρεις στους 10.000 ελεύθερους επαγγελματίες έχουν προχωρήσει σε αμφισβήτηση του φόρου εισοδήματος", τονίζοντας πως έως χθες το βράδυ 386.000 ελεύθεροι επαγγελματίες είχαν υποβάλει τις φορολογικές τους δηλώσεις και από εκείνους μόνο 122 έχουν προχωρήσει σε αμφισβήτηση.\n\n"Καταλαβαίνω πως δεν είναι ευχάριστο μέτρο για κάποιους, αλλά αν ήταν τόσο άδικη η φορολόγηση, εφόσον υπάρχουν δυνατότητες αμφισβήτησης, θα τις εκμεταλλεύονταν περισσότερο", υπογράμμισε λέγοντας πως φέτος, μετά από πολλές δεκαετίες ο μέσος εργαζόμενος και συνταξιούχος θα πληρώσει λιγότερους φόρους από τον μέσο ελεύθερο επαγγελματία. Απαντώντας σχετικά με το εάν θα υπάρξουν αλλαγές στο σύστημα φορολόγησης των ελευθέρων επαγγελματιών σημείωσε πως δεν έχει ολοκληρωθεί ακόμα η υποβολή των φορολογικών δηλώσεων προκειμένου να εξεταστούν οι διαθέσιμες επιλογές, τόνισε, όμως, πως "η κυβέρνηση, χωρίς να είναι αλαζονική και αδιάφορη, δεν μπορεί την ίδια στιγμή να υιοθετήσει στην πολιτική της μέτρα κοινωνικής αδικίας. Δηλαδή, δεν μπορεί σε καμιά περίπτωση να ξανάρθει και να πει στους συνταξιούχους και στους εργαζόμενους ότι "εσείς είστε τα υποζύγια, επειδή εμείς κάνουμε κάποιους υπολογισμούς πολιτικάντικου κόστους"", κατέληξε.\n\nΔιαβάστε τις Ειδήσεις σήμερα και ενημερωθείτε για τα πρόσφατα νέα.\n\nΑκολουθήστε το Skai.gr στο Google News και μάθετε πρώτοι όλες τις ειδήσεις.', 'source': {'uri': 'skai.gr', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'ΣΚΑΪ'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://cdn.skai.gr/sites/default/files/styles/article_16_9/public/2024-07/xatzidakis.jpg?itok=B8pRUD9d', 'eventUri': 'ell-946543', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920951, 'relevance': 34}

{'uri': '8230132205', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:01:06', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:01:06Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T14:00:28Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.9647058844566345, 'url': 'https://newsadvance.com/opinion/column/tyler-cowen-why-is-sweden-paying-grandparents-to-babysit-economist-says-its-worth-a-try/article_16ba1228-b214-547b-901d-937a96fc9b0c.html', 'title': "Tyler Cowen: Why is Sweden paying grandparents to babysit? Economist says it's worth a try", 'body': 'As Sweden attends its first NATO summit as a member, FRANCE 24\'s Nadia Massih spoke to Tobias Billström, Swedish Foreign Minister.\n\nAt first glance, the policy sounds absurd, especially to many Americans: In Sweden, grandparents are now eligible for government subsidies to babysit their grandchildren.\n\nAs a proud grandparent, I would be willing to pay to babysit my grandkids. (I don\'t have to, but I would.) It would feel wrong to accept government money for my services.\n\nAnd even in the Swedish context, the program seems excessive. The country has long had first-rate and well-subsidized child-care facilities, which is another reason not to pay grandparents anything, and Sweden already has high levels of government spending and taxation. Is this additional benefit -- and expenditure -- really what it needs?\n\nBut sometimes even apparently foolish ideas have such compelling rationales that you begin to rethink whether they\'re foolish at all. These are often the cases that require the hardest thinking.\n\nIf you look at Sweden\'s policy closely, it adheres pretty well to some basic economic principles: namely, the notion of "Pareto improvements," which benefit all parties involved.\n\nStart with the fact that Swedish parents currently receive extensive paid leave on the birth of a child, and so it can be said they are already paid to look after their children. Whether you agree with that policy, it is longstanding and well-established. Take it as a given.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nNow imagine that you are an ambitious Swedish doctor or lawyer, climbing the career ladder, and are self-aware enough to realize you do not always have entirely the right degree of natural patience necessary for parenting. In that case, you might prefer to go back to work following the birth of your child. Under the status quo, you could not work and draw your normal salary and still get the full child-care benefit, even though some child benefits are paid automatically.\n\nSo the system has some potential inefficiency. You may stay at home just to get the money, even when an alternate arrangement might be better for everyone.\n\nNow add grandparents to this equation. If the grandparents can be paid to take care of your child, all of a sudden the extended family as a whole doesn\'t lose the money by having the parent go back to work. Instead, that money is transferred to the grandparents, so the work disincentive is diminished.\n\nAnd economists will tell you that the parents and grandparents can do their own settling up. If the grandparents are well-to-do, for instance, and eager to spend time with their grandkids, they might funnel some of that money back to the parents or the child, either directly or indirectly. In some cases, on net, the grandparents may not end up getting paid anything at all.\n\nIn essence, you can think of this policy as a model designed to maximize gains from trade.\n\nOne side effect is that, to the extent the parent who returns to work is a high earner, government tax revenue will increase. That will help pay for the policy, partially if not entirely.\n\nThe logic for this policy may hold all the more for single parents. In that case, the costs of giving up work may be even higher. That\'s because on a single income, climbing the career ladder and investing in future earnings will be all the more important. Enlisting aid from grandparents may also be more necessary, given the higher burdens on a single caregiver. A defender of the policy would cite these accommodative benefits, whereas a critic might allege they encourage single parenthood too much.\n\nMore broadly, fiscal conservatives might point out that the policy still costs some money upfront, while social conservatives might argue that it commodifies family relationships. The policy\'s supporters, on the other hand, might note that it can help some people get back to work and also make the grandparents happier. The children might benefit, too.\n\nI am still unsure if this policy is a good idea, though it has stronger virtues and benefits than I first thought. But I am all the more certain of one final lesson: Framing is everything. The very same policy, described in different terms, can sound eminently reasonable or badly out of whack. Keep that in mind next time you are tempted to render a quick verdict on someone else\'s idea.\n\nCowen is a Bloomberg columnist, professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog.\n\n___\n\nCatch the latest in Opinion\n\nGet opinion pieces, letters and editorials sent directly to your inbox weekly!\n\nSign up! * I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy.', 'source': {'uri': 'newsadvance.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'NewsAdvance.com'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/newsadvance.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/1/6b/16ba1228-b214-547b-901d-937a96fc9b0c/6697b3d00b56e.preview.jpg?crop=1765%2C927%2C0%2C123&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': 'eng-9738640', 'sentiment': 0.05098039215686279, 'wgt': 458920866, 'relevance': 31}

Porém, esta é uma atividade que envolve alguns riscos e por isso deve encarada com responsabilidade e estratégia. Nesse sentido, confira em seguida algumas estratégias que podem trazer mais sucesso aos seus jogos de cassino.\n\nUma das estratégias que poderá considerar ao começar a jogar em cassinos online é aproveitar os bônus que são oferecidos. A maioria das plataformas disponibiliza uma diversidade de ofertas na forma de bônus ou promoções. Algumas das ofertas mais comuns incluem os bônus de boas-vindas, que são oferecidos a novos usuários quando fazem o seu primeiro registro. Também uma oferta comum são os bônus sem depósito que permitem que comece a jogar sem precisar fazer um primeiro depósito para começar a jogar. E outras ofertas comuns incluem promoções especiais ou programas de fidelidade para jogadores frequentes.\n\nAproveitar estas ofertas pode beneficiá-lo de várias formas, nomeadamente aumentando seu saldo inicial para jogar. Além disso, com algumas destas ofertas vêm incluídas rodadas grátis o que vai permitir que você possa experimentar novos jogos sem arriscar do seu dinheiro. Da mesma forma, ofertas como os bônus sem depósito também vão-lhe proporcionar a oportunidade de experimentar jogos, ou até mesmo as plataformas, sem precisar arriscar do seu próprio dinheiro. Isto vai assim reduzir o risco financeiro do jogo e também vai aumentar suas chances de ganhar, pois ao ter mais dinheiro para jogar você terá mais chances de acertar ou ativar um recurso especial em um jogo.\n\nPorém, antes de aceitar qualquer oferta, é fundamental que primeiro você leia atentamente os termos e condições do bônus ou promoção e entenda todos os requisitos. Para que possa aproveitar ao máximo a oferta, é importante que você saiba quais os requisitos desta, se poderá cumpri-los e se valem a pena. Sendo que geralmente os bônus têm restrições de jogos, requisitos de apostas específicos e validade para serem usufruídos.\n\nTambém fundamental para tirar o melhor partido e maior sucesso dos seus jogos de cassino, é que priorize a gestão responsável e inteligente do seu bankroll. Para começar, é importante que você defina um orçamento específico apenas para os seus jogos. Essa quantia não deve afetar seu bem-estar financeiro pessoal caso você perca esse dinheiro. Além disso, você poderá considerar separar o orçamento em sessões de jogo e não apostar a totalidade de uma vez só.\n\nIgualmente, defina um limite de perdas e ganhos e cumpra sempre esses limites de forma disciplinada, encerrando a sessão de jogo quando atingir esses limites. Lembre-se que ao gerir seu bankroll de forma responsável e disciplinada, não só poderá vir a evitar perdas maiores, como poderá aumentar seu tempo de jogo e diversão.\n\nOutro aspecto importante a ter em conta quando o objetivo é maximizar as chances de sucesso ao jogar em cassinos é a escolha correta dos jogos. Nesse sentido, você poderá considerar primeiro quais os jogos com as melhores odds, sendo que o blackjack, quando jogado com estratégia, é um dos que tem melhores odds. O mesmo se aplica ao baccarat quando a aposta é feito no banqueiro, assim como a roleta europeia ou o video poker.\n\nMas além das odds, é claro que também é importante que você considere suas preferências pessoais, pois jogar em jogos com as melhores odds mas que você não gosta ou que não são divertidos, pode ter resultados negativos. Além disso, é também fundamental que você considere seu nível de habilidade e experiência, sendo que se estiver começando a jogar o melhor é optar por jogos mais simples e fáceis de entender como os caça-níqueis.\n\nUma estratégia que também pode ajudar a maximizar suas chances de sucesso, é usar ferramentas de aposta. Estas irão ajudá-lo a estruturar e monitorar suas apostas, sendo que assim terá mais controle sobre toda a atividade. Porém, nenhuma destas ferramentas elimina por completo a vantagem da casa e os riscos ligados ao jogo mantêm-se. Assim, você poderá beneficiar de aplicativos de rastreamento de apostas, com as quais poderá registar e monitorar suas apostas, ganhos e perdas.\n\nCom isso, poderá mais facilmente identificar padrões de apostas ou erros, e tomar decisões mais informadas. A utilização de planilhas, do Excel ou Google Sheets, para documentar todos os detalhes das suas apostas também pode servir para o mesmo objetivo de monitorar suas apostas para identificar padrões ou erros. Além destas ferramentas, existe também software de análise de apostas através do qual você poderá ter acesso a uma análise detalhada e estatísticas que o poderão ajudar a melhorar suas estratégias de apostas.\n\nPara finalizar, uma das estratégias mais importante é que nunca se esqueça de praticar jogo responsável para evitar qualquer dano à sua vida pessoal, financeira e mental. É importante, nesse sentido, que você saiba reconhecer sinais de vício e que nesse caso implemente estratégias de controle, como definir limites, usar ferramentas de autoexclusão e procurar apoio. A ideia é que mantenha sempre uma relação saudável com os jogos de azar e que a diversão seja sempre o objetivo principal.', 'source': {'uri': 'cidadeverde.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'cidadeverde.com'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://cidadeverde.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=cover,g=top,q=80,f=auto,anim=false/https://cidadeverde.com/assets/images/cidadeverde-autopost-default-g.png', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920865, 'relevance': 12}

{'uri': '2024-07-424892229', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '14:00:12', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T14:00:12Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:50:23Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://districtadministration.com/rural-education-how-to-support-these-schools-with-edtech/', 'title': 'Rural education: How to support these schools with edtech', 'body': 'Karen Beerer has over 40 years of experience in public education and the educational technology industry and is currently serving as a member of her school district\'s board of directors and as Discovery Education\'s senior vice president of partner success.\n\nI am a proud resident of rural America. Our communities are resilient and innovative. Our crops feed the nation and our rivers and reservoirs provide clean drinking water. We provide the oil, coal, natural gas, hydroelectric and wind power that keeps the lights on in homes across the country. And our beautiful scenery is a welcome respite for urban and suburban Americans from all walks of life.\n\nBut rural America needs help. Quality healthcare is hard to find. Job opportunities can be limited. And our infrastructure -- roads, bridges, power grids and more -- is in disrepair.\n\nOur schools also face a litany of challenges, including:\n\nWhile these issues are similar to those schools in urban and suburban environments face, the relative isolation and lack of resources of rural school systems makes finding solutions problematic. In addition, the scale of the population impacted by these challenges is vast.\n\nToday in the United States, nearly one in five students attend rural schools. In 12 states -- Alaska, Iowa, Maine, Montana, Mississippi, New Hampshire, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, Vermont, and Wyoming -- at least half of the public schools are considered rural. (Showalter).\n\nWhile targeted policies and legislation, increased funding and a new level of community involvement are required to address the root causes of many of the education issues in rural communities, rural teachers across the country can begin to overcome these hurdles to learning through the thoughtful implementation of the latest generation of edtech services.\n\nAccessibility to curiosity-nurturing content\n\nLibraries can be few and far between in rural communities. Often, the local school is the only library available and, even then, costs often prohibit rural schools from maintaining a robust, modern library.\n\nThose of a certain age who grew up in rural communities might remember the Bookmobile. The Bookmobile would travel from school to school, offering students access to the limited books they carried or delivering pre-ordered books to students who thought ahead to make special requests.\n\n\'Talking Out of School\' podcast: Superintendent Atiya Perkins wants you to "pause for the cause"\n\nUnfortunately, the number of rural communities serviced by a Bookmobile has decreased significantly over the years. So, how do we provide new literature and nonfiction stories and books to our rural students?\n\nToday\'s generation of K-12 digital learning platforms provide literature to students through audiobooks, eBooks and animated stories. Often, these stories are coupled with ready-to-use activities supported by classroom-tested instructional strategies that create engaging educational experiences for students. Because these resources are delivered via high-speed internet, there is no longer a limit to the titles available to students.\n\nIn addition, these platforms are offering students much more than books. Today\'s digital learning platforms offer curated libraries of relevant, interesting videos, interactives, podcasts, virtual labs and much more that students can explore. In this way, today\'s edtech services are making libraries of content that nurture the innate curiosity in all learners more accessible to rural populations.\n\nScaling best practices\n\nIn the rural United States, some educators still teach in the equivalent of a one-room schoolhouse. This means that they are teaching every subject and every grade level and are managing every minute of the school day single-handedly.\n\nWhether a teacher works in a one-room schoolhouse or not, edtech can help tremendously by scaling best practices into any environment and empowering teachers to deliver more personalized and differentiated learning to students.\n\nFor example, adaptive learning resources can tailor the lessons based on student performance, ensuring they receive the right level of challenge and support. Also, data analytics can be used by teachers to track student progress and identify areas for help, making it easier to provide targeted interventions.\n\nIn addition, assistive technologies -- like speech-to-text software, screen readers and adjustable text sizes -- can make learning materials more accessible to students with differing abilities while language tools such as Google Translate can help multilingual learners understand and engage in course content.\n\nTogether, these tools and others can change the rural education landscape by providing instruction in ways that cater to individual needs, promote engagement and ensure inclusivity. By leveraging these innovative tools and approaches, we can create a more effective learning environment for all students.\n\nCareer exploration\n\nIf I look around my community in eastern Pennsylvania\'s Upper Bucks County, I can see career opportunities in agriculture, animal husbandry, construction, warehousing and more. When I expand my view to the areas around my immediate community, I can see careers in law enforcement, retail, healthcare and, of course, education.\n\nHowever, many of our rural students are looking for career paths beyond their local communities. Providing students with the ability to learn about new careers and career paths beyond their immediate surroundings is critical. E\n\ndtech resources can now connect students with industry professionals through virtual mentorship and Q&A sessions. This real-world interaction allows students to gain insights into various professions and understand the day-to-day realities of different careers.\n\nIn addition, virtual career counseling tools offer resources ranging from career assessments to college planning tools. These platforms can help students understand their skills and interests and match them with potential career options.\n\nEdtech is revolutionizing the way students explore and prepare for their careers. From personalized learning experiences to virtual career counseling and skill development, these technologies provide invaluable support in navigating the future. By leveraging these tools, students can uncover their passions, build essential skills and confidently step into their chosen career paths.\n\nProfessional learning\n\nRural educators often find it difficult to travel long distances to attend professional development conferences and sessions, not only because of the time and energy it takes to travel but also because they likely must cancel school because there is no substitute to cover their classes.\n\nEdtech offers avenues for synchronous or asynchronous professional learning that can keep teachers just as informed about the latest developments in instructional practice as their peers. In addition, professional learning communities like the Discovery Educator Network, Apple\'s Distinguished Educator program and others provide opportunities for teachers to stay connected through a global network of teachers.\n\nTeachers can share best practices, compare lessons and connect with career specialists to talk to their classroom. But most importantly, teachers have access to professional development that they can do when it fits their schedule.\n\nFor years, rural systems have lagged behind their suburban and urban counterparts in integrating edtech into instruction. But now, thanks to greater internet access and more affordable and innovative technologies, conditions are ripe for rural districts to catch up. Make no mistake -- I do not believe edtech alone will solve all the challenges facing rural education. However, by leveraging technology, we can create more effective learning environments for all students that can support them in achieving their full potential, no matter where they live.', 'source': {'uri': 'districtadministration.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'District Administration'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://districtadministration.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/165486823962a3490f9ad3f.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.388235294117647, 'wgt': 458920812, 'relevance': 12}
{'uri': '8230130783', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:59:51', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:59:51Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:59:31Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://betanews.com/2024/07/17/attackers-defeat-segs-using-segs/', 'title': 'Attackers defeat SEGs using... SEGs', 'body': 'Email security tools such as Secure Email Gateways (SEGs) often encode URLs that are embedded in emails. This enables the security appliance to scan the URL before the recipient visits the website.\n\nBut when SEGs detect URLs in emails that have already been SEG encoded they don\'t scan the URL. A new report from Cofense reveals that threat actors are making use of this to avoid detection.\n\nThis has been going on for some time, but the second quarter of this year, and May in particular, saw an increase in threat actors taking advantage of SEG encoding of malicious URLs before sending them to victims.\n\nThe four tools most commonly seen in use by threat actors to encode URLs and bypass SEGs in Q2 2024 are: VIPRE Email Security, BitDefender LinkScan, Hornet Security Advanced Threat Protection URL Rewriting, and Barracuda Email Gateway Defense Link Protection. Email campaigns using these tools to bypass SEGs have been seen in environments protected by everything from Proofpoint to Microsoft ATP.\n\nDocuSign and Microsoft are the spoofed brands most often seen in these phishing campaigns. Common themes include content requiring a signature and voicemail or withheld email notifications.\n\nThe report notes that, "Because of how these campaigns are constructed, namely the fact that threat actors are abusing legitimate functions of security appliances, SEGs of all types have difficulty catching them. The easiest way to prevent them would be to tune SEGs to be suspicious of all embedded URLs and to scan them regardless of the apparent domain name. That said, few SEGs provide that option. In fact, there are very few automated steps that can be taken to prevent these campaigns."\n\nCofense says that employees need to be trained to be aware of things like sender addresses as those emails spotted by the research all had a \'From\' address that didn\'t match up to the contents of the email.', 'source': {'uri': 'betanews.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'BetaNews'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'ian_barker@betanews.com', 'name': 'Ian Barker', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://betanews.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/security-passed-email.jpg?w=640', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': -0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458920791, 'relevance': 22}

Morgan analysts wrote in a recent note, per the FT.
