La cantidad incluye una opción de sobreadjudicación en función de la demanda, agregó el informe.\n\nLa práctica de la tenencia cruzada de acciones, donde las compañías poseen acciones de otras, ha sido un método de larga data en Japón para fortalecer las relaciones comerciales.\n\nSin embargo, los expertos en gobernanza y los inversores internacionales argumentan que esto protege la gestión de la influencia de los accionistas, lo que plantea preocupaciones sobre las normas de gobernanza corporativa.\n\nEn diciembre, la Agencia de Servicios Financieros de Japón emitió una orden de mejora empresarial a las cuatro aseguradoras, Tokyo Marine Holdings, Sompo Holdings y dos unidades de MS&AD Insurance Group Holdings después de descubrir que habían coludido para fijar las tasas de seguros corporativos.\n\nEl regulador ordenó la reducción de la tenencia cruzada de acciones, instando a las aseguradoras a deshacerse de estos compromisos financieros.\n\nLas acciones de HMC cerraron con un alza del 0,22%, en los 32,56 dólares el martes.', 'source': {'uri': 'es.benzinga.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Benzinga España'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'shivani_kumaresan@es.benzinga.com', 'name': 'Shivani Kumaresan', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://cdn.benzinga.com/files/imagecache/story_image_685x375C/images/story/2024/07/17/Honda--Image-Via-Shutterstock.jpeg?crop=smart&height=164&width=300&optimize=medium&dpr=1&auto=webp', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920658, 'relevance': 12}
{'uri': '8230125203', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:57:01', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:57:01Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:56:34Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.8941176533699036, 'url': 'https://pantagraph.com/opinion/column/tyler-cowen-why-is-sweden-paying-grandparents-to-babysit-economist-says-its-worth-a-try/article_5bed3cb6-5829-5508-a5d4-268fd1391ece.html', 'title': "Tyler Cowen: Why is Sweden paying grandparents to babysit? Economist says it's worth a try", 'body': 'As Sweden attends its first NATO summit as a member, FRANCE 24\'s Nadia Massih spoke to Tobias Billström, Swedish Foreign Minister.\n\nAt first glance, the policy sounds absurd, especially to many Americans: In Sweden, grandparents are now eligible for government subsidies to babysit their grandchildren.\n\nAs a proud grandparent, I would be willing to pay to babysit my grandkids. (I don\'t have to, but I would.) It would feel wrong to accept government money for my services.\n\nAnd even in the Swedish context, the program seems excessive. The country has long had first-rate and well-subsidized child-care facilities, which is another reason not to pay grandparents anything, and Sweden already has high levels of government spending and taxation. Is this additional benefit -- and expenditure -- really what it needs?\n\nBut sometimes even apparently foolish ideas have such compelling rationales that you begin to rethink whether they\'re foolish at all. These are often the cases that require the hardest thinking.\n\nPeople are also reading... Felon held by armed resident in Macon County gets 2 years Thousands in Central Illinois without power after second night of summer storms Normal residence heavily damaged, cat perishes in structure fire Trump injured but \'fine\' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Jury deliberates fate of Bloomington man charged with murder of Decatur teen Normal backs enterprise zone taking in possible $200M Rivian expansion Bloomington man jailed on weapons, drug charges after traffic stop Revolution Dispensary to host grand opening Friday in Normal Dewon Griffin found guilty of murder in 2019 NYE shooting Hundreds evacuate \'imminent\' dam failure in Nashville, Ill. Highways flood and close. Trump picks Sen. JD Vance of Ohio, a once-fierce critic turned loyal ally, as his GOP running mate Authorities hunt for clues, but motive of man who tried to assassinate Donald Trump remains elusive Bloomington police investigating shots fired Wednesday night Flick Fact: How many State Farm employees are college educated? Flick Fact: Is there really a river under Normal?\n\nIf you look at Sweden\'s policy closely, it adheres pretty well to some basic economic principles: namely, the notion of "Pareto improvements," which benefit all parties involved.\n\nStart with the fact that Swedish parents currently receive extensive paid leave on the birth of a child, and so it can be said they are already paid to look after their children. Whether you agree with that policy, it is longstanding and well-established. Take it as a given.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nNow imagine that you are an ambitious Swedish doctor or lawyer, climbing the career ladder, and are self-aware enough to realize you do not always have entirely the right degree of natural patience necessary for parenting. In that case, you might prefer to go back to work following the birth of your child. Under the status quo, you could not work and draw your normal salary and still get the full child-care benefit, even though some child benefits are paid automatically.\n\nSo the system has some potential inefficiency. You may stay at home just to get the money, even when an alternate arrangement might be better for everyone.\n\nNow add grandparents to this equation. If the grandparents can be paid to take care of your child, all of a sudden the extended family as a whole doesn\'t lose the money by having the parent go back to work. Instead, that money is transferred to the grandparents, so the work disincentive is diminished.\n\nAnd economists will tell you that the parents and grandparents can do their own settling up. If the grandparents are well-to-do, for instance, and eager to spend time with their grandkids, they might funnel some of that money back to the parents or the child, either directly or indirectly. In some cases, on net, the grandparents may not end up getting paid anything at all.\n\nIn essence, you can think of this policy as a model designed to maximize gains from trade.\n\nOne side effect is that, to the extent the parent who returns to work is a high earner, government tax revenue will increase. That will help pay for the policy, partially if not entirely.\n\nThe logic for this policy may hold all the more for single parents. In that case, the costs of giving up work may be even higher. That\'s because on a single income, climbing the career ladder and investing in future earnings will be all the more important. Enlisting aid from grandparents may also be more necessary, given the higher burdens on a single caregiver. A defender of the policy would cite these accommodative benefits, whereas a critic might allege they encourage single parenthood too much.\n\nMore broadly, fiscal conservatives might point out that the policy still costs some money upfront, while social conservatives might argue that it commodifies family relationships. The policy\'s supporters, on the other hand, might note that it can help some people get back to work and also make the grandparents happier. The children might benefit, too.\n\nI am still unsure if this policy is a good idea, though it has stronger virtues and benefits than I first thought. But I am all the more certain of one final lesson: Framing is everything. The very same policy, described in different terms, can sound eminently reasonable or badly out of whack. Keep that in mind next time you are tempted to render a quick verdict on someone else\'s idea.\n\nCowen is a Bloomberg columnist, professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog.\n\n___\n\nLove 0 Funny 0 Wow 0 Sad 0 Angry 0\n\nCatch the latest in Opinion\n\nGet opinion pieces, letters and editorials sent directly to your inbox weekly!\n\nSign up! * I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy.', 'source': {'uri': 'pantagraph.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'pantagraph.com'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/pantagraph.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/5/be/5bed3cb6-5829-5508-a5d4-268fd1391ece/6697b3d016c72.preview.jpg?crop=1765%2C927%2C0%2C123&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': 'eng-9738640', 'sentiment': 0.05098039215686279, 'wgt': 458920621, 'relevance': 21}
{'uri': '8230122312', 'lang': 'ita', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:57:01', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:57:01Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:54:54Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://askanews.it/2024/07/17/come-la-transizione-digitale-sta-cambiando-il-mondo-del-lavoro/', 'title': 'Come la transizione digitale sta cambiando il mondo del lavoro', 'body': 'Roma, 17 lug. (askanews) - Questa mattina presso la Sala del Cenacolo - Complesso di Vicolo Valdina della Camera dei Deputati, si è svolto l\'incontro "Italia comunità digitale. I lavori del futuro". L\'appuntamento è stato organizzato dalla Consulta delle Fondazioni del Lazio, in collaborazione con Acri e Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale Impresa Sociale, per riflettere sull\'impatto che la transizione digitale sta avendo sul mondo del lavoro, di oggi e di domani. Sono intervenuti l\'on. Paolo Trancassini, Questore della Camera dei Deputati, Gabriella Sarracco, Presidente Consulta delle Fondazioni del Lazio, Giovanni Azzone, Presidente Acri, Maria Ida Germontani, già Senatrice della Repubblica; Daria Perrotta, Presidente del Comitato di Indirizzo strategico del Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale; Diego Ciulli, Head of Government Affairs and Public Policy Google Italy; Cristina Pozzi, co-Fondatrice e CEO Edulia; Luigi Capello, Ceo Zest; Giovanni Fosti, Presidente Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale Impresa Sociale; Shalini Kurapati, Ad Clearbox AI. La moderazione è stata curata da Giorgio Zanchini, giornalista Rai Radio 1. Per Giovanni Azzone, presidente di Acri "Oggi si chiude un viaggio che ha toccato diversi territori del nostro Paese. L\'abbiamo chiamato \'Italia comunità digitale\', perché siamo convinti che di fronte alla transizione digitale, la vera sfida sia riuscire a non aggravare le disuguaglianze esistenti, ma, al contrario, a creare nuove opportunità per tutti. Per i ragazzi che rischiano di abbandonare la scuola e per i Neet che non studiano e non lavorano per le organizzazioni del Terzo settore, per favorire la competitività territoriale e diffondere l\'utilizzo dell\'Intelligenza Artificiale. In questa partita, le Fondazioni di origine bancaria possono contribuire a fare in modo che le nuove competenze necessarie per entrare e rimanere competitivi nel mondo del lavoro siano veramente alla portata di tutti. Il Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale è un positivo caso di partenariato Pubblico-Privato sociale che va proprio in questa direzione". "Anche le Fondazioni di origine bancaria del Lazio partecipano all\'iniziativa nazionale Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale, promossa da Acri, perché la trasformazione digitale in atto già oggi sta impattando profondamente sul mondo del lavoro e in maniera estremamente rapida lo farà ancora nei prossimi anni. C\'è quindi un bisogno impellente di nuove competenze: tanto per chi deve ancora entrare nel mondo del lavoro, quanto per chi è già attivo e necessita di aggiornarsi. A questa nuova domanda di formazione non tutti saranno in grado di rispondere autonomamente. Come Fondazioni di origine bancaria abbiamo avvertito la responsabilità di dover aiutare chi rischia di rimanere escluso da questa trasformazione. Per questo aderiamo, insieme alle Fondazioni di tutta Italia, al Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale: che sta mettendo in campo un vasto programma di corsi gratuiti volti a offrire le competenze digitali indispensabili per il mondo del lavoro di oggi e di domani" dichiara Gabriella Sarracco, presidente della Consulta tra le Fondazioni del Lazio e della Fondazione Cariciv. Per Giovanni Fosti, Presidente del Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale Impresa sociale: ½Con l\'appuntamento di questa mattina a Roma dedicato ai lavori del futuro, si conclude il primo ciclo di eventi organizzati in collaborazione con il Fondo, nato da un partenariato tra Governo e Fondazioni di origine bancaria. Il Fondo vuole accrescere le competenze digitali di base e avanzate per non lasciare indietro nessuno e realizzare una società più giusta ed equa. Nei prossimi mesi e anni proseguiremo a pubblicare bandi, selezionare e sostenere progetti e creare contenuti di valore per tutti". Il Fondo per la Repubblica Digitale è una partnership tra pubblico e privato sociale (Governo e Associazione di Fondazioni e di Casse di risparmio - Acri), che si muove nell\'ambito degli obiettivi di digitalizzazione previsti dal PNRR (Piano Nazionale di Ripresa e Resilienza) e dall\'FNC (Fondo Nazionale Complementare). Il Fondo - in via sperimentale per gli anni 2022-2026 - stanzia un totale di 350 milioni di euro ed è alimentato da versamenti effettuati dalle Fondazioni di origine bancaria. Operativo dalla fine del 2022, il Fondo - tramite l\'impresa sociale costituita da Acri, che ne è il soggetto attuatore - ha lanciato i primi quattro bandi, attraverso i quali sono stati selezionati e sostenuti 76 percorsi di formazione gratuiti che forniscono le competenze digitali indispensabili, per favorire l\'accesso a nuove opportunità lavorative a NEET, donne, disoccupati e inoccupati, lavoratori a rischio disoccupazione causa automazione. Si tratta di un campione significativo per valutare puntualmente l\'impatto dei percorsi formativi finanziati - in termini di competenze acquisite e di posti di lavoro creati - affinché le Fondazioni possano "consegnarli" al Governo, quali pratiche efficaci per immaginare future politiche nazionali. Per maggiori informazioni fondorepubblicadigitale.it. La Consulta delle Fondazioni del Lazio riunisce:Fondazione Nazionale delle Comunicazioni, Fondazione Carivit, Fondazione Cassa di Risparmio di Civitavecchia e Fondazione Varrone Cassa di Risparmio di Rieti.', 'source': {'uri': 'askanews.it', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Askanews'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://askanews.it/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Come-la-transizione-digitale-sta-cambiando-il-mondo-del-lavoro.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920621, 'relevance': 39}

These partners are the backbone behind Ethos\' operating model, working hand-in-hand with companies throughout every stage of the investment process, leveraging their vast networks to add value wherever possible.\n\n"We are thrilled to welcome Caroline, Allie, Colin, and Nagui to our firm. Their combined experience in data, technology, media, operations, and vocational training will benefit our portfolio companies, leveraging their unique skillsets, networks and insights to foster long-term growth," commented Ethos Capital\'s Managing Partners and Co-Founders, Erik Brooks and Fadi Chehade. "In addition to their wealth of experience, this group is also aligned with our vision of responsible capitalism, which is rooted in a values-based approach that prioritizes sustained growth over short-term profits. This is central to the way all of our Executive Partners work alongside our companies to guide their future."\n\nCaroline Campbell serves as a Founding Principal at LEO DIX, a boutique technology and business management consulting firm. With an emphasis on the convergence of data and technology, market positioning, and leadership development, she has advised a variety of Fortune 500 companies and tech startups throughout her career. She previously served as the Head of Communications at AOL and has held strategic roles at Google and ING Investment Services.\n\nAllie Kline, also a Founding Principal of LEO DIX, is recognized for her expertise in organic and M&A-led business growth and transformation. She serves on the boards of Huntington Bank (NASDAQ: HBAN), BILL Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: BILL), and the National Forest Foundation in addition to Identity Digital (an Ethos Capital portfolio company). Prior to LEO DIX, Kline held c-suite operating and marketing leadership roles at AOL, Verizon, and high-profile startups in the data, marketing and technology sectors.\n\nColin Kessinger is an accomplished leader in analytics and supply chain management, having served as a Managing Director within Accenture\'s Applied Intelligence group. There he focused on the advanced applications of analytics in supply chain, pricing, and trade spend management, including the integration of End-to-End Analytics within Accenture, a 70-person business he founded in 2005 that was acquired in 2020, designed to help clients in industries such as CPG and retail deploy and scale AI solutions. Prior to Accenture and End-to-End Analytics, Colin also founded Vivecon, a company dedicated to delivering supply chain solutions using financial engineering concepts to optimize cost and performance.\n\nNagui Elyas is a specialist in education, training and development and a serial entrepreneur. A graduate of Alexandria University Faculty of Medicine, Nagui transitioned from practicing medicine in Egypt to higher education after relocating to the U.S., becoming COO of Nova Institute. Following his role at Nova, he co-founded Vocado, a cloud-based financial aid platform that optimizes funding for students and helps them manage aid more strategically, which was later acquired by Oracle. He went on to found Skilado, a reskilling training platform and currently serves as the CEO and chairman of Tekleen-Automatic Filters, an eco-based company building automatic water filtration systems.\n\nFor more information on Ethos\' Executive Partners, visit ethoscapital.com/team.\n\nAbout Ethos Capital\n\nEthos was established to make majority and control minority investments in middle-market information service companies, primarily across North America and Europe. The organization provides operational expertise to companies through a dedicated team of 21 Executive Partners. Ethos\' strategy is to add value by partnering with existing management teams to strategically enhance operations and accelerate growth.\n\nEthos is actively seeking new investment opportunities with companies that recognize the importance of stakeholder capitalism and would benefit from the deep operating experience and business networks of our Executive Partners. Bank Indonesia (BI) memutuskan menahan suku bunga acuan atau BI rate di level 6,25% dalam Rapat Dewan Gubernur (RDG) BI bulan Juli 2024.\n\nGubernur BI, Perry Warjiyo, mengungkapkan, keputusan mempertahankan BI rate 6,25% ini sejalan dengan fokus kebijakan moneter yang pro stabilitas.\n\n"Sebagai langkah pre-emptive dan forward looking untuk memastikan inflasi tetap terkendali dalam sasaran," tutur Perry dalam konferensi pers, Rabu (17/7).\n\nBaca Juga: Suku Bunga The Fed Turun Lebih Cepat, Gubernur BI Optimistis Rupiah Makin Menguat\n\nAdapun saat ini, BI mematok inflasi tahun 2024 dan 2025 berada di kisaran 2,5% plus minus 1%. Kebijakan ini juga didukung dengan penguatan operasi moneter untuk memperkuat efektifitas stabilisasi nilai tukar rupiah dan masuknya aliran modal asing.\n\nPerry juga memastikan kebijakan makroprudensial dan sistem pembayaran tetap pro-growth untuk mendukung pertumbuhan ekonomi yang berkelanjutan. Kebijakan makroprudensial longgar terus ditempuh untuk mendorong kredit/pembiayaan perbankan kepada dunia usaha dan rumah tangga.\n\nKebijakan sistem pembayaran diarahkan untuk tetap memperkuat keandalan infrastruktur dan struktur industri sistem pembayaran, serta memperluas akseptasi digitalisasi sistem pembayaran.\n\nBaca Juga: Gubernur BI Perkirakan Pertumbuhan Ekonomi Global 2024 Sentuh 3,2%\n\nLebih lanjut, selain menahan suku bunga acuan BI rate, bank sentral juga menahan suku bunga deposit facility di level 5,5% dan suku bunga lending facility di level 7%.\n\nUntuk diketahui, pada RDG April lalu, BI telah menaikkan BI rate sebesar 25 basis poin (bps) dari 6,00% menjadi 6,25%. Kemudian pada bulan Mei hingga Juli 2024, BI rate masih tetap dipertahankan pada level 6,25%.\n\nSelanjutnya: Harga Minyak Bergerak Tipis karena Pelemahan Ekonomi China\n\nMenarik Dibaca: HP Jatuh ke Air? (Image: LOCALiQ)\n\nWith the frequent updates, 68% of businesses felt their SEO strategy wasn\'t completely effective, and 38% said they needed more training in SEO - beating the likes of education in social media, content, and email marketing.\n\nIn addition, 75% of businesses struggled to maintain innovative marketing tactics, strategies, and technologies. Marketers reported difficulties in accessing, organising, and utilising customer data, as well as in understanding and defining their target audience.\n\nAs the world of digital marketing rapidly evolves, LOCALiQ believes that this year\'s report will help local businesses benchmark against others and consider their current and future plans.\n\nNikki Broxup, LOCALiQ\'s Marketing Director said, "We are excited to launch this year\'s State of Digital Marketing Survey.\n\n"Since our last survey, the digital marketing landscape has shifted significantly, with artificial intelligence gaining even more momentum and reshaping the way businesses approach their marketing strategies.\n\n"We encourage business owners and marketers to take part in this year\'s survey. {'uri': '8230123279', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:56:08', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:56:08Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:55:32Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.4705882370471954, 'url': 'https://en.globes.co.il/en/article-the-big-wiz-winners-and-the-taxes-theyll-pay-1001484663', 'title': "The big Wiz winners, and the taxes they'll pay", 'body': 'Why it\'s worthwhile for the company\'s founders to hold less than 10%, and other questions.\n\nAlphabet, the parent company of search giant Google, is reportedly on the final straight towards buying Israeli cloud security company Wiz for $23 billion. Data published in the US shed light on the main winners from the deal, most of whom are overseas residents who will be exempt from paying full tax in Israel. So who will pay what?\n\nWhy will Wiz pay less tax than normal?\n\nWiz was registered from the outset, in 2020, as a US company, with the New York head office as the parent company that holds the development center in Tel Aviv as a subsidiary. Unlike many Israeli companies, the company decided to keep all of its intellectual property in the US, under the US company Wiz Inc. Even if Google, or any other US company, buys it, Wiz will save having to pay tax on transferring intellectual property out of Israel, amounting to 23% of its estimated value.\n\nIn another large acquisition by Google in Israel, that of navigation app company Waze a decade ago, the tax paid on the transfer of intellectual property out of Israel amounted to NIS 800 million, much more than the capital gains tax paid by the Israeli shareholders, which came to NIS 400 million.\n\nWhy was it worthwhile for the founders not to hold more than 10%?\n\nAccording to a report on US website "The Information", the four Israeli founders of Wiz - CEO Assaf Rappaport, Yinon Costica, Ami Luttwak and Roy Reznik - hold 9.5% of the shares in the company each, their holdings having been diluted below 10% in the past year. The value of their holdings, on the basis of a $23 billion acquisition price, is thus $2.2 billion each. It may be, however, that preference shares held by the large venture capital funds will dilute their holdings in the calculation of the exit, which could leave each of them with about 5% "only".\n\nAssuming that they keep their stakes at the higher level, they will pay capital gains tax at 25%, plus a surtax of 3% imposed on income of more than NIS 722,000. The tax rate could however be higher, at 33%, in the light of the fact that their holdings were diluted from 10% to 9.5% in the past year. Adv. and CPA Racheli Guz-Lavi , a tax specialist at Amit Pollak Matalon & Co., explains that owners of 10% or more of the shares in a company, or shareholders with the right to appoint directors, pay a higher rate of capital gains tax, of 33%. The higher rate also applies if the shareholding was at the relevant level in the last tax year.\n\nAccording to the latest reports, who are the big winners from the sale?\n\nFour foreign venture capital firms - Index Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Insight Partners, and Greenoak Capital - and one Israeli firm - Cyberstarts - will share $7 billion. According to "The Information", the largest shareholder is US-British VC firm Index Ventures, with an 11% stake, worth $2.53 billion at the reported acquisition price. Most of the money received by the foreign venture capital funds will be exempt from tax in Israel, as the limited partners in these funds are almost all overseas residents. All the managing partners in the funds, however, both Israeli and foreign, are liable to tax in Israel, at varying rates\n\nThe Index Ventures partner who manages the investment in Wiz is Shardul Shah, who knows Israeli companies well. He is also a director of Dazz, another Israeli cybersecurity company, which has several shareholders in common with Wiz, and of content platform Outbrain.\n\nOther large shareholders are: Sequoia Capital, which has a 10% stake, worth $2.3 billion at the reported deal price, and which is represented on the Wiz board by veteran partner Doug Leone; and Insight Partners, which used to be the most active investor in Israeli high-tech, with a 9% stake worth $2.07 billion, and which is represented on the Wiz board by its founder, Jeff Horing. Since only 42% of the shares in Wiz are held by Israelis, most of the profit on the sale of the company will go to overseas players, and will be subject to reduced rates of tax.\n\nThe partners in Insight Partners will also pay reduced rates of tax, since it\'s a foreign firm with most of its activity in the US. Horing, who brought Insight Partners to Israel with an initial investment in website building platform Wix two decades ago, could pay tax of 15% in Israel, if the company being sold is viewed as a company connected to Israel, that is, a company with most of its assets, directly or indirectly, located in Israel.\n\nHow much tax will be paid by the Israeli partners in the overseas funds?\n\nPartners such as Liad Agmon in Insight Partners and Israeli partners in Lightspeed Venture Partners are unconnected to Wiz, but could benefit from participation in the funds\' success fees. Even if they don\'t sit on the company\'s board of directors, their status a partners entitles them in principle to benefit from the fund\'s earnings on the sale of the company. "Although these are foreign venture capital funds, the Israeli managing partners, who could share in 20% of the gain on the sale of the company, are liable to tax of 28% to 50%, depending on the mix of foreign investors in the fund. The larger the proportion of foreign investors, the lower the rate of tax," says Guz-Lavi.\n\nHow much will investors such as Shlomo Kramer and Nir Zuk make?\n\nAccording to the report in the US, Cyberstarts, an Israeli venture capital firm founded by Israeli Gili Raanan that has as its original investors senior people from the cybersecurity industry such as Rakesh Loonkar, Mickey Boodaei, Shlomo Kramer, Armis Security founders Yevgeny Dibrov and Nadir Izrael, and Wiz CEO Assaf Rappaport himself, holds shares in Wiz worth $920 million, after investing just $30 million.\n\nThis apparently means a dream exit of tens of millions of dollars for each of the limited partners, who will receive back their investment in the fund, plus 80% of the gain on the sale. Raanan, the general partner in the fund with two other partners, will benefit from double-digit success fees and will pay a tax rate of over 28%, since most of the investors in the fund are Israelis.', 'source': {'uri': 'en.globes.co.il', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Globes'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://res.cloudinary.com/globes/image/upload/t_800X392/v1711535156/direct/Wiz_Founders._Credit_-_Avishag_Shaar-Yashuv_opytj1.jpg', 'eventUri': 'eng-9732191', 'sentiment': 0.3490196078431373, 'wgt': 458920568, 'relevance': 57}
{'uri': '8230123523', 'lang': 'deu', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:56:08', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:56:08Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:55:39Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.7058823704719543, 'url': 'https://www.giga.de/news/amazon-liefert-den-beweis-selbst-microsoft-ist-die-xbox-jetzt-egal/', 'title': 'Amazon liefert den Beweis: Selbst Microsoft ist die Xbox jetzt egal', 'body': 'Ein US-amerikanisches Game-Pass-Ultimate-Bundle wird auf Amazon wie verrückt gekauft, und das aus einem guten Grund: Das Bundle kostet umgerechnet weniger als 80 Euro und bietet euch fast alle Game-Pass-Ultimate-Spiele - aber ohne einen PC oder eine Xbox kaufen zu müssen.\n\nAuf der US-amerikanischen Amazon-Seite gibt es gerade ein starkes Angebot: Für nur 80 US-Dollar könnt ihr hier ein Bundle bekommen, das eine Xbox Series X Konsole nahezu ersetzt - und auch einen PC braucht ihr hierfür nicht. Enthalten im Bundle sind:\n\nDas Bundle könnt ihr euch nicht nach Deutschland bestellen, aber ihr könnt es euch auf der englischen Amazon-Seite ansehen. Höchstwahrscheinlich jedoch ist es nur eine Frage der Zeit, bis das Bundle es auch nach Deutschland schafft.\n\nWann genau das Bundle in Deutschland erscheinen wird, ist noch nicht klar. Fakt ist aber, dass ihr euch die einzelnen Artikel natürlich trotzdem schon kaufen könnt - es ist dann nur etwas teurer. Wir zeigen euch im deutschen Amazon-Shop, was ihr braucht:\n\nUnd violá - mit diesen drei Käufen könnt ihr den Cloud-Service von Game Pass Ultimate ganz ohne Xbox-Konsole oder PC genießen. Natürlich aber braucht ihr einen internetfähigen Fernseher, eine sehr gute Internetverbindung und den Willen, ein Game Pass Ultimate-Abonnement abzuschließen.\n\nDa ihr über den Amazon Fire Stick nun den Game Pass abonnieren könnt, braucht ihr weder einen PC noch eine Xbox für das Abonnement. Wer sich also eine Xbox-Konsole für das Spiele-Abo geholt hat, für den ist die Konsole jetzt fast obsolet geworden. Kurz gesagt: Mit einer guten Internetverbindung und einem Abo könnt ihr jetzt - ob mit oder ohne das Bundle - faste alle Spiele spielen, die im Game Pass Ultimate enthalten sind. Nur einige wenige - wie etwa Diablo 4 - sind momentan nicht bei Xbox Cloud Gaming dabei.\n\nEs ist dennoch ein großes Ding, denn der Game Pass Ultimate enthält nicht nur alle Xbox-exklusiven Spiele, sondern noch viele weitere große und moderne Blockbuster, beliebte Indie-Games und schließlich All-Time-Klassiker wie The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim. Mit Game Pass Ultimate bekommt ihr außerdem alle Xbox-exklusiven Spiele direkt zum Release-Tag. Dazu wird wohl auch Call of Duty Black Ops 6 bald gehören. Falls es für Xbox Cloud Gaming freigeschaltet wird.\n\nEs gibt jedoch einen Haken: Microsofts Cloud-Streaming-Service - über den ihr mit dem Fire Stick spielen würdet - ist nicht perfekt. Selbst mit einer tollen Internetverbindung könnte die Spieleerfahrung über Streaming variieren.', 'source': {'uri': 'giga.de', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'GIGA'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://crops.giga.de/b6/6d/4f/a1a10d901749ef4dd8409a38ed_YyAxODA0eDkwMis1OCs4OQJyZSAxMDI0IDUxMgNiZGExOTdlZDRhZQ==.jpg', 'eventUri': 'deu-1815991', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920568, 'relevance': 9}

{'uri': '8230121921', 'lang': 'ind', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:55:12', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:55:12Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:54:40Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://surabaya.tribunnews.com/2024/07/17/8-motor-di-rumah-dpo-ungkap-sindikat-spesialis-parkiran-polres-bangkalan-tangkap-3-pelaku-curanmor', 'title': '8 Motor di Rumah DPO Ungkap Sindikat Spesialis Parkiran, Polres Bangkalan Tangkap 3 Pelaku Curanmor - Surya.co.id', 'body': 'SURYA.CO.ID, BANGKALAN - Personel gabungan Unit Reskrim Polsek Kamal dan Opsnal Satreskrim Polres Bangkalan melakukan penggerebekan di rumah pelaku pencurian sepeda motor berinisial YS, Desa Pamorah, Kecamatan Tragah pada Selasa (17/7/2024) malam.\n\nSebanyak 8 unit sepeda motor serta 3 orang diamankan dari rumah YS yang sebelumnya ditetapkan sebagai DPO.\n\nTiga orang tersebut berinisial GHS (21), warga Wonokusumo, Pegirikan Surabaya; MS (24), warga Desa Pamorah, Kecamatan Tragah; dan IM (28), warga Bulak Banteng, Kenjeran Surabaya.\n\nMereka ditangkap untuk menyusul tersangka FF (20), perempuan asal Bulak Banteng Surabaya yang terlebih dulu ditangkap Unit Reskrim Polsek Kamal pada 12 Juli 2024 lalu.\n\nPenggerebekan tersebut merupakan pengembangan penyidikan atas perkara pencurian motor dengan tersangka FF yang dilakukan bersama DPO YS. Keduanya mencuri motor Honda Vario putih-biru bernopol M 5 5668 GK di parkiran Balai/Desa Kamal dan terekam CCTV motor di parkiran Balai Desa/Kecamatan Kamal pada 11 Juli 2024 siang.\n\n"Aksi keduanya terekam CCTV sehingga tim polres melakukan penyelidikan dan dilakukan penangkapan terhadap FF. Ia mengaku dilakukan bersama YS sebagai tersangka utama, tersangka perempuan ini berperan mengawasi, menunggu di atas motor," ungkap Kapolres Bangkalan, AKBP Febri Isman Jaya, Rabu (17/7/2024).\n\nSaat penggerebekan dengan barang bukti 8 unit sepeda motor, YS melarikan diri dan hingga saat ini dalam pengejaran oleh pihak kepolisian.\n\nDari total 8 unit motor, tiga motor di antaranya sudah protolan bahkan dua menyisakan rangka. Terdeteksi pula nomor rangka berbeda dengan nomor mesin.\n\nFebri membeberkan, ketiga tersangka berikut tersangka FF merupakan satu sindikat pencurian sepeda motor spesialis area parkir. Bahkan tersangka GHS mengaku bahwa telah melakukan pencurian sepeda motor di 5 TKP berbeda.\n\nSeperti pencurian motor Vario L 5018 ABF yang dilakukan bersama YS di Jalan Pemuda Kaffa pada 12 Juli 2024. Tersangka GHS juga mencuri motor Ninja RR bernopol M 4510 II dari teras sebuah rumah di Kelurahan Tunjung, Kecamatan Burneh pada 14 Mei 2024.\n\nSelanjutnya, GHS bersama YS melakukan pencurian Scoopy di parkiran Kantor Pegadaian Cabang Bangkalan, Jalan Ki Lemah Duwur pada Juli 2024. Di bulan yang sama, keduanya kembali beraksi mencuri Beat dari parkiran SDN 1 Keleyan, Kecamatan Socah.\n\nBersama DPO YS pula, GHS mengaku telah mencuri Beat warna hitam di parkiran Klinik An Namirah di Kecamatan Tanah Merah pada Mei 2024, termasuk di tempat fitness dekat Polsek Burneh.\n\n"Pemilik rumah (YS) masih DPO, melarikan diri saat kami lakukan penggerebekan. Sementara empat pelaku termasuk FF memiliki peran berbeda. Ada yang tukang preteli. Mereka dapat bagian mulai dari Rp 1 juta, Rp 1,5 juta, hingga Rp 2 juta," beber Febri.\n\nIa menambahkan, penggerebekan itu berawal dari laporan masyarakat bahwa di Kecamatan Tragah ada suatu rumah yang dicurigai karena aktivitasnya sangat mencurigakan.\n\n"Dengan cepat teman-teman Opsnal Satreskrim Polres Bangkalan dan Unit Reskrim Polsek Kamal melakukan penyelidikan dan menggeledah rumah DPO. Ternyata di dalam ditemukan beberapa unit sepeda motor yang diduga hasil dari curanmor," pungkas Febri.\n\nDi hadapan Febri, FF yang kesehariannya berada di Surabaya mengaku terpaksa ikut melakukan pencurian karena desakan ekonomi. Bersama DPO YS, tersangka FF terekam CCTV mengendarai sepeda motor PCX warna putih menuju parkiran Balai Desa/Kecamatan Kamal\n\n"Istri YS yang nge-WA dulu, sini main-main ke rumah. Tidak tahunya, suaminya ngajak nyolong itu tadi, karena waktu itu saya terpaksa. Saat berangkat, YS nyetir PCX, saat pulang saya yang bawa PCX," terang FF. *****', 'source': {'uri': 'surabaya.tribunnews.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Surya'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://asset-2.tstatic.net/surabaya/foto/bank/images/gerebek-rumah-curanmor-Bangkalan.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920512, 'relevance': 31}
{'uri': '2024-07-424886239', 'lang': 'zho', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:53:57', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:53:57Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T11:47:58Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.6901960968971252, 'url': 'https://m.163.com/dy/article/J7ASMUF905198NMR.html', 'title': '锁定中国新能源科技，沙特6万亿主权财富基金访华连签合资大单！_手机网易网', 'body': '近日，沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金 -- -- 沙特公共投资基金（PIF）代表团访华，密集会见高层领导，并与中国企业达成系列合作，引发一波"沙特热"。\n\n在金融领域，PIF与中国银行、建设银行等金融机构签署战略合作协议和合作备忘录，进一步深化双方在重点项目建设、能源合作、债券发行、投资托管等领域的战略合作。特别值得关注的是在新能源领域，PIF在7月16日一天之内，就与远景科技集团、晶科能源和TCL中环等新能源头部企业签署了在沙特成立合资企业的战略协议，推动中东清洁能源转型。\n\nPIF与远景科技集团（下称"远景"）、沙特能源设备公司Vision Industries共同宣布将在沙特成立风电装备合资公司，远景将是合资企业的最大股东，PIF是第二大股东，Vision Industries持有剩余股权。该合资公司将帮助沙特风电价值链到2030年实现75%本地化生产的目标。\n\nPIF与晶科能源组建的合资企业将在沙特建设并运营高效光伏电池及组件项目，预计总投资额近10亿美元，正式投产后预计年产能将分别达到10GW，或将成为中国光伏电池和组件行业海外最大的制造基地，也是迄今为止晶科能源最大的海外投资项目。\n\nPIF与TCL中环成立的合资公司，将推进太阳能光伏晶体晶片在沙特的本土化生产，项目总投资金额约为20.8亿美元。\n\nPIF是沙特的主权财富基金，是全球第五大主权财富基金，目前管理资产规模高达9250亿美元（约67230亿元人民币），并在2023年实现250亿美元投资盈利。PIF同时也是沙特最大的电力投资运营商ACWA的控股股东，承担着助力沙特可再生能源转型、实现沙特"2030愿景"的使命，致力于发展风电、光伏、氢能、储能等可再生能源。\n\n掌管超过9000亿美元的PIF可以说"财大气粗"，这一次PIF在风电、光伏领域精心选择了能够代表全球最高技术水平的三家中国企业，来分别组建合资公司，意味着PIF不再走"买买买"的扫货逻辑，而是通过"招商引资"的模式将其引入沙特，很明显看重的是领先全球的中国新能源科技。\n\n这种以市场和资本换技术的发展模式，是引进先进技术促进本国产业升级的有效路径，其效果已在中国四十多年的改革开放中得以验证。PIF此次牵手远景等中国新能源巨头组建合资公司，某种程度上也是期望复制中国新能源、高科技行业发展的成功经验。\n\n中沙投资合作"双向奔赴"\n\n此次PIF与中国新能源企业的密集合作，是中沙两国近年来在投资领域"双向奔赴"的最新写照。\n\n2016年，沙特阿拉伯王国正式发布沙特"2030愿景"，该计划旨在通过经济和社会改革，推动国家实现多元化转型，减少对石油的依赖，促进可持续发展，并改善人民的生活质量。\n\n2022年，中沙签署了《中华人民共和国政府和沙特阿拉伯王国政府关于共建"一带一路"倡议与"2030愿景"对接实施方案》，进一步推动双方在多个领域的合作。此后两国在"2030愿景"框架下的合作不断深化，特别是在能源、基础设施建设、旅游和人文交流等领域。\n\n作为沙特的主权财富基金，PIF是实现"2030愿景"的重要推动者之一。公开资料显示，PIF的投资标的包括沙特阿美公司、沙特电力公司、利雅得地铁等关乎沙特长期经济发展的战略项目，也包括股票、债券等金融资产，持仓包含苹果、微软和亚马逊等公司。此外，PIF还是软银愿景基金和黑石集团的LP。PIF最大的一笔投资是向软银愿景基金注资450亿美元，使其成为该基金最大的有限合伙人。\n\n沙特对华经济合作事务负责人、沙特公共投资基金总裁、沙特国家石油公司（沙特阿美）董事长鲁梅延（Yasir Al-Rumayyan）在今年7月的访华之行中，已分别获得中共中央政治局委员、国务院副总理何立峰，中共中央对外联络部部长刘建超，商务部部长王文涛，上海市委书记陈吉宁，北京市市长殷勇，中国证监会主席吴清等人的会见。\n\n何立峰在会见中表示，中沙双方要共同落实好两国领导人重要共识，加强发展战略对接，深化能源、贸易、投资、金融等领域合作，拓展清洁能源、高技术等新兴领域合作，推动中沙全面战略伙伴关系实现更大发展。\n\n鲁梅延还与多家中国金融及新能源领域关键机构的负责人举行会谈，包括中国投资有限责任公司董事长彭纯、远景科技集团董事长张雷、中国银行董事长葛海蛟、中国建设银行行长张毅、上海证券交易所理事长邱勇、TCL中环董事长李东生、晶科能源董事长李仙德等。\n\n据数据平台全球主权财富基金（Global SWF）发布的报告，尽管全球大多数主权财富基金在2023年减少了支出，但PIF的交易活动却是高歌猛进，总额从2022年的207亿美元增加至2023年的316亿美元，一举超越了新加坡政府投资公司，成为全球最活跃的主权财富基金。\n\n而PIF中东和北非证券投资主管Abdulmajeed Alhagbani近期在一次公开采访中表示，该机构目前在中国的投资额已达220亿美元，约合1600亿元人民币，聚焦可持续发展、科技、汽车、卫生保健等领域。\n\n从具体投资项目上看，PIF已在中国布局科技、能源、商业等多个行业。重点的投资项目包括以246亿元人民币完成对荣盛石化10%股权的收购，与东方盛虹签署合作框架协议、推动收购全资子公司江苏盛虹石化集团有限公司10%的战略股权等。今年5月29日，联想集团宣布与PIF旗下公司Alat埃耐特达成战略合作，Alat埃耐特提议向联想集团提供20亿美元无息可换股债券投资。\n\n在沙特资金加速流向中国的同时，一批中国制造业标杆企业，也开始联手当地战略合作伙伴加速对沙特的投资布局。2023年5月，沙特阿美、宝山钢铁和PIF签署股东协议，计划在沙特共同建设一家全流程厚板工厂。\n\n在中沙全面战略伙伴关系持续发展的背景下，以远景为代表的中国新能源企业，与沙特主权基金及企业的合作正当其时。远景科技集团董事长张雷表示，"中国\'一带一路\'倡议与沙特\'2030愿景\'的双向奔赴将为全球零碳转型提供新的动力。远景作为新型能源系统的领导者，通过产业链的本地化建设，将有效推动沙特新工业体系发展。"\n\n以风电领域唯一的代表企业远景科技集团为例，远景科技集团是中国绿色能源科技巨头之一，其风力发电机业务已占据全球领先地位，连续两年中标量全球第一，海外风机订单占中国风机企业订单的70%。因引领全球绿色能源转型的重大贡献，远景获得《时代》（TIME）2024年"全球100家最具影响力企业"，并被冠以"绿巨人"的称谓。\n\n沙特要加强风电价值链的本土化生产，与具备技术领先优势的远景联手，可以说是最佳选择。在全球风电行业里，远景毫无疑问是掌控整个价值链的"链主"之一。根据协议，远景、PIF、Vision Industries三方组建的合资公司将进行风力发电机及关键零部件的本地化生产制造。\n\n此次PIF与远景成立风电装备合资公司，能够很自然地将智能风力发电机、叶片等一系列产品的产业链上下游企业引入沙特，既有利于风电产品的本地化生产推动当地产业结构升级，又能带动就业与税收。\n\n而在智能风机业务领域，远景无疑为"王者"。远景风机产品在全球累计装机容量已超过60GW。据国际能源咨询公司伍德麦肯兹（Wood Mackenzie）统计，远景风机连续两年中标量全球第一；据彭博新能源财经（BNEF）统计，远景风机2023全球新增吊装量为15.4GW，排名全球第二。远景风机目前已在印度、沙特、中亚等多个市场拥有全球领先的市占率。\n\n作为全球领先的新型能源系统企业，远景科技集团旗下包括远景能源、远景动力、远景智能等核心业务板块。而PIF之所以在全球范围内选择远景作为合作伙伴，不仅仅因为其强大的风机业务，更是因为远景能为全球绿色转型提供领先的风电、储能、绿氢、动力电池和智能物联网等产品和技术，其创造的新型电力系统和零碳产业园正在成为推动全球脱碳的重要力量。\n\n远景基于自身深耕新能源装备技术和数字化智能技术的成熟经验，还创造了零碳产业园模式，并在零碳产业园的场景中构建并实践新型电力系统，这对致力于加速新能源转型的沙特而言也有很强的借鉴价值。\n\n在数字化智能技术的赋能下，风电、光伏发电侧可实现秒级响应负荷变化，储能侧可根据需求进行实时响应，在风光发电大于实际用电时将绿电进行储存，当风光储出力不足时，通过绿电交易获取绿色电力，由此实现风光储协同的80%绿色能源直供，确保100%绿色能源使用。此外，发展绿电制氢，不仅为绿电提供了稳定、大规模负荷侧的应用场景，还可实现长时储能。\n\n新型电力系统不仅是保障能源体系清洁、稳定、安全的核心，更是为产业的低碳转型和深度调整打下坚实的基础。\n\n落子沙特，远景加速出海\n\n远景本身就具备全球化基因，自2014年就进行了长期战略规划，进军印度、东南亚、沙特、中东等市场，目前在全球各地拥有20多个研发与运营中心，50多个制造中心，国际化人才占比超过50%。此次与PIF达成战略合作合资布局沙特新能源产业，将令其全球市场布局更加完善。\n\n在远景的全球布局中，中东市场一直是重要一环，远景此前已深度参与全球最大绿氢项目 -- -- 沙特NEOM（新未来城）绿氢项目，为该项目供应1.67GW、257台风电机组。项目建成后，将通过专用输电网络直接为绿氢工厂实现供电。作为这一大型项目建设和开发的里程碑，第一套风力发电机组于2023年10月8日成功完成交付给NEOM绿色氢能公司（NGHC）。\n\nNEOM绿氢项目上的合作，也为远景此次与PIF合资埋下伏笔。NGHC是沙特最大的电力投资运营商ACWA Power、空气产品公司（Air Products）和沙特政府的NEOM未来城市项目三方组建的合资企业。而PIF，就是ACWA的控股股东。\n\n在印度风电市场上，远景已累计获得7.4GW风机订单，成为最大的风电供应商。远景在印业务涉及6个邦、30个项目、20个独立电站，并在马哈拉施特拉邦（Maharashtra）第二大城市浦那(Pune)建设了年产3GW的机舱制造厂，在泰米尔纳德邦（Tamil Nadu）蒂鲁奇市（Tirchy）建成年产量2.5GW的叶片制造厂。\n\n在中亚风电市场上，远景风机在哈萨克斯坦和乌兹别克斯坦的市场占有率分别达到70%和68%。2023年，远景在乌兹别克斯坦斩获1GW规模的中亚最大风电项目Bash & Dzhankeldy机组供货订单。项目投产后，将为当地每年减少碳排放约160万吨。而乌兹别克斯坦致力于到2030年将可再生能源发电比例提升到30%，未来市场潜力巨大。\n\n远景储能具备全栈的技术能力和全球化的布局。目前，远景储能已在全球参与超过200个项目，累计交付超过15GWh，在手订单超25GWh。\n\n在新加坡，远景储能为东南亚最大的储能系统（BESS）提供100MW/138MWh远景智慧液冷储能系统。通过毫秒级的存储和传输，该系统不仅能大幅提升太阳能利用率，为电网储备更多能量，还能主动管理电力供需平衡，提高新加坡电网的稳定性和弹性，为新加坡的清洁能源转型发挥重要作用。\n\n在英国，远景与英国领先的电池储能开发商和运营商HEIT达成战略合作，为其在英国的两个电站提供电池储能系统(BESS)，储能容量分别为30MW/60MWh和49.9MW/99.8MWh。远景智慧液冷储能系统将为当地电网提供能量时移、容量服务以及调频服务。\n\n从风电到储能、绿氢、动力电池和智能物联网，远景的全产品线都能在沙特这个高增长的新能源市场上找到机会。而中国的绿色科技也将给沙特，给世界带来不可估量的绿色效应。将商业与可持续结合，这不也正是中国企业走向全球的新一轮动力？\n\n*以上内容不构成投资建议，不代表刊登平台之观点。用户应考虑本文中的任何意见、观点或结论是否符合其特定投资目标、财务状况或需要。市场有风险，投资需谨慎，请独立判断和决策。', {'uri': '8230119237', 'lang': 'fra', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:53:39', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:53:39Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:52:42Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.8274509906768799, 'url': 'https://lecourrier.vn/tiktok-perd-son-recours-contre-les-nouvelles-regles-de-concurrence-de-lue/1265564.html', 'title': "TikTok perd son recours contre les nouvelles règles de concurrence de l'UE", 'body': '>> Les législateurs britanniques demandent au gouvernement de couvrir les jeunes utilisateurs de TikTok\n\n>> Le spectre de l\'interdiction de TikTok aux États-Unis hante créateurs et PME\n\nLe réseau social, propriété du groupe chinois ByteDance, a été désigné en septembre par la Commission européenne comme l\'une des plateformes soumises à cette nouvelle législation qui vise à endiguer les abus de position dominante des géants de la tech.\n\nByteDance avait saisi le Tribunal de l\'UE en novembre pour faire annuler cette décision.\n\nLa juridiction, basée à Luxembourg, "rejette le recours de Bytedance", a-t-elle annoncé dans son premier arrêt portant sur le champ d\'application du DMA.\n\n"Nous sommes déçus par cette décision. TikTok est un +challenger+ qui concurrence fortement les acteurs en place", a réagi un porte-parole du groupe. ByteDance avertit que le DMA risque finalement de protéger les monopoles qu\'il entend contester.\n\n"Nous allons maintenant évaluer les prochaines étapes", a ajouté le porte-parole, en rappelant que la plateforme de partage de vidéos avait "déjà pris des mesures pour se conformer aux obligations" introduites depuis mars par le nouveau règlement.\n\nTikTok a encore la possibilité de former un pourvoi, dans un délai de deux mois et dix jours, contre la décision de première instance rendue mercredi 17 juillet.\n\nLe Bureau européen des unions de consommateurs (BEUC) a lui salué "une bonne nouvelle" par la voix de sa conseillère Vanessa Turner.\n\n"L\'arrêt confirme que ByteDance doit respecter les règles du DMA et notamment obtenir le consentement de millions d\'utilisateurs de TikTok avant que leurs données personnelles puissent être utilisées pour du ciblage publicitaire", a-t-elle commenté.\n\nLe règlement sur les marchés numériques, particulièrement contraignant, s\'applique aussi à cinq mastodontes américains - Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft - et, depuis mai, à la plateforme néerlandaise de réservation d\'hôtels Booking.\n\nRecours de Meta et Apple\n\nMeta (Facebook, Instagram) et Apple ont également déposé des recours pour que certains de leurs services échappent à la nouvelle législation.\n\nLa justice de l\'UE doit encore se prononcer à leur sujet.\n\nLe nouveau règlement concerne des groupes actifs dans au moins trois pays européens, dépassant 75 milliards d\'euros de capitalisation boursière ou 7,5 milliards de ventes en Europe, et enregistrant au moins 45 millions d\'utilisateurs finaux actifs et 10.000 entreprises utilisatrices en Europe.\n\nIls sont dénommés "contrôleurs d\'accès", dans le jargon bruxellois, car jugés incontournables pour leurs utilisateurs.\n\nLe DMA leur impose depuis mars un carcan d\'obligations et d\'interdictions spécifiques, supervisées par la Commission qui entend ouvrir davantage les marchés numériques à la concurrence grâce à des pouvoirs renforcés.\n\nLes entreprises en infraction s\'exposent à des amendes pouvant atteindre 10% de leur chiffre d\'affaires mondial, ou 20% en cas de récidive, voire à des mesures de démantèlement dans les cas les plus graves.\n\nLe Tribunal de l\'UE a constaté mercredi que "la Commission européenne pouvait considérer à juste titre que Bytedance était un contrôleur d\'accès". Il a relevé "qu\'il n\'était pas contesté que Bytedance atteignait les seuils quantitatifs prévus dans le DMA".\n\nDe son côté, la Commission a dit "prendre note" de ce jugement qui la conforte. "Nous continuerons à travailler avec ByteDance, comme avec tous les autres contrôleurs d\'accès, pour assurer le plein respect de la législation sur les marchés numériques", a déclaré un porte-parole.\n\nEn vertu du DMA, qui lui permet d\'agir plus vite et plus fort, l\'exécutif européen a déjà mis en cause Apple et Meta, ouvrant la voie à de lourdes sanctions à leur encontre s\'ils ne modifient pas leurs pratiques.\n\nLa Commission a jugé non conforme le 1 juillet le système d\'abonnement payant mis en place par Facebook et Instagram pour échapper à l\'obligation d\'obtenir le consentement des utilisateurs avant d\'exploiter leurs données pour du profilage publicitaire.\n\nLe 24 juin, Bruxelles avait épinglé Apple pour sa boutique d\'applications App Store accusée d\'empêcher les consommateurs d\'être dirigés vers des canaux de distribution alternatifs plus avantageux.', 'source': {'uri': 'lecourrier.vn', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'lecourrier.vn'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://image.lecourrier.vn/MediaUpload/Medium/2024/07/17/172534-vna_potal_tiktok_tich_hop_tinh_nang_moi_6848933.jpg', 'eventUri': 'fra-1089475', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458920419, 'relevance': 19}
{'uri': '2024-07-424884927', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:52:43', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:52:43Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:45:00Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.8901960849761963, 'url': 'https://siouxcityjournal.com/opinion/column/tyler-cowen-why-is-sweden-paying-grandparents-to-babysit-economist-says-its-worth-a-try/article_757b7bb1-1a92-52e8-b8d2-c25aa8c1051f.html', 'title': "Tyler Cowen: Why is Sweden paying grandparents to babysit? Economist says it's worth a try", 'body': 'As Sweden attends its first NATO summit as a member, FRANCE 24\'s Nadia Massih spoke to Tobias Billström, Swedish Foreign Minister.\n\nAt first glance, the policy sounds absurd, especially to many Americans: In Sweden, grandparents are now eligible for government subsidies to babysit their grandchildren.\n\nAs a proud grandparent, I would be willing to pay to babysit my grandkids. (I don\'t have to, but I would.) It would feel wrong to accept government money for my services.\n\nAnd even in the Swedish context, the program seems excessive. The country has long had first-rate and well-subsidized child-care facilities, which is another reason not to pay grandparents anything, and Sweden already has high levels of government spending and taxation. Is this additional benefit -- and expenditure -- really what it needs?\n\nBut sometimes even apparently foolish ideas have such compelling rationales that you begin to rethink whether they\'re foolish at all. These are often the cases that require the hardest thinking.\n\nPeople are also reading...\n\nSioux City woman claims $300,000 lottery prize City of Okoboji urges governor to increase releases from Iowa Great Lakes McCook Lake Association president: \'There\'s really no compensation\' for flood losses High school softball: Sioux City West snaps 12-year postseason drought with win Sioux City school district settles student injury lawsuit for $175,000 Woman arrested after chase exceeding 115 mph on I-29 Dan Greenwell to pay $52.7K in attorney fees to former Sioux City superintendent Paul Gausman Winnebago family finds meaning in missing, murdered pow wow High school baseball: McCarty leading successful, youthful MOC-FV squad into playoffs Sioux City Career Academy house sells for $150,000 to couple impacted by flooding Hinton man wins $100K in Iowa Lottery scratch game Trump injured but \'fine\' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Marriage licenses for Woodbury County for July 14, 2024 Portion of Outer Drive to temporarily close Iowa restaurant inspection update: Grimy blenders, mouse droppings and bad sushi\n\nIf you look at Sweden\'s policy closely, it adheres pretty well to some basic economic principles: namely, the notion of "Pareto improvements," which benefit all parties involved.\n\nStart with the fact that Swedish parents currently receive extensive paid leave on the birth of a child, and so it can be said they are already paid to look after their children. Whether you agree with that policy, it is longstanding and well-established. Take it as a given.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nNow imagine that you are an ambitious Swedish doctor or lawyer, climbing the career ladder, and are self-aware enough to realize you do not always have entirely the right degree of natural patience necessary for parenting. In that case, you might prefer to go back to work following the birth of your child. Under the status quo, you could not work and draw your normal salary and still get the full child-care benefit, even though some child benefits are paid automatically.\n\nSo the system has some potential inefficiency. You may stay at home just to get the money, even when an alternate arrangement might be better for everyone.\n\nNow add grandparents to this equation. If the grandparents can be paid to take care of your child, all of a sudden the extended family as a whole doesn\'t lose the money by having the parent go back to work. Instead, that money is transferred to the grandparents, so the work disincentive is diminished.\n\nAnd economists will tell you that the parents and grandparents can do their own settling up. If the grandparents are well-to-do, for instance, and eager to spend time with their grandkids, they might funnel some of that money back to the parents or the child, either directly or indirectly. In some cases, on net, the grandparents may not end up getting paid anything at all.\n\nIn essence, you can think of this policy as a model designed to maximize gains from trade.\n\nOne side effect is that, to the extent the parent who returns to work is a high earner, government tax revenue will increase. That will help pay for the policy, partially if not entirely.\n\nThe logic for this policy may hold all the more for single parents. In that case, the costs of giving up work may be even higher. That\'s because on a single income, climbing the career ladder and investing in future earnings will be all the more important. Enlisting aid from grandparents may also be more necessary, given the higher burdens on a single caregiver. A defender of the policy would cite these accommodative benefits, whereas a critic might allege they encourage single parenthood too much.\n\nMore broadly, fiscal conservatives might point out that the policy still costs some money upfront, while social conservatives might argue that it commodifies family relationships. The policy\'s supporters, on the other hand, might note that it can help some people get back to work and also make the grandparents happier. The children might benefit, too.\n\nI am still unsure if this policy is a good idea, though it has stronger virtues and benefits than I first thought. But I am all the more certain of one final lesson: Framing is everything. The very same policy, described in different terms, can sound eminently reasonable or badly out of whack. Keep that in mind next time you are tempted to render a quick verdict on someone else\'s idea.\n\nCowen is a Bloomberg columnist, professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog.\n\n___\n\nLove\n\n0\n\nFunny\n\n0\n\nWow\n\n0\n\nSad\n\n0\n\nAngry\n\n0\n\nCatch the latest in Opinion\n\nGet opinion pieces, letters and editorials sent directly to your inbox weekly!\n\nSign up!\n\n* I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy.', 'source': {'uri': 'siouxcityjournal.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Sioux City Journal'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/siouxcityjournal.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/57/757b7bb1-1a92-52e8-b8d2-c25aa8c1051f/6697b3d1124f0.preview.jpg?crop=1765%2C927%2C0%2C123&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': 'eng-9738640', 'sentiment': 0.1058823529411765, 'wgt': 458920363, 'relevance': 17}

Finance'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'reuters@ca.finance.yahoo.com', 'name': 'Reuters', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': True}], 'image': 'https://media.zenfs.com/en/reuters.com/37b999d5a7f03a3663364fbbee6fd3c3', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.2, 'wgt': 458920356, 'relevance': 103}
{'uri': '8230115665', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:51:08', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:51:08Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:50:13Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.8588235378265381, 'url': 'https://napavalleyregister.com/opinion/column/tyler-cowen-why-is-sweden-paying-grandparents-to-babysit-economist-says-its-worth-a-try/article_61209164-de6e-5f24-b434-d361becdfe52.html', 'title': "Tyler Cowen: Why is Sweden paying grandparents to babysit? Economist says it's worth a try", 'body': 'As Sweden attends its first NATO summit as a member, FRANCE 24\'s Nadia Massih spoke to Tobias Billström, Swedish Foreign Minister.\n\nAt first glance, the policy sounds absurd, especially to many Americans: In Sweden, grandparents are now eligible for government subsidies to babysit their grandchildren.\n\nAs a proud grandparent, I would be willing to pay to babysit my grandkids. (I don\'t have to, but I would.) It would feel wrong to accept government money for my services.\n\nAnd even in the Swedish context, the program seems excessive. The country has long had first-rate and well-subsidized child-care facilities, which is another reason not to pay grandparents anything, and Sweden already has high levels of government spending and taxation. Is this additional benefit -- and expenditure -- really what it needs?\n\nBut sometimes even apparently foolish ideas have such compelling rationales that you begin to rethink whether they\'re foolish at all. These are often the cases that require the hardest thinking.\n\nPeople are also reading... $400K in unpaid bills for grapes lead to slew of lawsuits against Napa winemaker Ryan Seacrest\'s Napa County home up for sale at $22 million Customers are raving about Moulin -- downtown Napa\'s new café and bakery Hank McGraw, onetime baseball phenom turned maverick and late-life Napan, dead at 81 Letter: Concerns about St. Helena Agritourism Initiative Mount Veeder vineyard owners sue own lawyers over money tied to Tubbs Fire Napa City Council to weigh selling land for downtown development Napa High School Athletic Hall of Fame: Cabral learned from sports how to battle adversity in life Why is that? Here\'s the lowdown on some Napa head-scratchers Napa County, Hoopes winery file closing arguments in legal clash St. Helena Cyclery to reopen in wake of Trek\'s closure Trump injured but \'fine\' after attempted assassination at rally; shooter and one attendee are dead Fight between Le Petit Elephant and Alta Heights neighbors gets personal Authorities hunt for clues, but motive of man who tried to assassinate Donald Trump remains elusive Defendants in Napa double murder delay pleas to Sept. 17\n\nIf you look at Sweden\'s policy closely, it adheres pretty well to some basic economic principles: namely, the notion of "Pareto improvements," which benefit all parties involved.\n\nStart with the fact that Swedish parents currently receive extensive paid leave on the birth of a child, and so it can be said they are already paid to look after their children. Whether you agree with that policy, it is longstanding and well-established. Take it as a given.\n\nListen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | Stitcher | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts\n\nNow imagine that you are an ambitious Swedish doctor or lawyer, climbing the career ladder, and are self-aware enough to realize you do not always have entirely the right degree of natural patience necessary for parenting. In that case, you might prefer to go back to work following the birth of your child. Under the status quo, you could not work and draw your normal salary and still get the full child-care benefit, even though some child benefits are paid automatically.\n\nSo the system has some potential inefficiency. You may stay at home just to get the money, even when an alternate arrangement might be better for everyone.\n\nNow add grandparents to this equation. If the grandparents can be paid to take care of your child, all of a sudden the extended family as a whole doesn\'t lose the money by having the parent go back to work. Instead, that money is transferred to the grandparents, so the work disincentive is diminished.\n\nAnd economists will tell you that the parents and grandparents can do their own settling up. If the grandparents are well-to-do, for instance, and eager to spend time with their grandkids, they might funnel some of that money back to the parents or the child, either directly or indirectly. In some cases, on net, the grandparents may not end up getting paid anything at all.\n\nIn essence, you can think of this policy as a model designed to maximize gains from trade.\n\nOne side effect is that, to the extent the parent who returns to work is a high earner, government tax revenue will increase. That will help pay for the policy, partially if not entirely.\n\nThe logic for this policy may hold all the more for single parents. In that case, the costs of giving up work may be even higher. That\'s because on a single income, climbing the career ladder and investing in future earnings will be all the more important. Enlisting aid from grandparents may also be more necessary, given the higher burdens on a single caregiver. A defender of the policy would cite these accommodative benefits, whereas a critic might allege they encourage single parenthood too much.\n\nMore broadly, fiscal conservatives might point out that the policy still costs some money upfront, while social conservatives might argue that it commodifies family relationships. The policy\'s supporters, on the other hand, might note that it can help some people get back to work and also make the grandparents happier. The children might benefit, too.\n\nI am still unsure if this policy is a good idea, though it has stronger virtues and benefits than I first thought. But I am all the more certain of one final lesson: Framing is everything. The very same policy, described in different terms, can sound eminently reasonable or badly out of whack. Keep that in mind next time you are tempted to render a quick verdict on someone else\'s idea.\n\nCowen is a Bloomberg columnist, professor of economics at George Mason University and host of the Marginal Revolution blog.\n\n___\n\nCatch the latest in Opinion\n\nGet opinion pieces, letters and editorials sent directly to your inbox weekly!\n\nSign up! * I understand and agree that registration on or use of this site constitutes agreement to its user agreement and privacy policy.', 'source': {'uri': 'napavalleyregister.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Napa Valley Register'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/napavalleyregister.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/6/12/61209164-de6e-5f24-b434-d361becdfe52/6697b3cf1f781.preview.jpg?crop=1765%2C927%2C0%2C123&resize=438%2C230&order=crop%2Cresize', 'eventUri': 'eng-9738640', 'sentiment': 0.05098039215686279, 'wgt': 458920268, 'relevance': 35}
