(NYSE:BAC) Securities ha aumentato l\'obiettivo di prezzo per le azioni Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) prima dell\'imminente pubblicazione degli utili del secondo trimestre della società tecnologica, indicando che i progressi nelle capacità di ricerca basate sull\'intelligenza artificiale e la stabilità del numero di dipendenti "dovrebbero portare a risultati migliori del previsto".\n\nGli analisti finanziari di Bank of America Securities prevedono un annuncio di utili favorevole per Alphabet, che sarà pubblicato il 23 luglio.\n\nPrima della pubblicazione della relazione, hanno corretto le stime di crescita dei ricavi di Search al 12% rispetto allo stesso trimestre dell\'anno scorso e prevedono che il fatturato del secondo trimestre e l\'utile per azione GAAP saranno rispettivamente di 70,9 miliardi di dollari e 1,91 dollari, superiori alle stime di consenso degli analisti finanziari.\n\nGli analisti basano le loro previsioni ottimistiche sull\'integrazione dell\'intelligenza artificiale che porterà a un maggiore utilizzo e a tassi più elevati di clic sugli annunci pubblicitari, su entrate consistenti da Search sostenute da condizioni economiche migliori e su notevoli guadagni da YouTube grazie alla monetizzazione della sua funzione di video brevi.\n\nSi prevede inoltre che il numero di dipendenti non cambierà rispetto allo stesso periodo dell\'anno precedente, che continueranno gli sforzi di ristrutturazione e riduzione dei costi, che le spese operative saranno di 22,7 miliardi di dollari e che i margini di profitto di base miglioreranno di 183 punti base, raggiungendo il 37,2%. {'uri': '8230109571', 'lang': 'hin', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:46:16', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:46:16Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:45:46Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.800000011920929, 'url': 'https://npg.news/auto-mobile/royal-enfield-new-guerrilla-450-bike-launched-in-india-price-features-specifications-details-1271004', 'title': 'Royal Enfield Guerrilla 450: रॉयल एनफील्ड की नई गुरिल्ला 450 बाइक भारत में हुई लॉन्च; जानिए कीमत, फीचर्स और स्पेसिफिकेशन की पूरी जानकारी...', 'body': 'Guerrilla 450 Bike: रॉयल एनफील्ड ने अपनी नई बाइक गुरिल्ला 450 को भारत में लॉन्च कर दिया है। इस बाइक की शुरुआती कीमत 2.39 लाख रुपये (एक्स-शोरूम) रखी गई है। गुरिल्ला 450 कंपनी की पहली 500cc से कम इंजन वाली स्ट्रीट नेकेड मोटरसाइकिल है। इस लॉन्च के साथ रॉयल एनफील्ड ने एक नए सेगमेंट में कदम रखा है। आइए जानते है लॉन्च हुई इस नई गुरिल्ला 450 बाइक के फीचर्स और स्पेसिफिकेशन्स के बारें में विस्तार से।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: डिजाइन और रंग\n\nगुरिल्ला 450 का डिजाइन मॉडर्न और पुराने जमाने की झलक मिलाकर बनाया गया है। इस बाइक में गोल LED हेडलाइट लगी है, जो इसे एक अलग लुक देती है। 11 लीटर की टेयरड्रॉप (बूंद) के आकार की फ्यूल टैंक और पतला पिछला हिस्सा इसे स्टाइलिश बनाते हैं। बाइक में एक पीस की सीट है और पीछे बैठने वाले के लिए पाइप का बना हुआ हैंडल दिया गया है।\n\nगुरिल्ला 450 के तीन अलग-अलग मॉडल हैं - फ्लैश, डैश और एनालॉग। हर मॉडल के अपने खास रंग हैं। फ्लैश मॉडल में ब्रावा ब्लू और येलो रिबन रंग मिलता है। डैश मॉडल में गोल्ड डिप और प्लाया ब्लैक रंग है। उसी तरह एनालॉग मॉडल में स्मोक और प्लाया ब्लैक रंग मिलता है।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: इंजन और परफॉर्मेंस\n\nगुरिल्ला 450 में 452cc का एक सिलिंडर वाला इंजन लगा है। यह इंजन 8,000rpm पर 39.50bhp की ताकत देता है और 5,500rpm पर 40Nm का टॉर्क पैदा करता है। इस इंजन के साथ 6 स्पीड का गियरबॉक्स जोड़ा गया है। यह सेटअप बाइक को अच्छी स्पीड और पिकअप देता है।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: चेसिस और सस्पेंशन\n\nबाइक का ढांचा स्टील के पाइप से बना है, जिसमें इंजन को मजबूती देने वाले हिस्से की तरह इस्तेमाल किया गया है। सस्पेंशन में आगे 140mm चलने वाला 43mm का टेलीस्कोपिक फोर्क है और पीछे 150mm चलने वाला प्रीलोड एडजस्ट होने वाला मोनोशॉक है। बाइक के 17-इंच के पहियों पर आगे 120 की चौड़ाई और पीछे 160 की चौड़ाई वाले सीट ग्रिप XL टायर लगे हैं।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: ब्रेक और सुरक्षा\n\nब्रेक लगाने के लिए आगे 310mm की डिस्क (दो पिस्टन वाले कैलिपर के साथ) और पीछे 270mm की डिस्क (एक पिस्टन वाले कैलिपर के साथ) दी गई है। दोनों पहियों पर ABS स्टैंडर्ड है, जो बाइक को रोकने में मदद करता है और सुरक्षा बढ़ाता है।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: डाइमेंशन और वजन\n\nगुरिल्ला 450 का व्हीलबेस 1440mm है, जो इसे स्थिर बनाता है। बाइक की जमीन से ऊंचाई 169mm है, जो इसे ज्यादातर सड़कों पर आसानी से चलाने की सुविधा देती है। बाइक का वजन 185kg है, जो इसी तरह की दूसरी बाइकों से थोड़ा ज्यादा है।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: फीचर्स और टेक्नोलॉजी\n\nफीचर्स की बात करें तो इस बाइक में सभी लाइट्स LED की हैं। सबसे महंगे मॉडल में रंगीन TFT स्क्रीन, ब्लूटूथ से जुड़ने की सुविधा और Google के मैप पर चलने वाला नेविगेशन मिलता है। सबसे सस्ते मॉडल में पुराने और नए जमाने का मिला-जुला मीटर है, जिसमें अगर चाहें तो एक अलग से नेविगेशन की स्क्रीन जोड़ सकते हैं।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450: वेरिएंट और कीमतें\n\nगुरिल्ला 450 के तीनों मॉडल की कीमत अलग-अलग है। सबसे सस्ता एनालॉग मॉडल 2.39 लाख रुपये का है, बीच वाला डैश मॉडल 2.49 लाख रुपये का है, और सबसे महंगा फ्लैश मॉडल 2.54 लाख रुपये का है। ये सभी कीमतें शोरूम की हैं।\n\nरॉयल एनफील्ड गुरिल्ला 450 बाइक का मुकाबला\n\nभारत में गुरिल्ला 450 का मुकाबला कई दूसरी बाइकों से होगा। इनमें ट्रायम्फ स्पीड 400, हुस्क्वर्ना स्वार्टपिलेन 401, हार्ले-डेविडसन X440 और हीरो मैवरिक 440 शामिल हैं। ये सभी बाइकें इसी रेंज और तरह की हैं।', 'source': {'uri': 'npg.news', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'npg.news'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'gopal_rao@npg.news', 'name': 'Gopal Rao', {'uri': '2024-07-424877015', 'lang': 'fra', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:46:13', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:46:13Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:31:02Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://fr.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/bank-of-america-releve-lobjectif-de-cours-de-laction-alphabet-evoquant-les-progres-des-capacites-de-recherche-de-lintelligence-artificielle-432SI-2485698', 'title': "Bank of America relève l'objectif de cours de l'action Alphabet, évoquant les progrès des capacités de recherche de l'intelligence artificielle Par Investing.com", 'body': 'Bank of America Securities a relevé son objectif de cours pour les actions Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) avant l\'annonce des résultats du deuxième trimestre de la société. Ils ont mentionné que les améliorations des capacités de recherche basées sur l\'intelligence artificielle et la stabilité du nombre d\'employés devraient "contribuer aux gains financiers".\n\nLes analystes de Bank of America Securities prévoient une annonce de résultats favorable pour Alphabet, qui devrait être publiée le 23 juillet.\n\nAvant l\'annonce, ils ont ajusté leurs prévisions de croissance du chiffre d\'affaires de la recherche à 12 % par rapport à la même période de l\'année dernière et estiment le chiffre d\'affaires du deuxième trimestre et le bénéfice par action GAAP à 70,9 milliards de dollars et 1,91 dollar, respectivement. Ces chiffres sont supérieurs à la moyenne des prévisions des analystes du marché.\n\nLes analystes fondent leurs prévisions optimistes sur l\'intégration de l\'IA, qui se traduit par une augmentation de l\'engagement des utilisateurs et des taux de clics publicitaires, sur un chiffre d\'affaires constant dans le secteur de la recherche, soutenu par des conditions économiques favorables, et sur les bons résultats financiers de YouTube, grâce à l\'introduction de revenus provenant de fonctions vidéo courtes.\n\nIls prévoient également que le nombre d\'employés restera inchangé par rapport à l\'année précédente, que les coûts seront réduits grâce à une restructuration organisationnelle, que les dépenses d\'exploitation s\'élèveront à 22,7 milliards de dollars et que les marges bénéficiaires de base augmenteront de 183 points de base pour s\'établir à 37,2 %. En outre, ils s\'attendent à ce que l\'augmentation des autres revenus ait un effet positif sur le bénéfice par action.\n\n"Nous maintenons un point de vue positif sur l\'expansion des intégrations de l\'IA au sein des plateformes de Google et pensons qu\'une mise en œuvre plus large des résumés de l\'IA conduira à une augmentation de l\'activité dans l\'activité principale de recherche", ont souligné les analystes de Bank of America Securities.\n\n"Alors que l\'adoption de l\'IA représente un défi concurrentiel important à long terme, dans l\'immédiat, nous prévoyons que le principal enseignement du deuxième trimestre sera les avantages financiers découlant de l\'amélioration de la génération de revenus basée sur l\'IA."\n\nEn outre, un contrôle délibéré des coûts devrait conduire à une augmentation des marges bénéficiaires par rapport à l\'année précédente en 2024, ce qui pourrait se traduire par une hausse du bénéfice par action.\n\nSe référant à une augmentation de la valorisation du marché en raison de la baisse des taux d\'intérêt, les analystes ont relevé leur objectif de prix de 200 à 206 dollars.\n\nEn ce qui concerne l\'avenir, Bank of America Securities suggère que la seconde moitié de l\'année pourrait présenter plus de difficultés, avec une décélération potentielle de la croissance des revenus de Search en raison de comparaisons plus difficiles d\'une année sur l\'autre, de l\'introduction du produit de recherche d\'OpenAI et des résultats potentiels des procédures judiciaires du Département de la Justice.\n\nCet article a été produit et traduit avec l\'aide d\'AI et revu par un rédacteur. {'uri': '8230108502', 'lang': 'rus', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:45:29', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:45:29Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:45:05Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://ru.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/article-432SI-2457038', 'title': 'Bank of America повышает целевой уровень цен на акции Alphabet, ссылаясь на достижения в области искусственного интеллекта для поисковых функций От Investing.com', 'body': 'Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) Securities повысил ценовой ориентир по акциям Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) перед предстоящим объявлением прибыли за второй квартал, указав, что достижения в области искусственного интеллекта для поисковых функций и постоянное число сотрудников "как ожидается, будут способствовать финансовому росту".\n\nАналитики Bank of America Securities прогнозируют благоприятное объявление о прибыли Alphabet, которое планируется опубликовать 23 июля.\n\nПеред объявлением они скорректировали свои прогнозы по росту выручки Search до увеличения на 12 % по сравнению с аналогичным периодом прошлого года и прогнозируют выручку за второй квартал и прибыль по GAAP на акцию на уровне $70,9 млрд и $1,91 соответственно, что выше консенсус-оценок аналитиков.\n\nАналитики основывают свой оптимистичный прогноз на интеграции искусственного интеллекта, что приведет к росту использования и увеличению количества рекламных кликов, постоянных доходах от поиска, поддерживаемых более сильными экономическими условиями, и высоких доходах YouTube от монетизации функции Shorts.\n\nОни также прогнозируют отсутствие изменений в численности сотрудников по сравнению с предыдущим годом, постоянные усилия по реструктуризации с целью сокращения расходов, операционные расходы в размере 22,7 миллиарда долларов и увеличение маржи основной прибыли на 183 базисных пункта до 37,2 %. Кроме того, ожидается, что увеличение прочих источников дохода будет способствовать росту прибыли на акцию.\n\n"Мы сохраняем позитивный взгляд на расширение интеграции ИИ в платформы Google и считаем, что более широкое внедрение сводок ИИ приведет к росту активности в основном поисковом бизнесе", - подчеркивают аналитики Bank of America Securities.\n\n"Хотя использование искусственного интеллекта представляет собой серьезную конкурентную проблему в долгосрочной перспективе, мы считаем, что в краткосрочной перспективе финансовая выгода от улучшения монетизации с помощью искусственного интеллекта станет важным результатом второго квартала".\n\nКроме того, ожидается, что целенаправленный контроль расходов приведет к росту прибыли в годовом исчислении в 2024 году, что может увеличить прибыль на акцию.\n\nСсылаясь на рост рыночной оценки в связи со снижением процентных ставок, аналитики Bank of America Securities повысили ценовой ориентир до $206 с $200.\n\nЗаглядывая в будущее, Bank of America Securities отметил, что во второй половине года может возникнуть больше трудностей, поскольку темпы роста доходов от поисковых систем замедлятся из-за более сложных сравнений между годами, внедрения поискового продукта OpenAI и решений по судебным разбирательствам с Министерством юстиции.\n\nЭта статья была подготовлена и переведена при содействии AI и проверена редактором. {'uri': '8230101748', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:42:03', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:42:03Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:40:49Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://conservativeangle.com/futures-slide-as-global-tech-stocks-tumble-on-fresh-china-chip-trade-crackdown/', 'title': 'Futures Slide As Global Tech Stocks Tumble On Fresh China Chip Trade Crackdown - Conservative Angle', 'body': 'US equity futures slide with tech dragging down S&P and Nasdaq futures as both Semis and Mag7 are being sold pre-mkt with ASML -6% on a Bloomberg report the Biden administration is considering using the most severe restrictions available on companies like Tokyo Electron and European chip giant ASML (which tumbled to the lowest since early June), if companies continue to give China access to advanced semiconductor technology. As of 7:45am ET, S&P futures are down 1% and Nasdaq 100 futs tumble 1.4% with tech giants such as AAPL, NVDA, TSLA, AMD, MU, AVGO, MSFT, AMAT all down 1.4% - 4%. Meanwhile, the great rotation continues for another day with Russell futs positive. The yield curve is twisting flatter as 10-year Treasury yields rose while the dollar weakened and the yen jumps, sending the USDJPY lower as much as 200 pips to just above 156. Commodities are lower with Energy/Metals in the red though Ags are strong and WTI is flat. Today\'s macro data focus is on Housing data, Industrial Production, and the Fed\'s Beige Book. There are two Fed speakers and the 20Y bond auction which JPM rates strategist believe will require a concession.\n\nIn premarket trading, Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, Broadcom and other chipmakers lost more than 3% with Dutch chip giant ASML Holding plunging 7.5%, the most since 2022, even after the Dutch company reported strong orders in the second quarter, after Bloomberg reported that the Biden administration has told allies that it\'s considering using the most severe trade restrictions available if companies continue giving China access to advanced chip technology. Nvidia is down 4%. Here are other notable premarket movers:\n\nThe Biden administration is considering using the most severe trade restrictions available if companies including ASML continue to give China access to advanced semiconductor technology, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday. Meanwhile, an anti-China stance is also at the top of the agenda for Republican nominee Donald Trump who in an interview with Bloomberg questioned whether the US has a duty to defend Taiwan, a major chipmaking hub.\n\n"Regardless of whether it\'s a Democrat or Republican victory, there will always be a negative push toward China," John Taylor, director of global multisector strategies at AllianceBernstein, said in an interview with Bloomberg TV. "One is more brazen and the other is more behind the scenes but the outcome is essentially the same."\n\nThe move in stocks represents a small pullback after a stellar run of gains, fueled by soft inflation data and optimism that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates. The S&P 500 closed at another all-time high on Tuesday, and in only five days, the Russell 2000 jumped almost 12% -- hitting the most-overbought level since 2017.\n\n"We had gotten a little too frothy," said Tim Graf, head of EMEA macro strategy at State Street Global Markets. "Investors are underweight smalls, hugely overweight large caps and rotating a bit."\n\nEuropean stocks slumped for a third day as the start of the second-quarter earnings season failed to revive investor optimism and trade tensions between the US and China over semiconductors weighed on sentiment. The Stoxx Europe 600 fell 0.8% and was trading at session lows as technology stocks led the drop, with ASML Holding NV slumping as much as 7.7% after Bloomberg News reported that the Biden administration is mulling more severe measures to restrict the company\'s exports to China. ASM International and BE Semiconductors also fell more than 2.5%. Adidas AG gained 5% after raising its annual profit target for the second time in three months. Roche Holding AG jumped on promising early-stage study results for a weight-loss pill. Here are the most notable European movers:\n\nEarlier, Asian stocks rose, on course to snap a three-day losing streak, as global bets on Federal Reserve rate cuts increased while the market awaited more details from a key Chinese policy meeting. The MSCI Asia Pacific Index rose as much as 0.6%, with health-care and industrials the biggest boosts as tech stocks declined. Benchmarks climbed in Australia and New Zealand, while equities fell in South Korea and Taiwan and were mixed in Japan. Stocks fluctuated in Hong Kong and mainland China as sentiment remained fragile amid tougher rhetoric from the Biden administration and Trump\'s campaign. Traders are focusing on the Third Plenum ending Thursday, in which top leaders will unveil the long-term development agenda for the world\'s second-largest economy. Asian equity market performance is "a mixed bag," said Homin Lee, senior macro strategist at Lombard Odier Singapore. "Investors are in a waiting mode ahead of China\'s Third Plenum and also the conclusion of the Republican National Convention where Trump could provide more concrete details on his governing agenda."\n\nIn FX, the dollar fell as traders dissected Donald Trump\'s views on FX; the pound topped $1.30 as traders pared bets on an interest-rate cut in August after stickier-than-expected inflation data. The yen rallied 1% against the dollar, reducing the need for Japanese authorities to step into the market again. In his interview, Trump also said the strength of the dollar has been hurting the competitiveness of US exports and pointing to the weakness of yen and yuan; that\'s raised some speculation among strategists that he might adopt policies to reduce the value of the greenback if he takes office. Both currencies rose, with the yen climbing to 156.46 versus the greenback, outperforming major currencies, while the offshore Chinese renminbi broke through the 50 day moving average to 7.2640 per dollar.\n\n"The one thing that China and Japan and other Asian currencies are worried about is getting a tariff target on their back," Mark McCormick, global head of currency and emerging market strategy at TD Bank, said in an interview with Bloomberg TV. "These currencies should be stronger."\n\nIn rates, treasuries bear-flatten as front-end yields rise around 4bp on the day with long-end little changed vs Tuesday\'s close. The Treasury yield curve extends Tuesday\'s flattening move, tightening 2s10s and 5s30s spreads by ~3bp. The 10-year TSY yield is around 4.17% is ~2bp higher on the day with UK 10-year cheaper by an additional 1.5bp after UK inflation came in hotter than expected. Gilts lag slightly after UK inflation data pointed to stubborn underlying price pressures and swaps traders priced in less monetary easing by the Bank of England. With higher front-end yields, some Fed easing premium leaves the market, though around 62bp by December remains priced in vs 65bp at Tuesday\'s close. Treasury coupon issuance resumes with $13b 20-year reopening at 1pm; WI 20-year yield at ~4.475% is ~2bp cheaper than last month\'s auction.\n\nIn commodities, crude futures were steady. Spot gold was little changed at $2,471/oz. Bitcoin climbed above $65,000.\n\nLooking at today\'s calendar, US economic data slate includes June housing starts (8:30am) and industrial production (9:15am). Fed members scheduled to speak include Barkin (9am) and Waller (9:35am). Fed releases latest Beige book at 2pm.\n\nA more detailed look at global markets courtesy of Newsquawk\n\nAPAC stocks were mixed despite the positive handover from Wall St where the S&P 500 and DJIA extended to fresh record highs following better-than-expected Retail Sales data, as China trade frictions and tariff threats clouded over Asia-Pac sentiment. ASX 200 gained with notable strength in gold-related stocks after the precious metal rose to a fresh record level, while the mining sector is positive but with upside capped amid indecision in BHP despite posting better-than-expected quarterly iron ore output. Nikkei 225 gradually reversed its initial advances with trade restrained by a lack of drivers and a quiet calendar aside from the monthly Reuters Tankan survey which showed an improvement in large manufacturers\' sentiment. Hang Seng and Shanghai Comp. were lacklustre amid tariff fears and trade frictions after Trump suggested 60%-100% tariffs on China, while the Biden administration is to issue a proposed rule on Chinese connected vehicles in about a month and warned allies of stricter trade rules in the China chip crackdown.\n\nTop Asian News\n\nEuropean bourses, Stoxx 600 (-0.5%) are almost entirely in the red, with sentiment hit after ASML (-6.6%) reported Q2 earnings, which has significantly weighed on the AEX (-0.9%) and more notably on the tech-heavy NQ. Updates from Maersk also factor, Co. noted that Red Sea disruptions have extended beyond far-east Europe. European sectors hold a strong negative bias, with Tech the clear underperformer, dragged down by ASML weakness. Consumer Products were initially the best-performing sector, propped up by post-earning gains in Adidas; but the sector is now flat. US Equity Futures (ES -0.7%, NQ -1.3%, RTY U/C) are entirely in the red, with clear underperformance in the tech-heavy NQ, in reaction to the ASML results; Nvidia (-3.1%), AMD (-3%), Broadcom (-3.1%). The RTY remains fairly resilient to the selling pressure.\n\nRotation is the key word in financial markets at the moment as the leadership of the US market has very rapidly shifted away from the Mag-7 to the wider market. This trend is only a few days old but so far its been done without any damage to the overall market as last night the S&P 500 (+0.64%) closed at its 38th all-time high of 2024 so far, having now risen for 10 of the last 11 sessions. A further rise today would be the first 11 out of 12 run since April 2019. Zooming out the S&P 500 has risen for 28 out of the last 37 weeks, the best such streak in 35 years.\n\nThe small-cap Russell 2000 (+3.50%) reached another two-and-a-half year high, with a massive +11.54% increase seen over the last week alone, its largest 5-day gain since April 2020. This strength has been spread across many sectors, including those that have struggled in recent times, with the KBW Regional Banking Index up +14.88% in the last week alone. In this period the Mag-7 is down -2.68% and was -0.43% lower yesterday. The YTD price outperformance of the Mag-7 versus the Russell 2000 has thus narrowed from nearly 50pp a week ago (+49% vs 0% respectively) to about 33pp now (+45% vs +12%).\n\nThe equal-weighted S&P 500 (+1.74%) also closed at an all-time high last night, surpassing its previous record back in March and marking its best 5-day outperformance over the market-cap weighted S&P 500 since 2020. Our CoTD on Friday (link here) looked at how unloved sectors can rocket once a rotation away from tech occurs and yesterday\'s (link here) looked at the stretched positioning for Mega Cap Growth and Tech versus the rest and plotted this against earnings growth. Our strategists think the earnings gap will narrow sharply into year-end which will influence the respective positioning. So rotation is indeed the word du jour. Yesterday did show that overall markets have to be slightly careful of the rotation trade as heavyweights Nvidia (-1.62%), Microsoft (-0.98%), Meta (-1.28%) and Alphabet (-1.40%) were all notably lower. For now having 446 S&P 500 advancers on the session meant that these losses could be absorbed.\n\nFor the most part, sentiment was supported by the retail sales data, which showed headline retail sales were unchanged in June (vs. -0.3% expected). The details were also pretty good, as the measure excluding autos had its fastest growth in 3 months at +0.4% (vs. +0.1% expected), and there were positive revisions to the May number as well. In turn, that led to growing optimism about the Q2 GDP release next week, and the Atlanta Fed\'s GDPNow estimate now sees growth coming in at an annualised rate of +2.5%. It got as low as +1.5% on July 3.\n\nAdmittedly, that strength in retail sales did work against the other main theme at the moment, which is the growing anticipation about rate cuts. But ultimately, near-term expectations for rate cuts didn\'t shift too much, as the positive retail sales data wasn\'t enough to push back against the other data over recent weeks, and futures are still fully pricing in a rate cut by the Fed\'s September meeting. Those expectations for rate cuts got some support yesterday from commodity price moves, with Brent crude oil prices (-1.28%) falling back to a one-month low of $83.76/bbl. In addition, Canada\'s CPI also surprised on the downside in June, coming in at +2.7% (vs. +2.8% expected).\n\nAltogether a lower yield narrative dominated, as 1 0yr US yields (-7.1bps to 4.16%) closed at their lowest level in 4 months with a temporary 4bps intra-day sell-off after retail sales not holding. And 2yr yields fell to a 5-month low (-4.1bps to 4.42%). The rally in Treasuries was helped along by dovish-leaning comments from Fed Governor Kugler who said that "continued rebalancing [in the labour market] suggests that inflation will continue to move down toward our 2% target". Meanwhile, with the strong US data doing little to damage rate cut hopes, gold prices (+1.19%) also closed at an all-time nominal high of $2,459/oz.\n\nOvernight a Bloomberg interview with Trump has come out with the former President highlighting that he would allow Powell to serve out his term as Fed Chair (until 2026) and that he believes tariffs are great economically and great as a negotiating tool with other countries.\n\nBack to markets and sovereign bonds also rallied in Europe yesterday, with attention now increasingly shifting to the ECB\'s decision tomorrow, and yields on 10yr bunds (-4.6bps), OATs (-3.2bps) and BTPs (-4.7bps) all fell back. However, there were fresh losses for European equities, with the STOXX 600 (-0.28%), the DAX (-0.39%) and the CAC 40 (-0.69%) all losing ground for a second day running.\n\nThis morning in Asia equity markets are mostly trading lower with the Shanghai Composite (-0.45%), the CSI (-0.20%) and the Hang Seng (-0.10%) all dipping. Elsewhere, the KOSPI (-0.22%) is also losing ground while the Nikkei (+0.08%) is trading just above flat. Meanwhile, the S&P/ASX 200 (+0.98%) is notably outperforming reaching an all-time high. S&P 500 (-0.13%) and NASDAQ 100 (-0.26%) futures are pausing for breath in Asia hours and Treasury yields have edged up a bit.\n\nEarly morning data showed that New Zealand\'s Q2 CPI rose +3.3% y/y against +3.4% expected and slowing from the prior quarter\'s +4.0%.\n\nLooking forward, attention will be on the UK today, as the CPI release is coming out shortly after we go to press. That\'s an important one for the Bank of England, as current market pricing is saying there\'s a 49% chance of a rate cut at the next meeting, so this could well be an important piece of data in tilting that balance either way. Elsewhere in the UK, we\'ve also got the State Opening of Parliament happening today, where the King\'s Speech will outline the new government\'s legislative agenda for the upcoming parliamentary session.\n\nOtherwise, the IMF updated their growth forecasts yesterday, which painted a broadly similar picture for the global economy relative to three months ago. For this year, they still see global growth at +3.2%, and the 2025 number was revised up a tenth to +3.3%. That said, there were some bigger moves at the country level, and several emerging markets saw decent upgrades. That included China, where growth in both 2024 and 2025 was revised up four-tenths, and they now forecast growth of +5.0% in 2024 and +4.5% in 2025. India\'s growth was also revised up two-tenths this year to +7.0%.\n\nFinally on yesterday\'s other data, the German ZEW survey came in a bit stronger than expected in July, with the current situation up to a one-year high of -68.9 (vs. -74.8 expected). However, the expectations component did fall to 41.8 (vs. 41.0 expected), which ended a run of 11 consecutive monthly gains. Meanwhile in the US, the NAHB\'s housing market index fell to a seven-month low of 42 in July (vs. 43 expected).\n\nTo the day ahead now, and data releases include the UK CPI print for June, US industrial production, capacity utilisation, housing starts and building permits for June. From central banks, we\'ll hear from the Fed\'s Barkin and Waller, and the Fed will also be releasing their Beige Book. {'uri': '2024-07-424873536', 'lang': 'fra', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:42:00', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:42:00Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T08:00:00Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': "https://www.latribune.ca/affaires/2024/07/17/lentrepreneur-qui-a-dit-non-a-amazon-3AIY4ZMVI5CAZDIYDHM5Q7JB6I/?utm_content=Template%20-%20Aujourd'hui%20-%20LA%20TRIBUNE%20-%20NEWDynamic%20-%20NewAds&utm_medium=email_action&utm_source=customer.io&utm_campaign=Template%20Infolettre%20Aujourd'hui%20-%20La%20Tribune&utm_term=Mercredi%2017%20juil.%202024", 'title': "L'entrepreneur qui a dit non à Amazon", 'body': 'L\'homme d\'affaires Luc Vincent, dont les produits capillaires font fureur bien au-delà de nos frontières, continue de tenir tête à Amazon, malgré les offres répétées pour qu\'il rejoigne la "belle grande famille" du géant américain. "Moi, je veux pouvoir dire que je suis 100 % Québécois. Je ne veux pas perdre mon identité."\n\nCoiffeur de la Montérégie, Luc Vincent a créé sa propre gamme de produits qu\'il vend aujourd\'hui à travers le monde, notamment en Europe et aux États-Unis.\n\nIl a commencé à se faire remarquer en participant à des concours de coiffure et en collaborant à des émissions de télé et de radio. Il a ensuite développé son académie de coiffure et sa propre gamme de produits, en compagnie de sa conjointe. C\'est au début de la pandémie que la croissance de son entreprise a explosé.\n\nAvec la vente en ligne, son chiffre d\'affaires ne se comptait plus en milliers de dollars, mais en millions. C\'est à partir de ce moment qu\'Amazon a commencé à lui faire de l\'œil.\n\n"Je pense qu\'ils ont vu que mes produits étaient beaucoup recherchés sur Internet, raconte-t-il. J\'ai commencé à avoir des appels, pour que je vende mes produits sur leur plateforme. Mais je n\'ai pas embarqué, je voulais montrer qu\'au Québec, c\'était possible de se passer d\'Amazon."\n\nLes offres se sont répétées. Avec de plus en plus d\'insistance.\n\n"On m\'appelait tous les mois. On me demandait: \'Luc, quand rejoins-tu enfin la belle grande famille d\'Amazon?\'. On prenait des nouvelles de mon chien, de ma femme. On me promettait un chiffre d\'affaires qui allait se multiplier. À un moment donné, j\'ai dû être clair que je ne voulais pas."\n\n-- Luc Vincent\n\nDurant l\'opération charme, Luc Vincent a constaté que ce n\'était plus son site de vente en ligne qui arrivait en premier, lorsqu\'on écrivait son nom dans un moteur de recherche. C\'était celui d\'Amazon.\n\n"Je ne comprenais pas trop, puisque je n\'avais aucun produit en vente sur la plateforme américaine", se souvient-il.\n\nRapidement, il a constaté que c\'était plutôt son livre Pas de quoi s\'arracher les cheveux, publié aux éditions La Presse une dizaine d\'années plus tôt, qui était désormais en vente sur Amazon.\n\n" Ça, je n\'avais pas de contrôle là-dessus", dit-il.\n\nÀ partir de ce livre en vente sur Amazon, les internautes pouvaient cliquer sur un hyperlien, qui les envoyait sur d\'autres pages de la plateforme offrant des produits capillaires semblables, mais vendus par des compétiteurs de Luc Vincent.\n\n"Il a fallu que je mette de l\'argent pour racheter mon nom, pour que ce soit mon site qui sorte en premier lorsque les gens cherchaient mes produits sur le web", explique M. Vincent, qui dit avoir investi quelques dizaines de milliers de dollars pour le faire auprès de Google.\n\nEncore aujourd\'hui, en tapant le nom de l\'entrepreneur sur le moteur de recherche, un lien commandité d\'Amazon fait la passerelle vers son livre.\n\nL\'irréductible Gaulois\n\nMais pourquoi refuser de vendre ses produits sur la plus importante plateforme de vente en ligne du monde?\n\n"Je préfère garder mon identité. J\'engage des gens ici et mes produits sont pratiquement 100 % québécois, du bouchon aux étiquettes. C\'est certain que c\'est alléchant, les promesses sont exceptionnelles, surtout pour augmenter notre chiffre d\'affaires, qu\'on promet de doubler, de tripler. Mais j\'ai été en mesure de le faire en gardant le contrôle sur ma marque", explique Luc Vincent.\n\nS\'engager dans les rangs d\'Amazon peut également entraîner des risques, a constaté l\'homme d\'affaires québécois.\n\n"Premièrement, on doit livrer nos palettes dans les entrepôts d\'Amazon, payer pour l\'entreposage, la manutention. Et si ça ne fonctionne pas aussi bien qu\'on le pensait, on nous renvoie le tout, à nos frais", explique-t-il.\n\nRécemment, une nouvelle proposition est arrivée sur la table de Luc Vincent, par une voie détournée. "Là, il s\'agit d\'une agence qui fait affaire avec la plateforme. On vend nos produits à cette agence, qui s\'occupe ensuite de tout le reste. Mais encore une fois, ça ne nous appartient plus tout à fait."\n\nAujourd\'hui, Luc Vincent est un peu perçu comme l\'irréductible Gaulois. Il est "celui qui n\'est pas sur Amazon".\n\n"Ça crée un petit engouement, surtout aux États-Unis. On me dit: \'hein, tu n\'es pas sur Amazon?\'. Je pense que je m\'en sors gagnant."\n\n-- Luc Vincent\n\nAmazon n\'a pas répondu à nos questions, portant sur les méthodes utilisées afin de recruter des entreprises sur sa plateforme.', 'source': {'uri': 'latribune.ca', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'La Tribune'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://lescoopsdelinformation-latribune-prod.web.arc-cdn.net/resizer/D94fd8dIMQfliLWlabFoObKsILc=/657x0/filters:quality(70):format(url)/cloudfront-us-east-1.images.arcpublishing.com/lescoopsdelinformation/QKKGVMFV55FNVPUKWZGWT4D3QY.jpeg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458919720, 'relevance': 10}
{'uri': '8230101749', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:41:50', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:41:50Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:40:49Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://conservativeangle.com/irrational-exuberance-then-and-now/', 'title': 'Irrational Exuberance Then And Now - Conservative Angle', 'body': 'Authored by Michael Lebowitz via RealInvestmentAdvice.com,\n\nOn December 5, 1996, Chairman of the Fed Alan Greenspan offered that stock prices may be too high, thus risking a correction that could result in an economic fallout. He wondered out loud if the market had reached a state of "irrational exuberance."\n\nOver the past few months, we have seen the same term, irrational exuberance, used to describe the current state of the stock market. To gain perspective on the future, let\'s compare the market environment that prompted Greenspan\'s comments to today.\n\nClearly, sustained low inflation implies less uncertainty about the future, and lower risk premiums imply higher prices of stocks and other earning assets. We can see that in the inverse relationship exhibited by price/earnings ratios and the rate of inflation in the past. But how do we know when irrational exuberance has unduly escalated asset values, which then become subject to unexpected and prolonged contractions as they have in Japan over the past decade? And how do we factor that assessment into monetary policy? We as central bankers need not be concerned if a collapsing financial asset bubble does not threaten to impair the real economy, its production, jobs, and price stability. Indeed, the sharp stock market break of 1987 had few negative consequences for the economy. But we should not underestimate or become complacent about the complexity of the interactions of asset markets and the economy. Thus, evaluating shifts in balance sheets generally, and in asset prices particularly, must be an integral part of the development of monetary policy. -Alan Greenspan December 1996\n\nThe simple translation: Greenspan was apprehensive due to high stock valuations; therefore, a correction of stock prices could damage the economy. He didn\'t want to be "complacent about the complexity of the interactions of asset markets and the economy."\n\nLet\'s review a few graphs to appreciate Greenspan\'s point of view.\n\nIn just two years, between 1994 and the day Greenspan uttered irrational exuberance, the S&P 500 had risen nearly 60%. Furthermore, from the 1990 recession trough to his speech, the S&P had climbed almost 250%.\n\nThe economic recovery from the recession of 1990 kicked off the bull market. Further fueling the run were fabulous projections of how the budding World Wide Web, computers, and the powers of modern technology would result in outsized corporate profits and economic growth. Sound familiar?\n\nWith such lofty projections came immense speculation. Investors were willing to pay more for corporate sales and earnings due to higher growth prospects. In other words, valuations rose.\n\nThe first graph below shows the Shiller CAPE10 valuation stood at levels last seen in 1929 and were moderately higher than those at the peak of the Nifty Fifty Bubble. For more on the Nifty Fifty, check out our article Are The Magnificent Seven In A Bubble? Ask The Nifty Fifty.\n\nAnother valuation metric, Tobin\'s Q ratio, uses a company\'s assets\' market value and replacement value to determine if a stock is over or undervalued. A ratio greater than one means the market values the company more than the value of its assets. Therefore, a high reading implies expectations for above-average earnings growth. As shown, in 1996, the ratio was slightly higher than the Nifty Fifty Bubble peak but below the 1929 peak.\n\nGreenspan had ample reason to worry with higher stock prices and valuations at levels seen near the tops of the last two stock booms. His warning caused the market to stutter for a few weeks before continuing its climb higher. Between December 5, 1996, and the bull market peak three years later, in 2000, the S&P more than doubled, and its valuations far exceeded the lofty levels of 1996.\n\nKeep in mind that despite Greenspan\'s weariness of market conditions, he cut rates by 75 basis points in late 1998 over concerns related to the Long Term Capital Hedge Fund bankruptcy. His actions further fueled the market significantly higher.\n\nFrom the market peak in August of 2000 to its low in 2003, the S&P 500 erased a big chunk of the post "irrational exuberance" gains. Those highs would not be seen again until 2013.\n\nThe recent performance of the S&P 500 is like that of the mid to late 1990s. Similarly, current valuation metrics are at or above those Greenspan feared in 1996.\n\nToday\'s AI narrative mirrors the enthusiasm for the internet and technology forecasts of the mid- to late 1990s. Investors seem assured that AI will make the economy much more productive. Therefore, corporate profits will boom, and the economy will flourish. Those companies at the heart of AI, like Nvidia, Google, and Microsoft, will experience growth that dwarfs market averages. Or so we are told.\n\nWhile the AI narrative sounds excellent, reality and narratives are often quite different. Despite the internet and technology boom of the late 1990s and beyond, the economic and corporate earnings growth rate did not increase. In fact, as shown below, the economy grew at an average rate of nearly 3% from 1975 to 1999. Since then, the average growth rate has been closer to 2%.\n\nCorporate earnings have followed a similar path despite the internet\'s benefits.\n\nThe market will likely correct meaningfully, and valuations will normalize. This time is not different.\n\nHowever, the timing of a correction is far from known. Mr. Market doesn\'t care what you, we, or the Fed Chairman think of valuations and prices. The market is bigger than all of us and can have a mind of its own. High valuations, even if in already record territory, can go higher.\n\nThe market can stay irrational longer than you can stay solvent. John Maynard Keynes\n\nSome in the bearish camp advise taking our chips off the table and not trying to pick the top. That may be prescient. However, it may be years too early, like Greenspan\'s irrational exuberance advice.\n\nWalking the tightrope between irrational exuberance and reality is complex. Therefore, appreciate the market for what it is. This bull market has no known expiration date. Active management, using technical and fundamental analysis along with macroeconomic forecasting, is crucial to managing the potential risks and rewards that lie ahead.\n\nWe leave you with a contrarian thought. What if we are experiencing rational exuberance and AI is an economic game changer? What if current valuations aptly reflect enhanced economic growth? Such profits and wealth formation may allow us to service unproductive debts better. Accordingly, today\'s haunting macroeconomic issues may fade into a glorious future.\n\nNo one knows what the future holds. But, there are tools allowing us to maximize the upside better and limit the downside. With such potential returns and drawdowns lurking on the horizon, active management may likely prove to be the best way to manage your investments.', 'source': {'uri': 'conservativeangle.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Brigitte Gabriel'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://assets.zerohedge.com/s3fs-public/styles/inline_image_mobile/public/inline-images/SP-500-1900-1996-1024x683.jpg?itok=R52DWLGd', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': -0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458919710, 'relevance': 24}

{'uri': '2024-07-424871837', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:40:32', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:40:32Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:40:25Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.7019608020782471, 'url': 'https://www.esdelatino.com/microsoft-se-enfrenta-a-una-investigacion-antimonopolio-por-la-contratacion-masiva-de-inflection/', 'title': 'Microsoft se enfrenta a una investigación antimonopolio por la contratación masiva de Inflection', 'body': 'La investigación comenzará con una investigación de "fase 1" que durará 40 días. Después de esto, se decidirá si se necesita o no una "fase 2", es decir, una sonda completa.\n\nLa reciente contratación por parte de Microsoft de Mustafa Suleyman (cofundador de la startup de IA Inflection) y varios otros ex empleados que formaban parte del equipo central ha sido objeto de investigación.\n\nEl asunto ha sido remitido a la Autoridad de Mercados y Competencia de Gran Bretaña para una investigación inicial de fusión.\n\nEl martes, la agencia explicó la causa detrás de la investigación y dijo que dado que Microsoft ha contrató a una gran parte del personal de Inflectiones importante evaluar si esta medida puede considerarse una fusión según las leyes del Reino Unido.\n\nY si efectivamente se trata de una fusión, tienen que comprobar si se trata de obstaculizar la competencia en la industria de la IA.\n\nParece que Microsoft no está demasiado preocupado por la investigación. Un portavoz de la empresa dijo que es "Confía en que la contratación de talento fomenta la competencia y no debe tratarse como una fusión. "\n\nTambién agregaron que la empresa cooperar con las autoridades y proporcionarles toda la información que necesiten durante la investigación.\n\nMás sobre las contrataciones\n\nMicrosoft anunció las contrataciones en marzo. Suleyman fue nombrado vicepresidente ejecutivo y director ejecutivo de Microsoft AI, una unidad recién formada de la empresa que se centra en productos de IA.\n\nLas contrataciones no son las únicas razones por las que las autoridades están investigando. En marzo de este año, Microsoft también firmó un Acuerdo de 650 millones de dólares con Inflection eso le permitiría vender los productos de inteligencia artificial de Inflection a través de la plataforma Microsoft Azure.\n\nEl patrón es muy claro aquí. El gigante tecnológico es invertir fuertemente en empresas de IA lo que podría sugerir que está tratando de eliminar a sus principales competidores y incorporarlos a su propio equipo, esencialmente reduciendo la competencia. {'uri': '8230098298', 'lang': 'jpn', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '13:40:20', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T13:40:20Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T13:38:40Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://jp.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/article-432SI-809412', 'title': 'バンク・オブ・アメリカがアルファベット株の目標株価を引き上げ、人工知能による検索機能の進化に言及 執筆： Investing.com', 'body': 'バンク・オブ・アメリカ証券は、テクノロジー企業であるアルファベット（GOOGL）の第2四半期決算発表を前に、検索機能のAIの進歩と従業員数の安定が "業績向上につながる見込み "であるとして、アルファベット株の目標株価を引き上げた。\n\nバンク・オブ・アメリカ証券のアナリストは、7月23日に発表されるアルファベットの決算発表を好調と予測している。\n\n決算発表に先立ち、サーチの収益成長率予測を前年同期比12%増に調整し、第2四半期の収益は709億ドル、GAAPベースの1株当たり利益（EPS）は1.91ドルと、アナリストの平均予測を上回ると見積もっている。\n\nアナリストは、楽観的な見通しの理由として、AIの統合による利用拡大と広告クリック率の上昇、経済状況の改善に支えられた安定した検索収益、短編動画機能「ショーツ」の収益化によるYouTubeの顕著な成長を挙げている。\n\nまた、従業員数は前年と変わらず、コスト削減のための組織再編に取り組み、営業費用は227億ドル、コア利益率は183ベーシスポイント増の37.2％を見込んでいる。加えて、その他の利益の増加が1株当たり利益（EPS）の増加に寄与すると予想している。\n\nバンク・オブ・アメリカ証券のアナリストは、「われわれは、グーグルのサービスにおけるAIの利用拡大について引き続き好意的な見方をしており、AI要約の幅広い導入が主要検索サービスのアクティビティ増加に寄与すると考えている」と述べた。\n\n「AIの利用は競合他社にとって長期的な課題だが、短期的にはAIによる収益化で収益が増加することが第2四半期の重要なハイライトになると考えている。\n\nさらに、慎重に経費を管理することで、2024年には利益率が前年比で上昇し、ひいては1株当たり利益（EPS）を引き上げる可能性があると予測している。\n\n金利低下による市場評価の上昇により、バンク・オブ・アメリカ証券のアナリストは、アルファベット株の目標株価を200ドルから206ドルに引き上げた。\n\nバンク・オブ・アメリカ・セキュリティーズは将来を見据え、今年後半は前年同期比がより厳しくなるため検索収益の伸びが鈍化すること、OpenAIの検索製品導入、司法省（DOJ）との法的手続きによる潜在的な影響など、より複雑な状況が予想され、より困難な状況に陥る可能性があると言及している。\n\n本記事は、AIの協力を得て作成・翻訳され、編集者による校閲を受けています。詳細は利用規約をご覧ください。', 'source': {'uri': 'jp.investing.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Investing.com 日本'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://i-invdn-com.investing.com/news/LYNXMPEE3N0KS_L.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458919620, 'relevance': 28}
